cards.name: A Worthy Skull
cards.colourText: 'He killed well. He died well. Khorne shall savour this offering.' - Garrek Gorebeard
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy leader out of action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Blood for the Blood God!
cards.colourText: Bloodreavers do not care for subtle strategy. Theirs is the brutal force of an overwhelming charge.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if three or more of your fighters made a Charge action in this phase.

cards.name: Coward!
cards.colourText: To retreat is weakness, and the weak must be culled.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if an enemy fighter begins a Move action adjacent to one of your fighters and ends it adjacent to none of your fighters.

cards.name: Draw the Gaze of Khorne
cards.colourText: The Blood God marks well the names of those who commit great acts of slaughter in his name.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your warband takes two or more enemy fighters out of action in this phase.

cards.name: It Begins
cards.colourText: 'The first kill is the greatest. That first arc of hot blood through the air. The first scream of agony as your axe sinks home.' - Blooded Saek
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if at least one fighter from each warband is out of action.

cards.name: Khorne Cares Not
cards.colourText: Khorne cares not from whence the blood flows.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if five or more fighters are out of action.

cards.name: Khorne's Champion
cards.colourText: The weak fall, and only the mighty are left standing. Such is the will of Khorne.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if all fighters except one of your fighters are out of action.

cards.name: Let the Blood Flow
cards.colourText: All must wet their blade with the blood of the foe. To fail in this task is to invite the Blood God's wrath.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if three or more of your fighters made a successful Attack action in this phase.

cards.name: There is Only Slaughter
cards.colourText: 'What care we for worthless trinkets? Slaughter is all that matters.' - Garrek Gorebeard
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if no fighter is holding an objective.

cards.name: Blood Offering
cards.colourText: 'Witness my offering, Lord of Skulls, and send me worthy foes to butcher.'
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter. They suffer 1 damage. Roll two extra attack dice for their first Attack action in the next activation.

cards.name: Blood Rain
cards.colourText: When the blood rain comes, Khorne's faithful are masked by the profane deluge.
cards.rulesText: All Attack actions in the next activation have the characteristic, even if they would normally have the characteristic.

cards.name: Boon of Khorne
cards.colourText: Khorne offers great rewards to those who walk his bloody path.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that takes an enemy fighter out of action. Remove all wound tokens from one friendly fighter.

cards.name: Desecrate
cards.colourText: With each shadeglass artefact profaned with the blood of the fallen, the fury of Khorne's realm seeps into the Mirrored City.
cards.rulesText: Remove one objective that you hold from the battlefield.

cards.name: Final Blow
cards.colourText: 'Those cannibal madmen don't die easy. I've seen one strike the head from his killer even as his guts spilled out.'
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an enemy fighter's Attack action that takes an adjacent friendly fighter out of action. Their attacker suffers 1 damage.

cards.name: Fuelled by Slaughter
cards.colourText: The sight of a warrior torn asunder only serves to stoke a Bloodreaver's battle-lust.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action or ploy that takes a fighter out of action. A friendly fighter can make an Attack action.

cards.name: Insensate
cards.colourText: Bloodreavers fight on despite grievous wounds, lost to their exultant fury.
cards.rulesText: The first friendly fighter who suffers any amount of damage in the next activation only suffers one damage.

cards.name: Khorne Calls
cards.colourText: The Blood God's gaze falls upon you. Do not fail him.
cards.rulesText: Roll one extra attack dice for your first Attack action in the next activation.

cards.name: Rebirth in Blood
cards.colourText: 'The blood is death. The blood is life. The blood must flow.'
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action or ploy that takes your last surviving fighter out of action. Roll a defence dice. If you roll a or remove all wound tokens from them, and place them on a starting hex in your territory.

cards.name: Skulls for the Skull Throne!
cards.colourText: The path to ascension must be paved with worthy skulls.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that takes an enemy fighter out of action. Draw up to two power cards.

cards.name: Berserk Charge
cards.colourText: 'Yhaaaaarrraaaaargh!' - Blooded Saek
cards.rulesText: Both and symbols are successes when this fighter makes a Charge action.

cards.name: Bloodslick
cards.colourText: His flesh slick with gore, Garrek slips from the grasp of his foes.
cards.rulesText: +1 Defence

cards.name: Deadly Spin
cards.colourText: 'At Dredgard Ridge I opened the throats of three duardin with a single swing.' - Targor
cards.rulesText: Targets all adjacent enemy fighters - roll for each.

cards.name: Ever-Advancing
cards.colourText: Garrek is a whirlwind of unsuppressed violence, fighting to a drumbeat only the blood-maddened can hear.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: When this fighter could be driven back during an Attack action (whether or not your opponent chooses to do so), you can instead push them one hex.

cards.name: Frenzy
cards.colourText: 'Into them you dogs! The last to spill blood gets my axe in their belly!' - Garrek Gorebeard
cards.rulesText: Roll an extra attack dice when this fighter makes a Charge action.

cards.name: Grisly Trophy
cards.colourText: 'That's a pretty face. I think I'll flay it and hang it from my belt.' - Garrek Gorebeard
cards.rulesText: When this fighter takes an enemy fighter out of action, gain 1 additional glory point.

cards.name: Terrifying Howl
cards.colourText: Karsus' frenzied screams of battle-lust are enough to shake the will of even the sturdiest foe.
cards.rulesText: Action: Push each adjacent enemy fighter one hex.

cards.name: Unstoppable Charge
cards.colourText: When the faithful of Khorne set their eyes upon their prey, nothing in the realms can stand in their path.
cards.rulesText: When this fighter makes a Charge action they can move through other fighters, but their move must end in an empty hex.

cards.name: Whirlwind of Death
cards.colourText: 'To feel flesh tear beneath your axe and blood wash across your face, that's when you understand the true glory of Khorne.' - Karsus the Chained
cards.rulesText: +1 Damage to all Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2

cards.name: Wicked Blade
cards.colourText: 'They all keep their eyes on the axe. They can't help it. That's when you sink the cutter in deep.' - Arnulf
cards.rulesText: If you roll at least one this Attack action has Cleave.

cards.name: Awe-inspiring
cards.colourText: The sheer imposing majesty of a Stormcast Eternal in battle is enough to break the will of many foes.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your warband has taken two or more fighters out of action in this phase.

cards.name: Cleanse
cards.colourText: All manner of corrupt and malicious souls haunt the shadowed streets of Shadespire. They shall all fall before the might of Sigmar.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you hold all the objectives in enemy territory.

cards.name: Consecrated Area
cards.colourText: 'This is hallowed land, heathen. Take one step further and feel the wrath of Sigmar.'
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if there are no enemy fighters adjacent to your fighters.

cards.name: Eternals
cards.colourText: The Stormcast Eternals are immortal warriors, forged to fight an unending war against the forces of darkness.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if none of your fighters are out of action.

cards.name: Immovable Object
cards.colourText: 'I claim this shard in the name of the God-King. Flee, while you still have use of your limbs.' - Angharad Brightshield
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if the same friendly fighter has held the same objective at the end of two consecutive action phases.

cards.name: Lightning Strikes
cards.colourText: Sigmar's storm will break upon the faithless with shattering force.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if an enemy fighter is taken out of action by a Charge action made by one of your fighters.

cards.name: Seize Ground
cards.colourText: Steelheart's band have sworn to end the curse of Shadespire and escape their nightmarish prison. Woe to those who stand in their way.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you hold an objective in enemy territory.

cards.name: Sigmar's Bulwark
cards.colourText: To fight the Stormcast Eternals is to break upon a wall of blessed sigmarite.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if none of your fighters suffered any damage in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Slayers of Tyrants
cards.colourText: 'With their leader slain, these wretches will scatter to the shadows.' - Obryn the Bold
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy leader out of action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Heroic Guard
cards.colourText: A Stormcast Eternal is a living wall of sigmarite, impervious and unyielding.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter and put them on Guard.

cards.name: Peal of Thunder
cards.colourText: Even in the nightmare of the Mirrored City, the fury of Sigmar's storm rings clear.
cards.rulesText: Choose an enemy fighter and push them one hex in any direction.

cards.name: Righteous Zeal
cards.colourText: The Hammers of Sigmar were the first of Sigmar's mighty Stormhosts. Theirs is the power of the storm.
cards.rulesText: +1 Damage to the first Attack action with a Range of 1 or 2 in the next activation

cards.name: Sigmarite Wall
cards.colourText: Few indeed are the foes who can breach a Liberator shield wall.
cards.rulesText: Choose two adjacent friendly fighters and put them on Guard.

cards.name: Stormforged Resistance
cards.colourText: 'Not a single step backwards, Hammers of Sigmar. Grant them nothing but a swift death.'
cards.rulesText: Friendly fighters cannot be driven back by the first Attack action in the next activation.

cards.name: Stormforged Tactics
cards.colourText: Stormcast Eternals fight as a single entity, the precision of their movement and attacks seeming almost preternatural.
cards.rulesText: In the next activation, you can make the following Reaction.

cards.name: Tireless Assault
cards.colourText: 'Fear not, heathen. I can keep this up all day.'
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that fails. That fighter can make another Attack action that targets the same fighter.

cards.name: Undaunted
cards.colourText: 'A Stormcast Eternal never fights alone. Sigmar is always with us.'
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action or ploy that takes a friendly fighter out of action leaving one surviving friendly fighter on the battlefield. Remove all wound tokens from the surviving fighter.

cards.name: Unstoppable Strike
cards.colourText: Stormcast Eternals are granted a fraction of the God-King Sigmar's celestial power, enough to shatter the guard of all but the mightiest foes.
cards.rulesText: The first Attack action in the next activation gains Cleave.

cards.name: Valiant Attack
cards.colourText: They may be lost in the depths of a nightmare, but Steelheart's warriors fight with the same valour and skill as ever.
cards.rulesText: Enemy fighters cannot support the target of the first Attack action in the next activation.

cards.name: Blessed by Sigmar
cards.colourText: 'We shall not fall here. Sigmar's light will guide us home.' - Severin Steelheart
cards.rulesText: +1 Wounds

cards.name: Block
cards.colourText: 'Is that the best you've got? Try harder.' - Angharad Brightshield
cards.rulesText: Action: This fighter and all adjacent friendly fighters go on Guard.

cards.name: Brave Strike
cards.colourText: Obryn is ever the first to throw himself into battle, smashing an opening for his comrades to take advantage of.
cards.rulesText: Roll an extra attack dice if there are no adjacent friendly fighters.

cards.name: Fatal Riposte
cards.colourText: Even amongst his warrior kin, Steelheart's skill with the blade is the stuff of legend.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an Attack action that targets this fighter and fails, roll an attack dice. On a roll of or this fighter cannot be driven back and they can make an Attack action. It must target the attacker.

cards.name: Heroic Might
cards.colourText: 'There's no parrying a well-aimed grandhammer with the weight of righteousness behind it.' - Obryn the Bold
cards.rulesText: This fighter's Attack actions gain Cleave.

cards.name: Heroic Stride
cards.colourText: A well-timed countercharge can turn the tide of battle in an instant.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After an enemy fighter ends their activation within two hexes of this fighter, you can push this fighter one hex.

cards.name: Lightning Blade
cards.colourText: Celestial energy ripples around Steelheart's sword, a cleansing storm to sear away the taint of corruption.
cards.rulesText: On a critical hit, this Attack action has +1 Damage.

cards.name: Lightning Blast
cards.colourText: As Obryn's grandhammer strikes home, a shock wave of magical energy blasts forth to send his foes reeling.
cards.rulesText: When they make a critical hit, this fighter also inflicts 1 damage on enemy fighters adjacent to the target's hex.

cards.name: Righteous Strike
cards.colourText: 'The loud one, with the fancy blade. He dies first.' - Angharad Brightshield
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After this Attack action, if it failed and the target was an enemy leader, make this Attack action again.

cards.name: Shield Bash
cards.colourText: Brightshield wields her shield as a weapon, smashing it into the face of her foes with bone-crushing force.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an adjacent fighter's Attack action that targets this fighter and fails, this fighter cannot be driven back and you can push their attacker one hex.

cards.name: Battle Without End
cards.colourText: Shadeglass is not needed for Nagash to bind his followers to eternal servitude.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if two or more friendly fighters returned to the battlefield in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Claim the City
cards.colourText: 'You were fools to deny Nagash - soon the whole city will be his.' - The Sepulchral Warden
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you hold every objective.

cards.name: Fearless in Death
cards.colourText: As a forest can grow from a single seed, so can death blossom from a single lost soul.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if there is only one friendly fighter on the battlefield.

cards.name: March of the Dead
cards.colourText: 'Walk careful here. The dead are restless.' - Severin Steelheart
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all of your surviving fighters (at least five) made a Move action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: More Able Bodies
cards.colourText: Sooner or later, every denizen of Shadespire will belong to Nagash.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband took two or more enemy fighters out of action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Peerless General
cards.colourText: 'Which has more power - strength, or the fear of strength?' - anonymous graffiti found in the chambers of the Executioner General
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if you have four or more surviving fighters, and none are Inspired.

cards.name: Skills Unforgotten
cards.colourText: The Sepulchral Warden has lingered for as long as anyone in Shadespire, yet he is as strong as ever.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your leader takes an enemy fighter out of action.

cards.name: The Invigorated Dead
cards.colourText: With every fall, the living lose something of themselves. With every rise, the dead gain a portion of Nagash's power.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if all of your surviving fighters (at least three) are Inspired.

cards.name: Undead Swarm
cards.colourText: The ranks of the risen dead are truly numberless.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if each enemy fighter is adjacent to at least two friendly fighters.

cards.name: Bone Shrapnel
cards.colourText: As the skeleton collapses in a cloud of dust, razor-sharp fragments of bone slice through the air.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action that takes a friendly fighter out of action. The fighter that took them out of action suffers 1 damage.

cards.name: Ceaseless Attacks
cards.colourText: How do you defeat an army that does not tire?
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action. Make an Attack action with another friendly fighter.

cards.name: Clawing Hands
cards.colourText: Bony claws reach forth from the earth, grasping at the flesh of the living.
cards.rulesText: Each friendly fighter that is not on the battlefield is considered to be supporting the first Attack action in the next activation.

cards.name: Danse Macabre
cards.colourText: Even the dissonant clatter of bones can be made to fall into rhythm.
cards.rulesText: Any friendly fighters that make a Move action in the next activation can move one additional hex.

cards.name: Grasping Hands
cards.colourText: The bony claws of the undying reach out from the ashes of the Mirrored City, seeking to share their fate with those of flesh and blood.
cards.rulesText: Reduce the Move characteristic of the first fighter to be activated in the next activation by the number of friendly fighters that are not on the battlefield, to a minimum of 0.

cards.name: Restless Dead
cards.colourText: Nagash denies the gift of eternal rest to those who defied his will.
cards.rulesText: Place a friendly fighter that was taken out of action (other than the Sepulchral Warden) on a starting hex in your territory.

cards.name: Spectral Form
cards.colourText: The solidity of bone gives way to baleful luminescence, and the screaming faces of tortured souls.
cards.rulesText: Any friendly fighters that make a Move action in the next activation can move through other fighters, but must end their moves in empty hexes.

cards.name: Swift Evasion
cards.colourText: Sometimes death stays its hand, but only for a time.
cards.rulesText: Choose one friendly fighter and push them up to two hexes. Their new position must be further away from all enemy fighters.

cards.name: Terrifying Screams
cards.colourText: The fallen of Shadespire know terror, for they have experienced the slow horror of their bodies rotting and wasting away.
cards.rulesText: Choose an enemy fighter and push them one hex.

cards.name: The Necromancer Commands
cards.colourText: As inexorable as the march of time, death cannot be resisted.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that fails. Make the Attack action again.

cards.name: Ancient Commander
cards.colourText: The Sepulchral Warden has fought a thousand battles, and commanded both the living and the dead with equal surety.
cards.rulesText: Action: Choose three other friendly fighters. Make Move actions with these fighters. This does not allow a fighter to move twice in a phase.

cards.name: Assumed Command
cards.colourText: Though the memories of his life have decayed, the Prince still exudes an aura of unquestionable authority.
cards.rulesText: Each friendly fighter that supports this fighter is considered to be two supporting fighters.

cards.name: Deathly Charge
cards.colourText: Once, the Champion tutored young warriors in the art of the sword. Now that life is little more than a fading dream.
cards.rulesText: This fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2 have +1 Damage in a phase in which they make a Charge action.

cards.name: Fatal Strike
cards.colourText: One final, spiteful strike before the end.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Make this Attack action during an Attack action that takes this fighter out of action, before they are removed from the battlefield. It must target their attacker.

cards.name: Focused Attack
cards.colourText: Sometimes a stubborn stem requires a firmer slice.
cards.rulesText: If you roll at least one this Attack action has Cleave.

cards.name: Frightening Speed
cards.colourText: Like all things, death can come sooner than expected.
cards.rulesText: +2 Move

cards.name: Grim Cleave
cards.colourText: The Harvester recalls the way he reaped the corn. A firm, strong swing.
cards.rulesText: This fighter's Attack actions gain Cleave.

cards.name: Lethal Lunge
cards.colourText: The souls of the dead belong to Nagash, and the Warden helps his master stake his claim.

cards.name: Remembered Shield
cards.colourText: Long after all memories of life have faded, a deep-seated sense of self-preservation continues to linger.
cards.rulesText: This fighter's Defence characteristic changes to .

cards.name: Undying
cards.colourText: Until the curse is lifted, the lost and damned of Shadespire can never find peace.
cards.rulesText: +1 Wounds

cards.name: 'Ard as Iron
cards.colourText: Orruks would be damned hard to put down even if they were not encased in thick iron armour.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if none of your fighters are out of action.

cards.name: Biggest an' da Best
cards.colourText: Orruk chieftains seldom make rousing speeches, preferring instead to lead by violent example.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your leader took an enemy fighter out of action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Call of the Waaagh!
cards.colourText: Roaring praises to the twin gods Gork and Mork, Gurzag leads his boys in an all-out assault.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if three or more of your fighters made a Charge action this phase.

cards.name: Dead Kunnin'
cards.colourText: The smartest orruks tend to figure out that greater strength often comes with greater numbers.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter has two more supporting fighters than their target when making an Attack action.

cards.name: Dere's More of Us
cards.colourText: Though they lack mathematical nuance, orruks can quickly figure out the bigger of two numbers.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you have more fighters on the battlefield than your opponent.

cards.name: Get Da Boss
cards.colourText: 'Want it dead? Smash da head.' - orruk proverb
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy leader out of action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Good Scrap
cards.colourText: Broken bodies, spilled blood, cracked skulls - these are some of the clearest signs that Ironjawz have had a good time.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if three or more fighters were taken out of action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Punch-up
cards.colourText: Orruks are not known to be good at sharing.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if each of your surviving fighters (at least two) made an Attack action against a different enemy fighter in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Too Dumb to Die
cards.colourText: 'What's got two legs and bleeds?' - orruk riddle
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter suffers 3 or more damage in a single attack and is not taken out of action.

cards.name: 'Avin' a Good Time
cards.colourText: An orruk is never happier than when he's hacking his way through a vicious melee.
cards.rulesText: Choose a fighter and roll an attack dice. If you roll a or they can make an Attack action.

cards.name: Brutal But Kunnin'
cards.colourText: Never underestimate an orruk's brutal cunning.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action. You can push that fighter up to three hexes.

cards.name: Deafening Bellow
cards.colourText: Those few who do not fear the orruks still do all they can to avoid being drenched in their saliva.
cards.rulesText: Choose an enemy fighter adjacent to one of your fighters. Push that fighter one hex.

cards.name: Gorkamorka's Blessing
cards.colourText: The savage, twin-faced orruk god delights in carnage and destruction.
cards.rulesText: The first Attack action with a Range of 1 or 2 in the next activation has +1 Damage.

cards.name: Kunnin' But Brutal
cards.colourText: Never underestimate an orruk's cunning brutality.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Move action. That fighter can make an Attack action. You cannot play this during a Charge action.

cards.name: Last Lunge
cards.colourText: An orruk is only considered to be truly dead when it is no longer trying to kill anyone.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this during an Attack action or ploy that will take a friendly fighter out of action, before removing them from the battlefield. Roll an attack dice. On a roll of or make an Attack action with that fighter. It must

cards.name: Leadin' By Example
cards.colourText: Orruk warlords lead through violence and intimidation. Might makes right.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action made by your leader that takes an enemy fighter out of action. Another friendly fighter that has not already made a Move or Charge action can make a Charge action.

cards.name: More Choppin'
cards.colourText: They may not be graceful duellists, but an orruk's sheer belligerence and tireless attacks can quickly wear a superior swordsman down.
cards.rulesText: Roll an extra attack dice for the first Attack action in the next activation.

cards.name: Pillage
cards.colourText: 'I'll be 'avin that, zog-face.'
cards.rulesText: Remove one objective that you hold from the battlefield.

cards.name: Scrag 'Em
cards.colourText: 'While I bash 'is face, you bash 'is face.'
cards.rulesText: Each friendly fighter that supports the first Attack action in the next activation is considered to be two supporting fighters.

cards.name: 'Ard Head
cards.colourText: Some orruks have skulls so thick they could beat iron into shape.
cards.rulesText: When this fighter suffers damage, reduce that damage by 1 to a minimum of 1.

cards.name: Aspiring Boss
cards.colourText: Hakka has long desired to lead his own mob. Warbosses get the fanciest loot, after all.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an Attack action by this fighter that targets an enemy leader and fails, you can re-roll one attack dice.

cards.name: Brutal Frenzy
cards.colourText: An orruk charge is a nigh unstoppable tide of iron, a mailed fist that smashes the life from the foe.
cards.rulesText: Roll an extra attack dice when this fighter makes a Charge action.

cards.name: Brutal Swing
cards.colourText: 'Come on then, I'll 'ave the lot of ya!' - Bonekutta
cards.rulesText: Targets all adjacent enemy fighters - roll for each.

cards.name: Crush and Cleave
cards.colourText: Orruk weapons may be little more than crude chunks of iron, but in the hands of an Ironjawz warrior they are brutally effective.
cards.rulesText: This fighter's Attack actions gain Cleave.

cards.name: Dead 'Ard
cards.colourText: Orruks can fight on, seemingly unconcerned, after even the most grievous wounds.
cards.rulesText: This fighter can only be driven back by a critical hit.

cards.name: 'Eadbutt
cards.colourText: 'Aha! I have disarmed you, orruk. What shall you do now?' - last recorded words of master duellist Acrius Kope
cards.rulesText: If this Attack action succeeds, the target cannot be activated for the rest of the phase.

cards.name: Headlong Rush
cards.colourText: Jumping and whirling in an insane dance, Basha leaves a trail of broken bones and shattered skulls in his wake.
cards.rulesText: This fighter's Attack actions gain Knockback 1 in a phase in which they make a Charge action.

cards.name: Unkillable
cards.colourText: Even without shadeglass, orruks can appear to be oblivious to the effects of death.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an Attack action or ploy that takes this fighter out of action, roll a defence dice. If you roll a or they suffer no damage and are not taken out of action, and you discard this upgrade.

cards.name: Waaagh!
cards.colourText: This thundering roar is often the last sound a warrior will hear, other than the splitting of their own skull.
cards.rulesText: This fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2 have +1 Damage in a phase in which they make a Charge action.

cards.name: A Claim Retaken
cards.colourText: 'Stand aside, for the warriors of Vostarg have claimed these treasures as their own.' - Tefk Flamebearer
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if a friendly fighter holds an objective that an enemy fighter held at the beginning of the preceding action phase.

cards.name: A Grim Promise
cards.colourText: Fjul-Grimnir makes neither oaths nor threats lightly.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy leader out of action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Ferocious Charge
cards.colourText: Fuelled by a desire to redeem their names and fulfil their ancient oaths, Fjul-Grimnir's warriors fight with furious aggression.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter takes an enemy fighter out of action with a Charge action.

cards.name: For the Ur-gold
cards.colourText: To the Fyreslayers, ur-gold represents a spiritual connection to their warrior god. They will risk their lives for a mere handful of it.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all of your surviving fighters (at least three) are Inspired.

cards.name: Fury of the Lodge
cards.colourText: 'For Vostarg! For Grimnir! Let them taste our fyresteel!' - Fjul-Grimnir
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all of your surviving fighters (at least three) made a Charge action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Hoarders
cards.colourText: 'The ignorant might call it greed. Those who cannot imagine the sacrifices we have made.' - Vol Orrukbane
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all of your fighters and no enemy fighters are holding objectives.

cards.name: Oaths Still to Fulfil
cards.colourText: 'I have lost count of the years I have been trapped in this cursed place. Yet still I hold to Vostarg's ancient oaths. I will fight until the curse of Shadespire is lifted.' - Fjul-Grimnir
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if none of your fighters are out of action.

cards.name: Scion of Grimnir
cards.colourText: Fjul-Grimnir has fought and slain some of the most fearsome warriors in the realms.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your leader takes an enemy fighter out of action.

cards.name: Unstoppable Advance
cards.colourText: 'Get out me way, get out me way! Shove off, or I'll use yer guts as a belt, ye wretch!' - Mad Maegrim
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all of your surviving fighters are in enemy territory.

cards.name: Berserk Fury
cards.colourText: The blood of Grimnir burns hot within Fyreslayer veins, granting them a furious battle-rage.
cards.rulesText: The first time a friendly fighter suffers damage in the next activation, roll a defence dice. If the result is a they suffer no damage.

cards.name: Indomitable
cards.colourText: Fyreslayers are as tough as the igneous rock from which they build their impervious magmaholds.
cards.rulesText: The first time a friendly fighter suffers damage in the next activation, they only suffer 1 damage.

cards.name: Living Wall
cards.colourText: The redoubtable sons of Grimnir can hold back foes many times their size.
cards.rulesText: Choose two friendly fighters and push each of them up to one hex. They must end up adjacent to one another.

cards.name: Oathsworn
cards.colourText: Fyreslayers would gladly die before dishonouring their oaths.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that fails. That fighter can make another Attack action that targets the same fighter.

cards.name: Piercing Stare
cards.colourText: Eyes blazing with the fiery wrath of their warrior-god, Fyreslayers are intimidating foes indeed.
cards.rulesText: Choose an enemy fighter. They cannot make an Attack action or a Charge action in the next activation.

cards.name: Slaying Blow
cards.colourText: 'And Grimnir hewed with his axe, and so mighty was his arm that the Mother of Salamanders' obsidian hide was cleaved asunder in but a single blow.'
cards.rulesText: If the first Attack action in the next activation is a critical hit, double its Damage characteristic.

cards.name: The Earth Shakes
cards.colourText: Grimnir's folk can sense the slightest tremor in the ground beneath their feet.
cards.rulesText: Choose a fighter and push them one hex.

cards.name: Treasure-lust
cards.colourText: 'Ur-gold is all that matters. It is the essence of our god, the lifeblood of our people.' - Auric Runefather Fjul-Grimnir
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter and push them up to three hexes. They must end up holding an objective.

cards.name: Ur-gold Boon
cards.colourText: Even the sight of blessed ur-gold can restore a Fyreslayer's vigour.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter and roll a defence dice. On a roll of or remove up to two wound tokens from them. Otherwise, remove one wound token from them.

cards.name: We Shall Not Be Moved
cards.colourText: Fyreslayers will not cease their quest, will not take a single step back until they have fulfilled their oaths.
cards.rulesText: Friendly fighters holding objectives cannot be driven back by the first Attack action in the next activation.

cards.name: Activated Runes
cards.colourText: This Fyreslayer's ur-gold runes blaze with white heat, imbuing him with the strength of his warrior god.
cards.rulesText: Each time this fighter makes an Attack action, you can re-roll one dice.

cards.name: Brute Strength
cards.colourText: Tefk boasts - when in his cups - that he once raised an ash-crawler above his head and hurled it into the mouth of a caldera.
cards.rulesText: This fighter's Attack actions gain Knockback 1.

cards.name: Defiant Strike
cards.colourText: Tefk never backs down from a good fight.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an Attack action that succeeds against this fighter, this fighter cannot be driven back and makes this Attack action. It must target the attacker.

cards.name: Flurry of Blows
cards.colourText: When Maegrim erupts in anger, his axe-strikes fall like a rain of flaming boulders.

cards.name: Great Swing
cards.colourText: Vol Orrukbane earned his name in the tunnels of Mok'ga, where greenskin blood ran as freely as rainwater.
cards.rulesText: Targets all adjacent enemy fighters - roll for each.

cards.name: Grimnir's Blessing
cards.colourText: Fjul-Grimnir has always been high in his god's favour. It has seen him through countless battles.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an Attack action or ploy that would take this fighter out of action, roll a defence dice. If you roll a the damage suffered by this fighter is ignored.

cards.name: Grimnir's Fortitude
cards.colourText: 'I've seen the Runefather take a punch from a coal-gargant without taking a single step back. Hard as blackstone, that one.' - Tefk Flamebearer
cards.rulesText: +1 Defence

cards.name: Grimnir's Speed
cards.colourText: Age has not slowed Fjul-Grimnir. His unfulfilled oaths drive him ever onwards.
cards.rulesText: +2 Move

cards.name: Returning Axe
cards.colourText: Mad Maegrim might not be altogether sane, but few can hurl an axe so well.
cards.rulesText: On a critical hit this Attack action has +1 Damage.

cards.name: War Song
cards.colourText: Vol's bellowed battle-hymns have been known to cause rockslides.
cards.rulesText: This fighter is considered to be two supporting fighters when they support, rather than one.

cards.name: Arm's Length
cards.colourText: Ideally, skaven would slay all their enemies from a nice, safe distance.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your warband takes an enemy fighter out of action while they are adjacent to none of your fighters.

cards.name: Brilliant, Brilliant!
cards.colourText: 'Skritch is pleased, yes he is. No floggings for rat-filth this night.' - Skritch Spiteclaw
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you scored two or more other objective cards in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Feast-feast
cards.colourText: A defeated enemy doubles as an acceptable meal for hungry clanrats.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all enemy fighters have been taken out of action.

cards.name: Honed Survival Instincts
cards.colourText: Skritch Spiteclaw and his filthy band are consummate survivors.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if no friendly fighter was taken out of action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Leading from the Back
cards.colourText: 'You must kill-slay the big one with the hammer, yes-yes. Skritch will observe from here.' - Skritch Spiteclaw
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if your leader is in your territory and not adjacent to an enemy.

cards.name: Live to Fight Another Day
cards.colourText: Panicked retreat is a time-honoured strategy of skaven armies.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if the only surviving friendly fighter is your leader.

cards.name: Lives are Cheap
cards.colourText: 'Many death-traps in this place, Warlord Spiteclaw. Many dead, squash-flat. Shall I send another score?' - Krrk the Almost-trusted
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if two or more friendly fighters were taken out of action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Numberless Swarm
cards.colourText: One thing that everyone who has ever fought against skaven knows well - there are always more of them.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if there are five friendly fighters on the battlefield.

cards.name: Skritch is the Greatest, Yes-yes
cards.colourText: While Skritch may prefer to avoid the needless risk of single combat, he's a dangerous warrior when left with no choice.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your leader takes an enemy fighter out of action.

cards.name: Aversion to Death
cards.colourText: Self-sacrifice is not an act widely celebrated amongst the skaven.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action that takes a friendly fighter out of action. Push up to two friendly fighters one hex each.

cards.name: Frenzied Stabbing
cards.colourText: There are few creatures as vicious as a cornered skaven warrior.
cards.rulesText: The first Attack action with a Range of 1 or 2 in the next activation has +1 Damage.

cards.name: Heightened Caution
cards.colourText: Skaven exist in a constant state of alert, and are extremely difficult to catch off guard.
cards.rulesText: Roll an extra defence dice for the first friendly fighter to be targeted by an Attack action in the next activation.

cards.name: Momentary Boldness
cards.colourText: Sheer weight of numbers can inspire some skaven to acts of uncharacteristic boldness.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter adjacent to two or more friendly fighters. That fighter makes a Charge action.

cards.name: Musk of Fear
cards.colourText: When threatened, ratmen release a pungent pheromone that heightens their senses and alerts their kin.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter and put them on Guard.

cards.name: Nervous Scrabbling
cards.colourText: The best form of defence is providing your foe with an easier target.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter. They switch places with any adjacent fighter.

cards.name: Scratching in the Shadows
cards.colourText: 'Wherever we turned we heard it. The sound of claws skittering across stone, echoed and amplified a thousand times.'
cards.rulesText: Choose an enemy fighter and push them one hex.

cards.name: Skaven Courage
cards.colourText: As far as the skaven are concerned, it's not a fair fight unless their opponent is severely outnumbered.
cards.rulesText: Play this if there are at least three friendly fighters adjacent to the same enemy fighter. One of those friendly fighters can

cards.name: Sudden Skittering
cards.colourText: Skaven are capable of bursts of extraordinary speed.
cards.rulesText: Double the Move characteristic of the first friendly fighter to make a Move action in the next activation. They may not make a Charge action. Once they have moved, they cannot be activated again in this phase.

cards.name: There Are Always More
cards.colourText: The swarms of the skaven clans are truly endless.
cards.rulesText: Choose one friendly fighter that is out of action (other than Skritch or Krrk). Remove all wound tokens from them and place them on any starting hex.

cards.name: Black Hunger
cards.colourText: 'Stab-smash! Drain the meat, drink the blood. Yes-yes!'
cards.rulesText: This fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 have +1 Damage, and target all adjacent fighters (friend and foe) - roll for each. Fighters do not provide support for Attack actions against friendly models (in attack or defence).

cards.name: Bodyguard for a Price
cards.colourText: Through threats or bribery, Skritch always employs a personal guard. The life expectancy of these bodyguards is especially low.
cards.rulesText: If Skritch is adjacent to this fighter, Skritch is on Guard (even if Skritch has made a Charge action this phase).

cards.name: Expendable
cards.colourText: Skaven leaders spend their warriors' lives uncaringly, for they know there are always more clanrats to be found.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an Attack action that will cause any damage to this fighter, you can remove them from the battlefield and deal 1 damage to their attacker.

cards.name: Festering Blades
cards.colourText: Skaven take particular delight in infecting their blades with a potent blend of filth, toxins and rotting matter.
cards.rulesText: On a critical hit, this fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2 have +2 Damage.

cards.name: Flee!
cards.colourText: 'Quick-quick, sacrifice yourself for your master, for he must escape to fight again. Yes. Yes-yes. Well done.' - Skritch Spiteclaw
cards.rulesText: Action: This fighter and one adjacent friendly fighter can make a Move action. Both fighters must end their move further away from all enemy fighters.

cards.name: Skitter-scurry
cards.colourText: Lightning fast and seemingly erratic, skaven movement is incredibly hard to predict.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After any action that this fighter makes, you can push this fighter one hex.

cards.name: Sneaky Stab-stab
cards.colourText: There is little more satisfying to a skaven than sinking a knife into the back of an unwary victim.
cards.rulesText: You can push this fighter one hex before they take an Attack action, though not when this fighter takes a Charge action.

cards.name: Swarm of Rats
cards.colourText: Common plague rats accompany the skaven, falling upon their foes in nipping, tearing swarms of pox-ridden fur.
cards.rulesText: Targets all adjacent enemy fighters - roll for each.

cards.name: Throwing Stars
cards.colourText: The assassins of the Clans Eshin favour the use of poisoned throwing stars to open throats and blind their foes.

cards.name: Whirling Halberd
cards.colourText: Skritch may prefer to let his minions do his fighting, but when cornered he is a lethal warrior.
cards.rulesText: Targets all adjacent enemy fighters - roll for each.

cards.name: All the Better to Slay Them
cards.colourText: Whoever claims the skull claims the glory.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if all friendly fighters (at least three) are adjacent to a different enemy fighter.

cards.name: Bane of Champions
cards.colourText: 'Old Riptooth's picky about what he eats. He favours the taste of foolish heroes.' - Ghartok Flayskull
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if Riptooth takes an enemy leader out of action.

cards.name: Bloody Annihilation
cards.colourText: Let the blood flow in endless rivers.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all enemy fighters have been taken out of action.

cards.name: Khorne Sees Us
cards.colourText: 'I saw his gaze reflected in the blood we spilled. I saw our glory, and our ruin.' - Zharkus the Bloodsighted
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your warband takes two or more enemy fighters out of action in a phase.

cards.name: Kill! Kill Again!
cards.colourText: A champion of Khorne can never cease his quest for slaughter.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if at least two fighters from each warband are out of action.

cards.name: No Escape
cards.colourText: Retreating from attacking Blood Warriors is rarely an option, for they will pursue tirelessly, like maddened hounds.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if three or more of your fighters made a Charge action this phase.

cards.name: Rivers of Blood
cards.colourText: Wounds merely drive Magore and his men to greater heights of frenzy.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all surviving fighters (at least four) are wounded.

cards.name: Save the Best
cards.colourText: 'I have been looking forward to this. Your skull shall be a worthy trophy.' - Magore Redhand
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if an enemy leader is the only surviving enemy fighter.

cards.name: Show of Strength
cards.colourText: Magore Redhand's sawtoothed axe - a gift from mighty Khorne, so he claims - must feed on spilled blood daily.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your leader takes an enemy fighter out of action.

cards.name: Blood Frenzy
cards.colourText: The more the blood flows, the faster Blood Warriors lose themselves to the rage of Khorne.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action or ploy that takes a fighter out of action. Roll one extra attack dice for the first Attack action in the next activation. Both and are successes for that Attack action.

cards.name: Bloodslick Ground
cards.colourText: Keeping one's footing whilst atop dripping piles of gore can be difficult for the uninitiated.
cards.rulesText: In the next activation, enemy fighters have -2 Move.

cards.name: Bloody Retribution
cards.colourText: The Blood Warriors do not avenge their fallen, but they do take inspiration from their deaths.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action that takes a friendly fighter out of action. A friendly fighter adjacent to the attacker makes an Attack action against that fighter.

cards.name: Continue the Slaughter
cards.colourText: Khorne's thirst for blood can never be satisfied.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action or ploy that takes a fighter out of action. The first Attack action in the next

cards.name: Daemonic Resilience
cards.colourText: Beneath their gore-smeared armour, this Blood Warrior's flesh has warped into thick, mottled hide. The first step on the long path to daemonhood.
cards.rulesText: The first friendly fighter who suffers any amount of damage in the next activation only suffers 1 damage.

cards.name: Fountain of Gore
cards.colourText: A cascade of arterial gore splatters across the battlefield, raising the hearts of Khorne's faithful.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action or ploy that takes a fighter out of action. All friendly fighters have +1 Defence in the next activation.

cards.name: Furious Inspiration
cards.colourText: 'You will earn me glory, or I will flay the skin from your back. The choice is yours.' - Magore Redhand
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter. They become Inspired.

cards.name: Glory to Khorne
cards.colourText: 'Slay them all for mighty Khorne! All glory to the Blood God!'
cards.rulesText: Roll one extra attack dice for the first Attack action made by a friendly fighter in the next activation.

cards.name: Horrifying Howl
cards.colourText: The howls of those lost to the blood rage are hideous indeed - primal bellows of mindless savagery.
cards.rulesText: Choose an enemy fighter that is adjacent to a friendly fighter and push them up to two hexes.

cards.name: To the Victor, the Spoils
cards.colourText: 'What's yours is mine. I'll take it from your bloody corpse.' - Ghartok Flayskull
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that takes an enemy fighter with a Wounds characteristic of 3 or more out of action. Draw three power cards.

cards.name: Brutal Charge
cards.colourText: Blood Warriors often break their enemies in the first few moments of a battle, so brutal and terrifying is their frenzied charge.
cards.rulesText: Roll an extra attack dice when this fighter makes a Charge action.

cards.name: Daemonic Maw
cards.colourText: The great maw on Redhand's chestplate snaps shut upon his foe, tearing flesh and shattering bone.
cards.rulesText: If this Attack action succeeds, remove one wound token from this fighter.

cards.name: Furious Charge
cards.colourText: Zharkus smashes into the enemy ranks, the song of Khorne upon his blood-scabbed lips.
cards.rulesText: When this fighter makes a Charge action both and are successes.

cards.name: No Respite
cards.colourText: Even when stricken by mortal wounds, Blood Warriors care for nothing but their next kill.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an Attack action or ploy that will take this fighter out of action, you can make an Attack action with them.

cards.name: Predatory Leap
cards.colourText: Nothing can stand in Riptooth's way once he has his quarry's scent.
cards.rulesText: When this fighter makes a Charge action they can move through other fighters, but their move must end in an empty hex.

cards.name: Rage-fuelled Attacks
cards.colourText: Zharkus screams and drools as he carves his foes apart, his eyes glazed over, blood seeping from his nose and mouth.
cards.rulesText: This fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2 have +1 Damage.

cards.name: Shake About
cards.colourText: Riptooth sinks his fangs deep into his prey's flesh and shakes violently, dragging them to the floor.
cards.rulesText: This fighter's successful Attack actions with a Range of 1 can push the target one hex (instead of driving them back) in addition to inflicting damage.

cards.name: Trophy Hunter
cards.colourText: 'Let them scavenge for trinkets. I have come for skulls, not baubles.' - Magore Redhand
cards.rulesText: When this fighter takes an enemy fighter out of action, gain 1 additional glory point.

cards.name: Unshakeable
cards.colourText: Flesh Hounds are cruel, voracious and utterly unrelenting.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an Attack action that could drive this fighter back (whether or not your opponent chooses to do so), you can instead push them one hex.

cards.name: Wrathful Blows
cards.colourText: 'There's naught so sweet as taking your foe's head off with one good swing.'
cards.rulesText: All of this fighter's Attack actions have +1 Dice.

cards.name: Behead the Beast
cards.colourText: Stormcast Rangers strike hard and fast, and cut the head from the foe before they can react.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy leader out of action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Brave but Cautious
cards.colourText: 'Bravery is commendable. Bravery untempered by caution will get you killed.'
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you have at least one surviving fighter and none of your fighters suffered any damage in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Close with the Enemy
cards.colourText: Farstrider's warriors are peerless marksmen, but they are always ready to draw blades and take the fight to their quarry.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if three friendly fighters are adjacent to enemy fighters.

cards.name: Eternal Supremacy
cards.colourText: 'Always the same. Rangers win the day, and then we wait for the shield-sloggers to catch us up.' - Eagle-Eye
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you hold three or more objectives.

cards.name: Lightning Advance
cards.colourText: 'There's no such thing as a safe haven for a Ranger. Nor for our enemies.' - Swiftblade
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all of your surviving fighters (at least two) are in enemy territory.

cards.name: Meticulous Annihilation
cards.colourText: Farstrider's warriors know the vital importance of leaving no survivors who could warn of their presence.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all enemy fighters have been taken out of action.

cards.name: Punishing Volleys
cards.colourText: Unceasing fire has left the enemy reeling.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you made at least three successful Boltstorm Pistol or Overcharged Boltstorm Pistol Attack actions in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Ranger Strike
cards.colourText: With one swift strike, the enemy is left bloodied and reeling.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your warband has taken two or more enemy fighters out of action in this phase.

cards.name: Sigmar's Finest
cards.colourText: Stormcast Rangers are well used to being isolated and outnumbered in hostile lands.
cards.rulesText: Score this is an end phase if your surviving fighters (at least one) are outnumbered by surviving enemy fighters by at least three to one.

cards.name: Fearsome Roar
cards.colourText: Stormcast Rangers know the value of sowing fear and discord amidst the enemy ranks.
cards.rulesText: Choose an enemy fighter adjacent to a friendly fighter. Push them one hex.

cards.name: Firm Footing
cards.colourText: Acclimated to the most extreme environments and battlefields in the Mortal Realms, Stormcast Rangers are rugged and unyielding warriors.
cards.rulesText: Roll an extra defence dice for friendly fighters holding objectives in the next activation.

cards.name: Lightning Blow
cards.colourText: Swift and merciless, the Stormcast Rangers are the subtle blade that opens the throat of the enemy.
cards.rulesText: The first Attack action in the next activation has +1 Damage.

cards.name: Lightning Stride
cards.colourText: Rangers are cunning and elusive warriors. They know that often a victory can be achieved by bypassing the foe.
cards.rulesText: Double the Move characteristic of the first friendly fighter to make a Move action in the next activation. They may not make a Charge action. Once they have moved, they cannot be activated again in this phase.

cards.name: Patient Defence
cards.colourText: 'The patient hunter claims the greatest trophies.' - motto of the Farstalker Vanguard Chamber, Astral Templars
cards.rulesText: The first friendly fighter to be targeted by an Attack action in the next activation has +1 Defence.

cards.name: Rangers, Advance
cards.colourText: When the time comes for their assault, Stormcast Rangers move with practised cohesion.
cards.rulesText: Choose two friendly fighters and push them one hex.

cards.name: Rapid Volley
cards.colourText: The Farstriders target their foes with a hail of crackling bolts.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Boltstorm Pistol or Overcharged Boltstorm Pistol Attack action. That fighter can make another Boltstorm Pistol or Overcharged Boltstorm Pistol Attack action that targets the same fighter.

cards.name: Retribution
cards.colourText: Many Stormcast Rangers were once hunters and vigilantes who fought alone against the forces of Chaos. They bear an ancient thirst for vengeance.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action that damages a friendly fighter. That fighter can make an Attack action that must target the attacker.

cards.name: Steady Volley
cards.colourText: Boltstorm pistols are designed to be fired on the move, suiting well the Vanguard-Hunters' aggressive, mobile tactics.
cards.rulesText: The first friendly fighter to make a Boltstorm Pistol or Overcharged Boltstorm Pistol Attack action in the next activation can be pushed one hex before they do so.

cards.name: Warning Cry
cards.colourText: The bonds within a Ranger detachment are strong indeed, forged through many long years of campaigning together as an isolated force.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter and put them on Guard.

cards.name: Aetheric Step
cards.colourText: Farstrider's men swear he has the God-King's eye upon him, so attuned is he to the aetheric currents.
cards.rulesText: This fighter can move through other fighters during a Move action, but must end their move in an empty hex.

cards.name: Covering Fire
cards.colourText: Just as the enemy moves to strike, a hail of crackling bolts explodes around them.
cards.rulesText: This fighter can support an adjacent friendly fighter targeted by an Attack action, even if this fighter is not adjacent to the attacker.

cards.name: Flashing Handaxe
cards.colourText: Stormcast Rangers wield weapons that surge with lightning, sending powerful shock waves coursing through anything they strike.

cards.name: Furious Blow
cards.colourText: 'One strike, one kill. That's how a Ranger fights.' - Almeric Eagle-Eye
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an Attack action that targets this fighter and has failed, this fighter cannot be driven back and can make an Attack action. It must target the attacker.

cards.name: Lone Warrior
cards.colourText: Vanguard-Hunters are used to fighting alone, for they are by nature a self-reliant breed.
cards.rulesText: Rolls of made for this fighter when they are targeted by an Attack action also count as successes when they are adjacent to no friendly fighters.

cards.name: Overcharged Boltstorm Pistol
cards.colourText: An overcharged boltstorm pistol can punch through even the thickest armour.

cards.name: Sharp Eyes
cards.colourText: Eagle-Eye can identify an enemy's weakness in a single glance, and utilises that knowledge to lethal effect.
cards.rulesText: This fighter's Attack actions gain Cleave.

cards.name: Spinning Strike
cards.colourText: Swiftblade bursts into motion, weaving his storm sabre so rapidly that it leaves a blinding after-image in the air.
cards.rulesText: Targets all adjacent enemy fighters - roll for each.

cards.name: Swift Stride
cards.colourText: Rangers favour lighter armour than their fellow Stormcasts, for they must be able to move swiftly and surely.
cards.rulesText: +2 Move

cards.name: Well-timed Lunge
cards.colourText: 'Every warrior leaves an opening in their guard. Wait until you see it, then strike like a dusk viper.' - Elias Swiftblade

cards.name: Accept Inevitability
cards.colourText: Those sequestered in the Mirrored City know that death is inevitable, if not necessarily final.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if all of your fighters are out of action.

cards.name: Advancing Strike
cards.colourText: Track your enemies to their lair and put them to the sword.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately when your warband takes an enemy fighter standing in enemy territory out of action.

cards.name: Alone in the Darkness
cards.colourText: Some warriors excel at the lone hunt.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if there are no adjacent fighters on the battlefield.

cards.name: Annihilation
cards.colourText: Shadespire is no stranger to suffering. This carnage is a mere drop in an ocean of torment.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all enemy fighters have been taken out of action.

cards.name: Assassinate
cards.colourText: The death of a leader can throw an enemy force into total disarray.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy leader out of action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Balance of Power
cards.colourText: The battle is poised upon the edge of a blade.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately when making an Attack action if both the attacker and the target have two supporting fighters.

cards.name: Blooded
cards.colourText: Scars often tell a warrior's tale more eloquently than words.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all of your surviving fighters (at least three) have at least one wound token.

cards.name: Bloodless
cards.colourText: Sometimes victory is a luxury, and survival is enough.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if no fighter suffered any damage in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Brawl
cards.colourText: Some warriors excel in the inglorious chaos of a brutal melee.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all friendly fighters (at least three) are adjacent to enemy fighters.

cards.name: Butchery
cards.colourText: Carnage worthy of the Blood God's gaze.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband took three or more enemy fighters out of action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Change of Tactics
cards.colourText: A sudden shift in strategy can catch the enemy unaware.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter on Guard makes a Charge action.

cards.name: Chosen Champion
cards.colourText: Upon the shoulders of one warrior rests the fate of all.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if a surviving friendly fighter has three or more upgrades.

cards.name: Complete Victory
cards.colourText: Your warriors are indomitable, their dominance unquestioned.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if none of your fighters are out of action.

cards.name: Concerted Attack
cards.colourText: Choose your target and put them down.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if three or more friendly fighters made an Attack action against the same enemy fighter in this phase.

cards.name: Conquest
cards.colourText: 'Hope is not yet lost. While we still stand, we can prevail.'
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if all of your surviving fighters are in your opponent's territory.

cards.name: Contained
cards.colourText: Nagash's plan was always to keep the Katophranes in the prison they had fashioned for themselves.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if all surviving enemy fighters are in their territory.

cards.name: Cover Ground
cards.colourText: Speed is of the essence.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter makes a Move action of six or more hexes.

cards.name: Crushing Force
cards.colourText: Sometimes you have to make absolutely certain your foe stays down.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter makes a successful attack that deals at least twice as much damage as is needed to take their target out of action.

cards.name: Dauntless
cards.colourText: 'Three against one? That's very nearly a fair fight.' - Angharad Brightshield
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your fighters are outnumbered by at least three to one.

cards.name: Defensive Strike
cards.colourText: Do not let your foes take a single step within your domain.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately when your warband takes an enemy fighter standing in your territory out of action.

cards.name: Denial
cards.colourText: 'None shall pass! These treasures are ours alone.'
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if there are no enemy fighters in your territory.

cards.name: Determined Defender
cards.colourText: 'It is the strangest thing - the longer I look into the shadeglass, the more of myself I see.' - Journeyman Artificer Havilax Unctius
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if the same friendly fighter has held the same objective at the end of two consecutive action phases.

cards.name: Divide and Conquer
cards.colourText: A divided enemy is an enemy ready to fall.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if each player has at least one fighter in their own territory and at least one fighter in enemy territory.

cards.name: Endless Slaughter
cards.colourText: In Shadespire, death lost its meaning long ago. Violence, however, never lost its charm.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if five or more enemy fighters are out of action.

cards.name: Escalation
cards.colourText: Never bring a knife to a giant iron cleaver fight.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if three or more upgrade cards were played in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Fearless
cards.colourText: 'When you take up the blade, you sign a pact with death. Fearing the inevitable is pointless.' - Farstrider
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if there are at least three enemy fighters adjacent to the same friendly fighter.

cards.name: Flawless Strategy
cards.colourText: 'Thinking one step ahead is good. Thinking two steps ahead is better.' - postscript from the collected letters of Princess Consort Venix Marriel
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you scored two or more other objective cards in this phase.

cards.name: Geared for War
cards.colourText: 'You boys ready to kick some 'eads in?' - Gurzag Ironskull
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if each of your surviving fighters (at least three) has at least one upgrade.

cards.name: Heroes All
cards.colourText: 'I could find no finer companions in all the realms.' - Steelheart
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all of your surviving fighters (at least three) are Inspired.

cards.name: Heroic Feat
cards.colourText: A single heroic act can turn the tide of a battle.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter's Attack action succeeds when their target has two or more supporting fighters more than the attacker.

cards.name: Hold Objective 1
cards.colourText: 'Death is simply a riddle we are yet to solve. In time, all truths emerge.'
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you are holding objective 1.

cards.name: Hold Objective 2
cards.colourText: 'Treasures of all shapes and forms were crafted from shadeglass - items of prodigious power.'
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you are holding objective 2.

cards.name: Hold Objective 3
cards.colourText: 'The Faneway is a paradox. It confines us, even as it frees our souls from the grasp of death.'
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you are holding objective 3.

cards.name: Hold Objective 4
cards.colourText: Unwilling to share the source of their might, the Katophranes locked their secrets away.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you are holding objective 4.

cards.name: Hold Objective 5
cards.colourText: 'Great Nagash opened our eyes. Life is a curse. Death is a gift.' - The Sepulchral Warden
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you are holding objective 5.

cards.name: Honest Opponent
cards.colourText: In a city filled with illusory madness, a straightforward fight can be a refreshing change of pace.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you played no ploy cards during the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Killing Ground
cards.colourText: After a bout of vicious fighting, the battlefield is an orderless, bloody mess.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if at least one fighter was taken out of action in the preceding action phase in enemy territory, in your territory and in no one's territory.

cards.name: Making a Statement
cards.colourText: Let the enemy know their doom.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you hold all objectives (at least one) in your opponent's territory.

cards.name: Massive Assault
cards.colourText: With one furious hammer-blow, the spine of the enemy force is shattered.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your fighters deal 7 or more damage in an action phase (damage in excess of a fighter's Wounds characteristic is included).

cards.name: Master of War
cards.colourText: Some are born to command. Others learn to master warfare over countless centuries of strife and slaughter.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you scored an objective card, played a ploy card and played an upgrade card in this round.

cards.name: Masterstroke
cards.colourText: With a single masterful strike, the tide of battle shifts.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if an enemy fighter is taken out of action by an Attack action made as a Reaction by your warband or a Reaction made by your warband that causes damage.

cards.name: Miraculous Escape
cards.colourText: There are no certainties in Shadespire.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if one of your fighters is the target of an enemy Attack action with a Dice characteristic of 3 or more that fails.

cards.name: Multiple Fronts
cards.colourText: The enemy can find no sanctuary from the reach of your blades.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband dealt damage to three or more enemy fighters in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: No More Tricks
cards.colourText: 'I'm sure I'll think of something.'
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you have no power cards in your hand.

cards.name: No Remorse
cards.colourText: Mercy is a luxury denizens of the Mirrored City can ill afford.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if one of your fighters takes an enemy fighter out of action with an Attack action with a Damage characteristic greater than the target's Wounds characteristic.

cards.name: Our Only Way Out
cards.colourText: Only those who claim the treasures of Shadespire have a chance of escaping its grasp.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you hold three or more objectives.

cards.name: Overextended
cards.colourText: Boldness is to be commended, but should be tempered with caution.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you hold every objective.

cards.name: Perfect Planning
cards.colourText: 'Force your enemy to react, and invariably he will make a mistake.' - Severin Steelheart
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if none of your fighters made a Move action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Plant a Standard
cards.colourText: The bold shall always be followed, even into death.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your leader is holding an objective in enemy territory.

cards.name: Ploymaster
cards.colourText: 'Skritch's plans are coming together, yes-yes they are.' - Skritch Spiteclaw
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you played three or more ploys in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Poised to Strike
cards.colourText: The bloody end draws near...
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if at least three friendly fighters are adjacent to the same enemy fighter.

cards.name: Precise Use of Force
cards.colourText: Truly masterful killers never expend more strength than they require for a killing strike.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter makes a successful Attack action that deals exactly enough damage to take their target out of action.

cards.name: Pure Carnage
cards.colourText: Butchered bodies litter the shadow-shrouded streets of the Mirrored City.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if seven or more fighters are out of action.

cards.name: Ready for a Challenge
cards.colourText: 'At last, a worthy foe.' - Magore Redhand
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all remaining enemy fighters (at least three) have an upgrade.

cards.name: Reaper
cards.colourText: Though Nagash's revenge is lingering, it was achieved in a single fell swoop.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter's attack takes two or more enemy fighters out of action.

cards.name: Scent of Victory
cards.colourText: The enemy is battered, bloodied and ready to break.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all surviving enemy fighters (at least three) have at least one wound token.

cards.name: Skirting Danger
cards.colourText: It pays to always have an escape route in mind.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all surviving friendly fighters (at least two) are on edge hexes.

cards.name: Stymied
cards.colourText: 'An opponent that cannot act cannot win.' - Teachings of the Champions of Shadespire
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your opponent played no power cards in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Superior Tactician
cards.colourText: 'We have achieved much, and victory is within our grasp.' - Severin Steelheart
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if you have scored six or more other objective cards.

cards.name: Supremacy
cards.colourText: Only by restoring the Faneway mirror can one hope to escape Shadespire. Only the bold can achieve such a task.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you hold three or more objectives.

cards.name: Swift Advance
cards.colourText: A swift assault leaves the foe reeling.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all of your surviving fighters are in enemy territory.

cards.name: Tactical Genius 1-3
cards.colourText: 'The Faneway allows us to break the chains of mortality. In time, what other limitations shall we free ourselves from?' - Grand Katophrane Fayrem Al'mwe
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you hold objectives 1, 2 and 3.

cards.name: Tactical Genius 3-5
cards.colourText: 'The Faneway was a symbol of our arrogant decadence. Never again shall we believe ourselves beyond the grasp of fate.' - The Sepulchral Warden
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you hold objectives 3, 4 and 5.

cards.name: Tactical Supremacy 1-2
cards.colourText: Whether recovered or defiled, shadeglass treasures are the key to escaping Shadespire.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you hold objectives 1 and 2.

cards.name: Tactical Supremacy 3-4
cards.colourText: Bold strategy and ruthless aggression are the keys to victory.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you hold objectives 3 and 4.

cards.name: The Bigger They Are
cards.colourText: A cunning strike can topple even the biggest foe.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter takes an enemy fighter out of action with an Attack action that has a Damage characteristic of 1.

cards.name: The Harvest Begins
cards.colourText: 'Cut them down, and let great Nagash judge their worthless souls.'
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter makes an Attack action that damages three or more enemy fighters.

cards.name: Total Annihilation
cards.colourText: Times of respite are hard won in the Mirrored City, and as precious as ur-gold.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the first or second end phase if all enemy fighters have been taken out of action.

cards.name: Trapped
cards.colourText: Nowhere to run. Nowhere to hide.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if an enemy fighter takes damage from a friendly fighter's Attack action because they cannot be driven back.

cards.name: Twilight Conqueror
cards.colourText: 'One precise strike from the shadows can end a long and bloody war.' - Elias Swiftblade
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all of your surviving fighters (at least three) are neither in your territory nor enemy territory.

cards.name: Unbroken Wall
cards.colourText: A solid, well-drilled shield wall can keep almost any foe at bay.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all surviving friendly fighters (at least three) are in a single group with each friendly fighter adjacent to another friendly fighter.

cards.name: Unstoppable
cards.colourText: There is a way past even the most formidable defence.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if one of your fighters makes a successful Attack action against an enemy fighter on Guard.

cards.name: Victorious Duel
cards.colourText: Even in Shadespire, where life and death are but reflections in a mirror, a champion's defeat is inglorious.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your leader takes an enemy leader out of action.

cards.name: Victory After Victory
cards.colourText: Never relent, and never allow your enemy to recover. Momentum is everything in war.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you scored three or more other objective cards in this round.

cards.name: War of Attrition
cards.colourText: Wars can be won simply by having more lives to hurl into the grinder than your foe.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if the same number of fighters (at least one) from each warband are out of action.

cards.name: Anticipation
cards.colourText: 'All too predictable.'
cards.rulesText: Play this card after the final activation in an action phase. Name an objective card. If an opponent scores that objective in the end phase, score a glory point.

cards.name: Blinding Flash
cards.colourText: A sudden burst of blinding light illuminates the battlefield.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this during an Attack action with a Range of 3 or greater (before any dice are rolled). The Attacks characteristic of that Attack action is changed to 1.

cards.name: Confused Priorities
cards.colourText: 'I've got it! Wait... what?'
cards.rulesText: Switch two objectives that are currently being held.

cards.name: Confusion
cards.colourText: It pays to keep your enemy guessing.
cards.rulesText: Choose two fighters that are adjacent to each other and switch them.

cards.name: Cruel Taunt
cards.colourText: 'Do you not recognise your friend? That's his flayed hide I wear upon my back.' - Ghartok Flayskull
cards.rulesText: Choose an enemy fighter and roll an attack dice. On a roll of or they are no longer Inspired, and cannot be Inspired this game.

cards.name: Curious Inversion
cards.colourText: No warrior is beyond defeat, for their greatest strength can quickly become their biggest weakness.
cards.rulesText: For the first Attack action in the next activation, characteristics become characteristics and vice versa, and characteristics become characteristics and vice versa.

cards.name: Darkness Descends
cards.colourText: The refracted beam of light that illuminated this dingy corner of the city is cut off in an instant, leaving all in the confusion of utter darkness.
cards.rulesText: The first Attack action in the next activation has a Range of 1.

cards.name: Daylight Robbery
cards.colourText: 'It was here a moment ago!'
cards.rulesText: Roll an attack dice. If you roll a or take one of your opponent's unspent glory points.

cards.name: Death Throes
cards.colourText: This fighter carries on swinging even as their lifeblood drains away.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this card during an Attack action or ploy that will take a friendly fighter out of action. Choose an enemy fighter adjacent to the target. They suffer 1 damage.

cards.name: Desperate Gambit
cards.colourText: Sometimes all one can do is roll the knucklebones and hope for good fortune.
cards.rulesText: When resolving the first Attack action in the next activation, you and your opponent roll off. The winner chooses whether the Attack action fails or succeeds.

cards.name: Distraction
cards.colourText: Battles are won by ensuring your foe is confused and off-balance.
cards.rulesText: Choose an enemy fighter and push them one hex.

cards.name: Dual Strike
cards.colourText: Many hands make light work of the enemy.
cards.rulesText: One fighter supporting the first Attack action in the next activation is considered to be two supporting fighters.

cards.name: Duel of Wits
cards.colourText: 'He's a clever one, this wretch. That won't stop me gutting him.' - Magore Redhand
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this when an opponent plays a ploy. Draw two power cards.

cards.name: Earthquake
cards.colourText: The earth shakes and warps beneath the combatants, as if the city of Shadespire itself is angry at their trespassing.
