cards.rulesText: Push all fighters one hex. You must push them all in the same direction. Any that cannot be pushed this way are not pushed.

cards.name: Ephemeral Shield
cards.colourText: A blow that should have felled this fighter is rebuffed by an unseen force.
cards.rulesText: The first friendly fighter to be targeted by an Attack action in the next activation has +1 Defence.

cards.name: Flickering Step
cards.colourText: Reality twists and flickers, and this fighter re-emerges on the far side of the battlefield.
cards.rulesText: Roll eight dice. Choose a friendly fighter and push them up to a number of hexes equal to the number of rolled.

cards.name: Forceful Denial
cards.colourText: Even the best-laid plans may be disrupted by a determined foe.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this when an opponent plays a ploy. Roll a defence dice. On a roll of or that ploy has no effect.

cards.name: Fortify
cards.colourText: 'Hold the line!'
cards.rulesText: Friendly fighters holding objectives have +1 Defence for the next activation.

cards.name: Frozen In Time
cards.colourText: Time flows differently in Shadespire, for every single inhabitant.
cards.rulesText: Choose an enemy fighter and roll a defence dice. On a roll of or that fighter cannot make any actions or be damaged in this phase.

cards.name: Fuelled by Fury
cards.colourText: Enraged that the foe escaped their strike, this warrior whips their blade back across for a killing blow.
cards.rulesText: You can re-roll any attack dice for the first friendly fighter's Attack action in the next activation.

cards.name: Grapple
cards.colourText: 'You're going nowhere.'
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an adjacent enemy fighter makes an Attack action that drives a friendly fighter back. Push the attacker into the hex the friendly fighter was driven back from.

cards.name: Great Concussion
cards.colourText: A thunderous blast echoes across the battlefield, sending bodies flying in all directions.
cards.rulesText: Choose a hex on the battlefield, then push all fighters one hex (in whichever order you choose). This push must move them away from the chosen hex. If there is no hex you could push a fighter into, do not push them.

cards.name: Healing Potion
cards.colourText: With just one draught of this shimmering liquid, wounds begin to close up.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter and roll a defence dice. On a roll of or remove up to two wound tokens from them. Otherwise remove one wound token from them.

cards.name: Hidden Paths
cards.colourText: Endless and impossible are the twisting paths of Shadespire.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter that hasn't made a Move action this phase and is on any edge hex. Place them on any other edge hex. They are considered to have made a Move action.

cards.name: Illusory Fighter
cards.colourText: In an instant the image of this fighter shatters into a thousand pieces, only to reform anew several yards away.
cards.rulesText: Choose one of your fighters on the battlefield. Place them on a starting hex in your territory.

cards.name: Improvisation
cards.colourText: 'This isn't working. We need to try something different.'
cards.rulesText: Discard all power cards in your hand and draw three power cards.

cards.name: Inspiration Strikes
cards.colourText: Inspiration can strike at the most unlikely of moments.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter. They become Inspired.

cards.name: Invisible Walls
cards.colourText: In Shadespire, one cannot trust their eyes to reveal the truth.
cards.rulesText: All fighters' Move characteristics are reduced to 1 for the next activation.

cards.name: Last Chance
cards.colourText: A long life is a lucky life.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this during an Attack action that would take a friendly fighter out of action. Roll a defence dice. If the result would not normally be a success for this fighter, ignore the damage from that Attack action on this fighter.

cards.name: Legacy
cards.colourText: The memory of the fallen inspires the living to great deeds.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action or ploy that takes a friendly fighter out of action. Choose one of their universal upgrades and give it to an adjacent friendly fighter.

cards.name: Lethal Strike
cards.colourText: One well-aimed strike cuts deeper than a dozen wild swings.
cards.rulesText: If the first Attack action in the next activation is a critical hit, double its Damage characteristic for that Attack action.

cards.name: Mighty Swing
cards.colourText: With a sudden surge of vigour, this fighter hews through multiple opponents.
cards.rulesText: Your first Attack action with a Range characteristic of 1 in the next activation targets all adjacent enemy fighters. Roll for each.

cards.name: Mischievous Spirits
cards.colourText: A mysterious spectral force ripples through the air, leaving chaos and confusion in its wake.
cards.rulesText: Taking it in turns with your opponent(s), starting with you and going clockwise, move each objective one hex. Objectives cannot be moved into a hex that already contains an objective.

cards.name: Misdirection
cards.colourText: Trickery can sometimes win the day when might alone cannot.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this when a friendly fighter is chosen by a ploy. Choose another friendly fighter that could be chosen by that ploy. That fighter is chosen instead.

cards.name: Momentary Madness
cards.colourText: Wits can snap without warning in the Mirrored City, often with violent results.
cards.rulesText: Choose an enemy fighter and roll an attack dice. If you roll a or make an Attack action with them as if they were a friendly fighter. Fighters do not provide support for this Attack action (in attack or defence).

cards.name: My Turn
cards.colourText: 'Is that your best effort, wretch? Here, let me show you how to do it.' - Obryn the Bold
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action or ploy that damages a friendly fighter. Push them up to one hex and make an Attack action with them.

cards.name: No Time
cards.colourText: Time has many paths. Some are dead ends.
cards.rulesText: No more power cards can be played until after the next activation.

cards.name: On Your Feet
cards.colourText: 'Get up and get back in the fight. We have heathens to slay.' - Severin Steelheart
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this during an Attack action or ploy that would take a friendly fighter out of action, when there is a friendly fighter adjacent to them. Roll a defence dice. On a roll of or the fighter does not suffer damage and is not taken out of action.

cards.name: Parry
cards.colourText: The ring of steel on steel fills the air as blades clash and counter too fast for the eye to follow.
cards.rulesText: The first time one of your fighters is targeted in the next activation, roll an extra defence dice. When counting your successes, ignore one of the defence dice.

cards.name: Quick Thinker
cards.colourText: 'Study the movement of your foe. When they make a mistake, do not hesitate to strike.'
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an enemy fighter's Move action. Make a Move action with a friendly fighter who has not already made a Move action in this phase.

cards.name: Ready for Action
cards.colourText: The prepared warrior shall prevail.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after you upgrade a fighter in an action phase. They can make a Move or Attack action.

cards.name: Rebound
cards.colourText: This strike deflects harmlessly off its intended target, and the weapon flies back towards its wielder with lethal force.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this during an enemy Attack action that would succeed. Roll a defence dice. On a roll of or the attacker suffers the damage, rather than the target, and neither fighter is driven back.

cards.name: Reflected Injury
cards.colourText: Somehow one warrior's injury appears upon the flesh of another.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter with at least one wound token, and an adjacent enemy fighter. The enemy fighter suffers 1 damage.

cards.name: Rethink Strategy
cards.colourText: 'It is the commander who sees the flow of battle and alters his strategy accordingly who shall win the day.' - Lord-Celestant Mykos Argellon
cards.rulesText: Discard any number of objective cards and draw that number of objective cards.

cards.name: Sacrificial Pawn
cards.colourText: 'Much must be sacrificed in order to achieve victory.' - Teachings of the Champions of Shadespire
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter. If they are taken out of action in the next activation, you gain a glory point.

cards.name: Scavenge
cards.colourText: 'Yes-yes, strip the bodies. Take their shinies.' - Krrk the Almost-trusted
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that takes an adjacent enemy fighter with an upgrade out of action. Gain an additional glory point.

cards.name: Second Wind
cards.colourText: 'The dead don't rest. Why should we?' - Fjul-Grimnir
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter that made a Charge action this phase. In the next activation, they can be activated as if they had Moved rather than Charged.

cards.name: Shardfall
cards.colourText: Even the best laid plans can fall to ruin.
cards.rulesText: Place a Shardfall token in an unoccupied hex. That hex is blocked until the end of the phase.

cards.name: Shardgale
cards.colourText: From above comes the sound of shattering glass, and a tempest of jagged, glittering shards whips down from on high.
cards.rulesText: All fighters suffer 1 damage.

cards.name: Shattering Terrain
cards.colourText: The ground itself shatters like a broken glass pane, stone and earth splintering into jagged shards.
cards.rulesText: Any fighters that make a Move action, are pushed or are driven back in the next activation suffer 1 damage.

cards.name: Shattershard
cards.colourText: A treasured possession of your enemy shatters into fragments, scattering on the ground like dust.
cards.rulesText: Choose an enemy fighter, and choose one of their upgrades. Roll an attack dice. On a roll of or that upgrade is discarded.

cards.name: Shifting Shards
cards.colourText: It is as if the city of Shadespire itself is taunting its inhabitants, dangling the promise of salvation forever out of reach.
cards.rulesText: Move an unheld objective one hex. You cannot move it into a hex that already contains an objective.

cards.name: Sidestep
cards.colourText: Quick footwork can position a warrior for the killing blow.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter and push them one hex.

cards.name: Spectral Wings
cards.colourText: For a moment it seems this fighter has taken on the form of a spectral wraith, as bony wings spread wide to take flight.
cards.rulesText: The first fighter to make a Move action in the next activation has +2 Move.

cards.name: Spoils of Battle
cards.colourText: 'Glory, pride, honour - I would trade it all for a good blade.'
cards.rulesText: Play an upgrade card. This doesn't cost a glory point.

cards.name: Sprint
cards.colourText: In some battles, strength is no match for speed.
cards.rulesText: Double the Move characteristic of the first friendly fighter to make a Move action in the next activation. They may not make a Charge action. Once they have moved, they cannot be activated again in this phase.

cards.name: Stumble
cards.colourText: In combat, a single misstep can be the difference between life and death.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action drives an enemy fighter back. They are driven back an additional hex in the same direction.

cards.name: Tainted Vitality
cards.colourText: Let your flesh writhe with the power of corruption.
cards.rulesText: Remove one wound token from each fighter who has at least one wound token.

cards.name: Tantalising Prize
cards.colourText: 'It is mine! I must have it!'
cards.rulesText: The first friendly fighter to take a Move action in the next activation can move up to an additional two hexes if they end their move on an objective.

cards.name: Teamwork
cards.colourText: The lone wolf is dangerous, but it is the pack that claims the kill.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this card during a friendly fighter's Attack action, before rolling any dice. Push another friendly fighter one hex.

cards.name: Time Trap
cards.colourText: Time does not flow as it should in the Mirrored City. Memories become actions, become vague visions of the future.
cards.rulesText: Choose a fighter. They can take an action. Skip your next activation (you cannot play this card after your fourth activation).

cards.name: Trap
cards.colourText: A canny fighter is always aware of their surroundings, and will use them to their advantage.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this during a friendly fighter's Attack action that drives an enemy fighter back. The enemy fighter suffers 1 damage.

cards.name: Triumphant Roar
cards.colourText: 'There is naught so sweet as victory.' - Obryn the Bold
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that takes an enemy fighter out of action. You can push each enemy fighter adjacent to the friendly fighter one hex.

cards.name: Trust to Luck
cards.colourText: Planning is no substitute for good fortune.
cards.rulesText: Discard any number of power cards and draw up to that number of power cards from your deck.

cards.name: Twist the Knife
cards.colourText: 'Stab-sink the blade, twist it in deep, deep, deep. Watch them bleed.' - Krrk the Almost-trusted
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this during a friendly fighter's Attack action that has a Range of 1 and will succeed. It has +1 Damage for that Attack action.

cards.name: A Destiny to Meet
cards.colourText: 'One lifetime is too short a span to achieve the greatness of which we are capable.' - Grand Katophrane Fayrem Al'mwe
cards.rulesText: If this fighter is not out of action at the end of the third action phase, gain 1 additional glory point.

cards.name: Acrobatic
cards.colourText: This warrior is capable of astonishing feats of agility.
cards.rulesText: If this fighter has a Defence characteristic or has a Defence characteristic but is on Guard, roll an extra defence dice when they are the target of an Attack action.

cards.name: Army of One
cards.colourText: The greatest heroes are born in the darkest hours.
cards.rulesText: If this fighter is the last friendly fighter on the battlefield, they have +1 Defence and all of their Attack actions have +1 Dice.

cards.name: Awakened Weapon
cards.colourText: A good blade is an invaluable ally.
cards.rulesText: You can re-roll one attack dice each time this fighter makes an Attack action.

cards.name: Blessed Armour
cards.colourText: This warrior's armour carries the fortune of the gods.
cards.rulesText: When you roll a for this fighter when they are targeted by an Attack action, remove one wound token from them before any damage is dealt.

cards.name: Concealed Weapon
cards.colourText: 'The subtle blade cuts deepest.' - Aelven proverb
cards.rulesText: On a critical hit, this fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 have +2 Damage.

cards.name: Coordinated Attack
cards.colourText: Two or more fighters working in concert can bring down a far mightier foe.
cards.rulesText: When making this Attack action, roll an extra attack dice for each other friendly fighter adjacent to the target.

cards.name: Cunning Duellist
cards.colourText: 'A good swordsman masters his footwork before his blade.' - Elias Swiftblade
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During this fighter's Attack action that succeeds against an adjacent enemy fighter, instead of driving the target back you can switch the two fighters' places.

cards.name: Cursed Artefact
cards.colourText: The treasures of Shadespire are of great value, but all come with a cost.
cards.rulesText: +1 Defence, -1 Wounds

cards.name: Daemonic Weapon
cards.colourText: This cursed axe hungers for slaughter and carnage.
cards.rulesText: Each time this fighter makes this Attack action, they first suffer 1 damage.

cards.name: Dark Darts
cards.colourText: A handful of glass darts make unexpected and deadly weapons.

cards.name: Deathly Fortitude
cards.colourText: This fighter has spent so long in Shadespire that their body is beginning to rot away, leaving hard bones and desiccated flesh behind.
cards.rulesText: -2 Move, +2 Wounds

cards.name: Disengage
cards.colourText: Sometimes discretion is the better part of valour.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After this Attack action, if it is successful, you can push this fighter one hex.

cards.name: Ethereal Shield
cards.colourText: An aura of flickering lights surrounds this fighter, protecting them from physical attacks.
cards.rulesText: This fighter's Defence characteristic changes to .

cards.name: Flickering Image
cards.colourText: This fighter seems to flicker and disappear at random, emerging behind his foes with his sword ready.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After an Attack action made by this fighter that scores a critical hit, you can push them up to two hexes.

cards.name: Ghostblade
cards.colourText: This spectral weapon flickers and shifts like smoke in the breeze.
cards.rulesText: When rolling defence dice, only rolls of are successes for the target of this Attack action. This Attack action can never cause more than 1 damage to a target.

cards.name: Great Fortitude
cards.colourText: This warrior can take a strike from a drunken gargant and keep on fighting.
cards.rulesText: +1 Wounds

cards.name: Great Speed
cards.colourText: This warrior is as swift as a loosed arrow.
cards.rulesText: +1 Move

cards.name: Great Strength
cards.colourText: This warrior strikes with the strength of a river troggoth.
cards.rulesText: +1 Damage to all Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2

cards.name: Headlong Charge
cards.colourText: This warrior charges with surprising speed, desperate to engage their foe.
cards.rulesText: When this fighter makes a Charge action, increase their Move characteristic by 1 until the end of the activation.

cards.name: Helpful Whispers
cards.colourText: In the darkness of Shadespire, aid can come from unexpected quarters.
cards.rulesText: If this fighter has no adjacent friendly fighters, rolls of are a success when they make an Attack action.

cards.name: Heroslayer
cards.colourText: Even the mightiest foe can be slain.

cards.name: Incredible Strength
cards.colourText: This warrior's blows are as devastating as a gore-grunta's charge.
cards.rulesText: +1 Damage to all Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2

cards.name: Katophrane's Belt
cards.colourText: Katophrane Relic
cards.rulesText: If this fighter has two or more Katophrane Relics, they gain the following (cumulative) abilities.

cards.name: Katophrane's Boots
cards.colourText: Katophrane Relic
cards.rulesText: If this fighter has two or more Katophrane Relics, they gain the following (cumulative) abilities.

cards.name: Katophrane's Gloves
cards.colourText: Katophrane Relic
cards.rulesText: If this fighter has two or more Katophrane Relics, they gain the following (cumulative) abilities.

cards.name: Katophrane's Hood
cards.colourText: Katophrane Relic
cards.rulesText: If this fighter has two or more Katophrane Relics, they gain the following (cumulative) abilities.

cards.name: Katophrane's Locket
cards.colourText: Katophrane Relic
cards.rulesText: If this fighter has two or more Katophrane Relics, they gain the following (cumulative) abilities.

cards.name: Katophrane's Plate
cards.colourText: Katophrane Relic
cards.rulesText: If this fighter has two or more Katophrane Relics, they gain the following (cumulative) abilities.

cards.name: Legendary Swiftness
cards.colourText: Some warriors are blessed with almost unnatural agility.
cards.rulesText: +1 Move

cards.name: Light Armour
cards.colourText: Lighter armour allows a fighter to strike with deadly grace, but leaves them vulnerable to a solid hit.
cards.rulesText: Rolls of on a defence dice are no longer a success for this fighter. Roll an extra attack dice when this fighter makes an Attack action.

cards.name: Light-footed
cards.colourText: Nimble and sure-footed, this warrior dances around their opponent with ease.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an Attack action that could drive this fighter back (whether or not your opponent chose to), you can instead push them one hex.

cards.name: Low Blow
cards.colourText: Honour is eternal, but expediency wins wars.
cards.rulesText: Both and symbols are successes for this Attack action.

cards.name: Opportunist
cards.colourText: When an enemy leaves an opening, this warrior is quick to take advantage.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After a failed Attack action that targets this fighter, you can push them one hex.

cards.name: Regeneration
cards.colourText: The artificer-mages of Shadespire crafted amulets and rings that could heal the bearer's wounds.
cards.rulesText: At the beginning of each action phase, remove up to one wound token from this fighter.

cards.name: Second-in-command
cards.colourText: Good leaders surround themselves with capable lieutenants.
cards.rulesText: If your warband's leader is out of action, this fighter is considered to be a leader. While this fighter is on the battlefield, opponents cannot score objectives for having taken your leader out of action.

cards.name: Shadeglass Axe
cards.rulesText: When this Attack action is successful, discard this upgrade. On a critical hit, this Attack action has +1 Damage.

cards.name: Shadeglass Dagger
cards.colourText: A popular weapon for Shadespire assassins, these daggers shatter upon impact.
cards.rulesText: When this Attack action is successful, discard this upgrade. On a critical hit, this Attack action has +1 Damage.

cards.name: Shadeglass Darts
cards.colourText: A well-thrown sliver of Shadeglass can slice through flesh as easily as tempered steel.
cards.rulesText: On a critical hit, this Attack action has +1 Damage.

cards.name: Shadeglass Hammer
cards.colourText: While clearly an ornamental weapon, getting struck with it is still a bad idea.
cards.rulesText: When this Attack action is successful, discard this upgrade. On a critical hit, this Attack action has +1 Damage.

cards.name: Shadeglass Spear
cards.colourText: The Katophranes' personal guard were armed with ceremonial spears, tipped with shadeglass.
cards.rulesText: When this Attack action is successful, discard this upgrade. On a critical hit, this Attack action has +1 Damage.

cards.name: Shadeglass Sword
cards.colourText: This glass blade shatters into a thousand pieces as it sinks into flesh.
cards.rulesText: When this Attack action is successful, discard this upgrade. On a critical hit, this Attack action has +1 Damage.

cards.name: Shadestep
cards.colourText: Light can be blocked, but the shadows know no such boundaries.
cards.rulesText: This fighter can move through other fighters during a Move action, but must end their move in an empty hex.

cards.name: Shardcaller
cards.colourText: Some denizens of the Mirrored City develop a strange connection with the shadeglass they seek.
cards.rulesText: At the beginning of each action phase, you can switch an objective held by this fighter with any other objective.

cards.name: Shifting Image
cards.colourText: 'It doesn't make sense. No one can move that fast.'
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After any Attack action in which you roll a for this fighter (with an attack or defence dice), you can push this fighter one hex.

cards.name: Sixth Sense
cards.colourText: To survive, a fighter must learn to watch their own back.
cards.rulesText: Your opponent can never consider a as a success for Attack actions that target this fighter.

cards.name: Solid Stance
cards.colourText: A well-trained warrior learns how to stand tall in the face of the enemy, not giving them an inch.
cards.rulesText: This fighter can only be driven back by a critical hit.

cards.name: Soultrap
cards.colourText: Shadeglass once preserved the souls of the honoured dead - now it condemns all within Shadespire to an eternity of suffering.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an Attack action or ploy that takes this fighter out of action, roll a defence dice. If you roll a or they suffer no damage and are not taken out of action, and you discard this upgrade.

cards.name: Sprinter
cards.colourText: This warrior is blindingly fast.
cards.rulesText: +1 Move

cards.name: Superior Agility
cards.colourText: This warrior is so light on their feet that it's almost impossible to predict their movement.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an Attack action that could drive this fighter back (whether or not your opponent chooses to), you can instead push them one hex.

cards.name: Swift Strike
cards.colourText: Objects in the Mirrored City are often closer than they appear.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Before making this Attack action, push this fighter one hex.

cards.name: Tethered Spirit
cards.colourText: The Mirrored City lays claim to every soul within its borders. Even seemingly mortal wounds do not grant the peace of death.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an Attack action or ploy that takes this fighter out of action, roll a defence dice. If you roll a or place them on any starting hex in your territory, ignore the damage and discard this upgrade. If you cannot, they are taken out of action.

cards.name: The Blazing Key
cards.colourText: With this key is the radiance of the Lux Magnica brought forth, to light one's way amidst the darkness.
cards.rulesText: If this fighter is holding objective 3 in the third end phase, score 2 glory points.

cards.name: The Dazzling Key
cards.colourText: One must possess this key to unlock the Tome of Enlightened Truth, in which the secrets of refining shadeglass are stored.
cards.rulesText: If this fighter is holding objective 4 in the third end phase, score 2 glory points.

cards.name: The Formless Key
cards.colourText: The God of Death forged his own key, a formless wisp of soul matter and darkest magic, and with this he unbound the city's wards and cursed it to an eternity of suffering.
cards.rulesText: If this fighter is holding an objective in the third end phase, score 1 glory point.

cards.name: The Fractured Key
cards.colourText: Trembling with barely suppressed energy, the Fractured Key unlocks the earth-shattering power of the Katolith, which can bring down the tallest spire.
cards.rulesText: If this fighter is holding objective 5 in the third end phase, score 2 glory points.

cards.name: The Hallowed Key
cards.colourText: Only the bearer of the Hallowed Key may wear the Watcher's Helm, which sees past all illusions.
cards.rulesText: If this fighter is holding objective 1 in the third end phase, score 2 glory points.

cards.name: The Shadowed Key
cards.colourText: Tempered in the soul-forges deep beneath Shadespire, the Shadowed Key allows the bearer of a shadeglass scrying orb to gaze into every corner of the Mirrored City.
cards.rulesText: If this fighter is holding objective 2 in the third end phase, score 2 glory points.

cards.name: Total Offence
cards.colourText: Focusing all their strength into a single blow, this fighter lashes out with lethal force.
cards.rulesText: You can roll two additional attack dice when this fighter takes an Attack action, though not when this fighter takes a Charge action. If you do so, this fighter cannot be activated again this phase.

cards.name: Trickster's Charm
cards.colourText: 'Lady Fortune smiles upon me once again!'
cards.rulesText: If this fighter is on the battlefield, you can play a single ploy card at the beginning of each action phase.

cards.name: Trusted Defender
cards.colourText: 'You can count on me. They're not getting past.' - Angharad Brightshield
cards.rulesText: You can re-roll one defence dice for this fighter when they are the target of an Attack action.

cards.name: Unparalleled Strike
cards.colourText: 'Pour all your fury into a single blow, and watch the blood fly.' - Garrek Gorebeard
cards.rulesText: Rolls of are considered to be rolls of for this Attack action.

cards.name: Vampiric Weapon
cards.colourText: This ornate blade gleams with a pale, green corpse-light and feeds hungrily upon spilled blood.
cards.rulesText: When this fighter takes an enemy fighter out of action, remove one wound token from this fighter.

cards.name: War Cry
cards.colourText: A blood-curdling war cry can cause even well-trained warriors to flinch.
cards.rulesText: When this fighter makes a Charge action, their Attack actions gain Knockback 1 for that activation.

cards.name: Zealous Defender
cards.colourText: 'I'll hold this spot or I'll die trying, sir.' - Angharad Brightshield
cards.rulesText: This fighter is considered to have an additional supporting fighter while they are holding an objective.

cards.name: Invulnerable
cards.colourText: 'The God-King alone knows what it would take to keep you down, Severin.' - Obryn the Bold
cards.rulesText: Your leader has +1 Defence for the first Attack action in the next activation.

cards.name: Steelheart's Second
cards.colourText: Like every good war leader, Steelheart has chosen his right hand well.
cards.rulesText: This fighter's Attack actions have +1 Damage when they are adjacent to a friendly leader.

cards.name: The Stage Is Set
cards.colourText: 'Just us, then. Worry not, you'll join your butchered friends soon enough.' - Garrek Gorebeard
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if the only surviving fighters (at least 2) are leaders.

cards.name: Coveted Trophy
cards.colourText: 'Don't know why he looked surprised when my axe found his neck. I told him his skull was mine.' - Garrek Gorebeard
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this when your leader takes an enemy leader out of action. Gain a glory point.

cards.name: Fervent Petition
cards.colourText: Surely such devotion cannot fail to gain the favour of the Great Necromancer?
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if three friendly Petitioners are surviving and Inspired.

cards.name: Warden's Call
cards.colourText: The Sepulchral Warden's words are the spoken will of the Great Necromancer.
cards.rulesText: Action: Choose two friendly fighters (other than your leader) and put them on Guard.

cards.name: Showin' Off
cards.colourText: 'Ain't none of you gits 'ard enough to face me?' - Gurzag Ironskull
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your leader took two or more enemy fighters out of action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Impress da Boss
cards.colourText: Impressing Ironskull in battle is a fine way of avoiding one of his lethal headbutts.
cards.rulesText: +1 Damage for the first Attack action in the next activation made by a friendly fighter adjacent to your leader.

cards.name: Pride of the Lodge
cards.colourText: Fjul-Grimnir is the embodiment of the Vostarg's indomitable spirit.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your leader has three or more upgrades with his warband symbol.

cards.name: Grimnir Commands
cards.colourText: Fjul-Grimnir's words carry the weight of a dead god's will.
cards.rulesText: The first friendly fighter (other than your leader) to make a Move action (not as part of a Charge action) in the next activation has +2 Move. You can only play this if your leader is on the battlefield.

cards.name: Krrk Now Leads!
cards.colourText: 'Yes-yes! Finally, the old rot-whiskers is dead and now Krrk is the master!' - Krrk the Almost-trusted
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your leader is out of action and a friendly fighter named Krrk is on the battlefield.

cards.name: Krrk the Clawchief
cards.colourText: Day by day, scheme by cunning scheme, Krrk prepares for his inevitable betrayal of his master.
cards.rulesText: Action: Return a friendly fighter (other than Skritch) to the battlefield in an empty hex adjacent to this fighter.

cards.name: Khorne's Chosen
cards.colourText: 'I will be the greatest of Khorne's servants, and by my hand the realms will drown in blood.' - Magore Redhand
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your leader is the only surviving fighter.

cards.name: Gory Visage
cards.colourText: Foes find the strength sapped from their bodies as they look upon the blood-slathered madness of Magore Redhand.
cards.rulesText: Attack actions that target this fighter deal 1 less damage, to a minimum of 1.

cards.name: Intervention
cards.colourText: 'I believe that trinket you're holding belongs to us.' - Sanson Farstrider
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your leader takes an enemy holding an objective out of action.

cards.name: Raptor Strike
cards.colourText: Farstrider's loyal aetherwing Gyrfalche drops from the sky to rake its quarry's eyes.
cards.rulesText: Choose an enemy fighter within four hexes of your leader. They take 1 damage.

cards.name: Bold Advance
cards.colourText: A daring surge into enemy territory can reap great rewards.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the first end phase if your leader is in enemy territory.

cards.name: Drawing Focus
cards.colourText: The dynamic and inspiring presence of this war leader has dominated the battlefield.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your leader is chosen by three or more ploys in this phase.

cards.name: Fearless Leader
cards.colourText: Few generals are more admired than those who lead from the front.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your leader is the only friendly fighter adjacent to any enemy fighters.

cards.name: Great Slayer
cards.colourText: Truly, battle hymns will be sung of this warlord's slaughterous deeds.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your leader takes three or more enemy fighters out of action in this phase.

cards.name: Impervious
cards.colourText: Try as they might, the enemy cannot strike this warlord down.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your leader is on the battlefield and was the target of three or more Attack actions in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Linchpin
cards.colourText: The warlord fights as one with their warriors, lending their expertise and skill to every assault.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your leader was a supporting fighter during three or more Attack actions in this phase.

cards.name: Neutralise
cards.colourText: 'Not so tuff now, is ya!' - Bonekutta
cards.rulesText: Score this in the first end phase if an enemy leader is out of action.

cards.name: Shining Example
cards.colourText: Burning with righteous purpose, this warlord is a beacon of hope and inspiration to their warriors.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your leader is on the battlefield and Inspired.

cards.name: Slayer
cards.colourText: This warlord has hewn and torn apart all who have challenged them.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your leader takes two or more enemy fighters out of action in this phase.

cards.name: Sufficient
cards.colourText: 'Right den. More for me!' - Gurzag Ironskull
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your leader is the only friendly fighter on the battlefield.

cards.name: Tireless Commander
cards.colourText: In the Mirrored City, there is no reprieve from duty.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you activated your leader with four activations in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Undefeated
cards.colourText: This warlord has passed through the storm of blades unharmed.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if your leader is on the battlefield.

cards.name: Well-guarded
cards.colourText: This warlord's bodyguards do not stray from their master's side, even for a moment.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your leader is adjacent to two or more friendly fighters.

cards.name: Burden of Command
cards.colourText: In the Mirrored City, the crushing responsibility of leadership soon becomes an unbearable burden.
cards.rulesText: Choose an enemy leader. Their Move characteristic (before other modifiers) is 1 for the next activation.

cards.name: Cautious Commander
cards.colourText: 'Bravery is admirable. Rash action is not.' - Severin Steelheart
cards.rulesText: Put your leader on Guard.

cards.name: Commanding Reach
cards.colourText: A perilous lunge can catch an enemy warrior completely off guard.
cards.rulesText: Your leader's first Attack action with a Range of 1 that only targets a single fighter in the next activation has a Range of 2.

cards.name: Commanding Strike
cards.colourText: Lead by example.
cards.rulesText: You can re-roll one attack dice during your leader's first Attack action in the next activation.

cards.name: Crippling Doubt
cards.colourText: Once doubt has set in amongst the foe, your final victory is sure to follow.
cards.rulesText: Choose an enemy leader. The Dice characteristic (before other modifiers) of their first Attack action in the next activation is 1.

cards.name: Final Duty
cards.colourText: Not even imminent death can keep this warrior from carrying out his duty.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this during an Attack action that will take your leader out of action, before they are removed from the battlefield. Roll an attack dice. On a roll of or , make an Attack action with them before they are removed from the battlefield.

cards.name: Great Cunning
cards.colourText: 'Look-look, those foolish man-things blunder straight into my trap.' - Skritch Spiteclaw
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after you play a power card in the power step. You can immediately play another power card. You can only play this if your leader is on the battlefield.

cards.name: Hidden Reserves
cards.colourText: It takes more than a grievous wound to keep this warrior down.
cards.rulesText: Remove one wound token from your leader's fighter card.

cards.name: Inspired Command
cards.colourText: This leader's countless victories and tactical expertise inspire unquestioning loyalty in those under their command.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter (other than your leader) and push them up to one hex or put them on Guard. You can only play this if your leader is on the battlefield.

cards.name: Look Out!
cards.colourText: Rare are the leaders whose warriors would risk death to protect them.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this during an Attack action that will damage your leader. Roll a defence dice. On a roll of , or , choose a friendly fighter adjacent to them. That fighter suffers the damage instead, then 1 additional damage, and no fighters are driven back.

cards.name: No Retreat
cards.colourText: 'Stand firm, sons of Vostarg, and give them no ground.' - Fjul-Grimnir
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this during an Attack action that targets your leader, after the dice are rolled. Your leader cannot be driven back by this Attack action.

cards.name: Premonition
cards.colourText: Some form of prescience or inexplicable insight has kept this warrior alive through countless battles.
cards.rulesText: In the next activation, you can re-roll one or more defence dice when your leader is the target of an Attack action.

cards.name: Quick Advance
cards.colourText: 'Haste with purpose - that is the key to unsettling your enemies.' - Sanson Farstrider
cards.rulesText: Choose up to two friendly fighters (other than your leader) and push each of them up to one hex. You can only play this if your leader is on the battlefield.

cards.name: Quick Manoeuvre
cards.colourText: Moving in perfect synchronicity, this warrior and their commander swiftly reposition.
cards.rulesText: Choose your leader and an adjacent friendly fighter. Switch their positions.

cards.name: Tyrant's Command
cards.colourText: Fear is a powerful motivator.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter (other than your leader) that has a Move token. Remove that token: that fighter is not considered to have moved for the purposes of their subsequent actions. You can only play this if your leader is on the battlefield.

cards.name: Apex Predator
cards.colourText: This leader will suffer no one to challenge his mastery of the battlefield.
cards.rulesText: When this fighter takes an enemy leader out of action, gain an additional glory point.

cards.name: Commanding Presence
cards.colourText: Some warriors radiate confidence and composure in the heat of battle.
cards.rulesText: This fighter is considered to be two supporting fighters when it supports another fighter.

cards.name: Commanding Shout
cards.colourText: The ability to project one's voice above the clangour of battle is not to be underestimated.
cards.rulesText: Action: Push a friendly fighter (other than your leader) up to two hexes.

cards.name: Cursed Shield
cards.colourText: Though this shield can stop even the most fearsome strikes, its dark enchantments sap at its bearer's soul.
cards.rulesText: +1 Defence, -2 Wounds (to a minimum of 1)

cards.name: Hero's Mantle
cards.colourText: This relic was worn by an ancient general, and still radiates their inspiring will.
cards.rulesText: If this fighter is on the battlefield in the third end phase, gain 1 glory point.

cards.name: Irresistible Challenge
cards.colourText: 'Come cross your blade with mine, wretch, or is your fear of death too great?' - Severin Steelheart
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an adjacent enemy fighter's Attack action, before any dice are rolled, change the target of that Attack action to this fighter and discard this card.

cards.name: Katophrane's Ring
cards.colourText: Katophrane Relic
cards.rulesText: If this fighter has two or more Katophrane Relics, they gain the following (cumulative) abilities.

cards.name: Kingsbane
cards.colourText: This blade has tasted the blood of kings, queens and emperors beyond counting.
cards.rulesText: If the target is a leader, you can re-roll one attack dice when making this Attack action.

cards.name: Loyal Defender
cards.colourText: The greatest champions inspire unswerving loyalty in their followers.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After an enemy fighter makes a Move action and ends their move adjacent to another friendly fighter that is your leader, push this fighter up to two hexes. They must end the push adjacent to the enemy fighter.

cards.name: Master of Tactics
cards.colourText: There is no battlefield this strategist cannot conquer, no defeat they cannot turn to victory.
cards.rulesText: If this fighter is on the battlefield, at the beginning of the round you can draw one objective card. If you do so, discard one objective card.

cards.name: Mighty Shove
cards.colourText: This warrior enjoys bullying and battering lesser warriors across the field of battle.
cards.rulesText: Action: Push an adjacent enemy fighter up to one hex.

cards.name: Rising to the Challenge
cards.colourText: The death of a leader reveals the true character of their warriors.
cards.rulesText: If your leader is out of action, this fighter has +1 Wounds and the Attack actions on their fighter card have +1 Dice.

cards.name: Seize the Day
cards.colourText: There are moments that can change the course of fate, if one only has the wit to see them.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After this fighter makes a Move action (not as part of a Charge action) discard this card. They do not gain a Move token and are not considered to have moved for the purposes of their subsequent actions.

cards.name: Treacherous Second
cards.colourText: When leading ambitious warriors, it pays to have eyes in the back of your head.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After an action or ploy that takes your leader out of action, if this fighter is on the battlefield, gain 1 glory point.

cards.name: Trusted Second
cards.colourText: 'No one I'd rather have at my side for this, Flamebearer.' - Fjul-Grimnir
cards.rulesText: If this fighter is supporting your leader, they are considered to be two supporting fighters.

cards.name: Tyrant's Lash
cards.colourText: 'Fail me a second time and I will carve open your belly and feed your worthless innards to Riptooth.' - Magore Redhand
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After an adjacent friendly fighter's Attack action that fails, that fighter takes 2 damage. If they survive, they can then make another Attack action.

cards.name: Blessed Banishment
cards.colourText: 'The light of the heavens burns away the taint of corruption.' - Ammis Dawnguard
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy leader out of action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Devastating Blow
cards.colourText: Stormsire's battle-wizards cut down their foes in a whirlwind of blades and lightning.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband took two or more enemy fighters out of action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Fight as One
cards.colourText: The warrior-mages of the Sacrosanct Chambers attack as one, with a flurry of graceful, interwoven strikes.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter makes an Attack action with two supporting friendly fighters.

cards.name: Harness the Storm
cards.colourText: With a gesture the aether-mage calls the storm to their fingertips, unleashing its devastating power upon the foe.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter successfully casts a spell.

cards.name: Heavily Armed
cards.colourText: Sigmar's arcane champions arm themselves with all manner of enchanted items.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if three or more surviving friendly fighters each have at least one upgrade.

cards.name: Magical Supremacy
cards.colourText: 'We are the storm and the flame. The blazing comet that strikes from the heavens. Turn now and run, or face your ruin.'
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband successfully cast two or more spells in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Measured Strike
cards.colourText: 'Magic is a dangerous tool indeed. One must channel it precisely, and to decisive effect.'
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter makes a successful Attack action that deals exactly enough damage to take their target out of action.

cards.name: Overwhelming Storm
cards.colourText: Few can stand before the unleashed power of the Sacrosanct Chambers.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you have more surviving fighters than your opponent.

cards.name: Purify the Earth
cards.colourText: 'Even this forsaken place will be cleansed by the light of the God-King.'
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you hold an objective held by an enemy fighter at the beginning of the round.

cards.name: Aetherwing Stance
cards.colourText: 'Let your opponents' attacks flow past you, like wind rushing over an aetherwing's feathers.' - Averon Stormsire
cards.rulesText: Friendly fighters have +1 Defence for the first Attack action in the next activation.

cards.name: Chain Lightning
cards.colourText: Trails of crackling lightning surround the caster, reaching out to sear the flesh from nearby foes.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, Scatter 3 from the caster's hex. Any enemy fighter in a hex in the chain suffers 1 damage.

cards.name: Cry of Thunder
cards.colourText: The caster unleashes a bellow of thunderous power that shatters stones and crumbles bones to dust.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose an enemy fighter. That fighter and any fighters adjacent to that fighter suffer 1 damage.

cards.name: Empathic Conduction
cards.colourText: 'The power of Sigmar's tempest cleanses us even as it destroys our foes.' - Averon Stormsire
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose a friendly fighter adjacent to the caster. Remove a wound token from that fighter's fighter card.

cards.name: Gather the Storm
cards.colourText: 'Let the tempest surge within you, its power growing with every passing moment. Only then unleash it, and see your foes swept aside.' - Rastus the Charmed
cards.rulesText: Innate () for the next spell your warband attempts to cast. This effect persists.

cards.name: Lightning Assault
cards.colourText: This warrior's weapons slash and weave in a blinding web of light, too fast for the eye to follow.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that fails. That fighter can make another Attack action that targets the same fighter.

cards.name: Lightning Step
cards.colourText: The caster transmutes into a streak of living lightning, surging forwards with startling speed.
cards.rulesText: The first friendly fighter to make a Move or Charge action in the next activation can move through occupied and blocked hexes, but must end their move in an empty hex.

cards.name: Safeguard Spirit
cards.colourText: 'We guide the spirits of fallen heroes to their rightful place at the God-King's side.' - Ammis Dawnguard
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action or gambit that takes a friendly fighter adjacent to another friendly fighter out of action. Your opponent doesn't score any glory points for taking that fighter out of action.

cards.name: Stormstrike
cards.colourText: The weapons of Sigmar's battle wizards crackle with fulminating energy, a devastating charge that is unleashed the moment they strike home.
cards.rulesText: +1 Damage to the first Attack action with a Range of 1 or 2 in the next activation

cards.name: Stormward
cards.colourText: The sheer force of the God-King's storm can turn aside an onslaught of lesser magic.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this during an enemy fighter's spell or spell Attack action, if the spell is cast. Roll a magic dice. On a roll of that spell is not cast and is not resolved.

cards.name: Blessed Blade
cards.colourText: It is said that Stormsire's blade was blessed by the Celestant-Prime himself, after the bloody battle of Gaspar's Hold.

cards.name: Corposant Staff
cards.colourText: A spear of lightning erupts from this weapon's tip, arcing out to sear flesh and char bone.
cards.rulesText: Spell Action (): If this spell is cast, choose a friendly fighter. Their Attack actions with a single target have +1 Range until the end of the phase.

cards.name: Disarming Blow
cards.colourText: Bursts of electricity wrack the victim, their weapon dropping from their grip as their muscles agonisingly convulse.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After an Attack action made by an adjacent enemy fighter that targets this fighter and fails, roll a defence dice. On a roll of or select an Attack action upgrade on the attacking fighter. That upgrade is discarded.

cards.name: Eye of the Storm
cards.colourText: Wizards of the Sacrosanct Chambers wield the fulminating energies of the heavens.
cards.rulesText: Innate ()

cards.name: Hurricane Step
cards.colourText: A sudden roaring gale sends the fighter rushing past their foe.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After this fighter's Attack action, push this fighter up to one hex.

cards.name: Lightning Whip
cards.colourText: A coil of lightning wraps around the foe, and the stench of burning flesh fills the air.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After this fighter's Attack action that succeeds, deal 1 additional damage to the target of that Attack action.

cards.name: Stunning Blow
cards.colourText: The Evocator blocks an attack with a blast of thunder, leaving their assailant reeling.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After an Attack action made by an adjacent enemy fighter that targets this fighter and fails, roll a defence dice. On a roll of or , place a Charge token next to the attacking fighter.

cards.name: Tempest's Might
cards.colourText: 'Surrender to the aetheric current. Let your body become a conduit for the raging storm.' - Ammis Dawnguard
cards.rulesText: +1 Damage to all spell Attack actions

cards.name: Unstoppable Zeal
cards.colourText: Rastus cuts the enemies of Order down with a merciless fervour born of fathomless contempt.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After this fighter's Attack action that takes an enemy fighter out of action, this fighter can make this Attack action.

cards.name: Warding Blast
cards.colourText: Ammis slams her enemies with a thundering emanation, sending them reeling.
cards.rulesText: Targets all adjacent enemies - roll for each.

cards.name: As Nagash Commands
cards.colourText: By decree of the Great Necromancer, the souls of all trespassers within the Mirrored City are forfeit.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if no enemy fighters are holding objectives.

cards.name: Death Sentence
cards.colourText: There is no escaping death. It claims all things in the end.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if three or more friendly fighters are adjacent to the same enemy fighter.

cards.name: Drag Them Down
cards.colourText: Those unfortunates taken into the Shadespire dungeons shall never see the light again.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if three or more friendly fighters made a successful Attack action in this phase.

cards.name: Execution
cards.colourText: 'Thou hast been marked, encroacher. Thy soul is damned.' - Varclav the Cruel
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy leader out of action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Swarming Spirits
cards.colourText: 'Let them feel the freezing claws of death close around their hearts.'
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if two or more friendly fighters moved through a hex occupied by an enemy fighter in this phase.

cards.name: Take the City
cards.colourText: 'This city belongs to the dead. And we shall claim it.' - The Briar Queen
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you hold all objectives on one or more game boards.

cards.name: The Vengeful Dead
cards.colourText: The hour of the dead has come.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all surviving friendly fighters (at least three) are Inspired.

cards.name: Treacherous Foe
cards.colourText: The dead care nothing for honour or mercy, only that the living share their wretched fate.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your warband makes a reaction.

cards.name: Vengeful Advance
cards.colourText: Shadespire is claimed by the spectral dead.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all surviving friendly fighters are in your opponent's territory.

cards.name: Drifting Advance
cards.colourText: Inexorable and terrifying is the advance of the spectral dead.
cards.rulesText: Push all friendly Chainrasps up to two hexes. This push must take them closer to the nearest enemy fighter in each case. If there is more than one nearest enemy fighter, you can choose which the Chainrasp is pushed towards.

cards.name: Endless Malice
cards.colourText: The dead despise the living, for mortals know nothing of true torment.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that fails. That fighter can make another Attack action that targets the same fighter.

cards.name: Grasping Chains
cards.colourText: Spectral chains ensnare the victim, rendering them helpless against the tearing claws of spiteful gheists.
cards.rulesText: Each friendly Chainrasp providing support in the first Attack action in the next activation is considered to be two supporting fighters.

cards.name: Howling Vortex
cards.colourText: A pitch-black void of shrieking winds opens in the air, dragging the victim towards it.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, push all enemy fighters up to one hex.

cards.name: Maddening Cackle
cards.colourText: Harsh, mocking laughter rings out over the clatter of combat.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an enemy fighter's Attack action that fails. That fighter is no longer Inspired, and cannot be Inspired. This effect persists.

cards.name: Rending Scream
cards.colourText: A howl of purest torment and malice sends icy daggers through the hearts of all who hear it.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, each enemy fighter adjacent to the caster suffers 1 damage.

cards.name: Spectral Parry
cards.colourText: It is no simple thing to land a telling blow upon a being of ethereal matter.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter that does not have a Guard token. Place a Guard token next to them.

cards.name: Spectral Touch
cards.colourText: The grasping fingers of a vengeful gheist can sink through armour to tear the flesh beneath.
cards.rulesText: The first Attack action in the next activation has Cleave.

cards.name: Sudden Appearance
cards.colourText: Gheists disappear and manifest at will, taunting and terrifying the living.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter and place them on any starting hex.

cards.name: Vengeful Curse
cards.colourText: Even as they are cast out of reality, gheists use the last of their strength to drag the living with them.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an enemy fighter's Attack action that takes an adjacent friendly fighter out of action. Their attacker suffers 1 damage.

cards.name: Chill Touch
cards.colourText: A single touch from this creature's ethereal claws can freeze the heart of its victim.
cards.rulesText: Rolls of are not successes for defence rolls made during Attack actions made by this fighter.

cards.name: Creeping Terror
cards.colourText: To feel an ethereal being pass through one's body is to be touched by the chill of the grave.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After this fighter makes a Move action, roll an attack dice for the first enemy fighter they moved through in that action. On a or , the enemy fighter suffers 1 damage.

cards.name: Curse of Unbinding
cards.colourText: The Briar Queen's mastery of magic allows her to wither spells and enchantments to nothing.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an enemy fighter's spell or spell Attack action, if the spell is cast and the caster is within three hexes of this fighter, roll a magic dice. On a roll of that spell is not cast and is not resolved.

cards.name: Driven by Hatred
cards.colourText: The spectral dead feel nothing but bitterness and spite.
cards.rulesText: +1 Dice to their Attack action when this fighter makes a Charge action

cards.name: Face of Death
cards.colourText: The countenance of a gheist is enough to unnerve all but the most redoubtable warriors.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an adjacent enemy fighter's Attack action, before any dice are rolled, roll a defence dice. On a roll of or , your opponent rolls 1 fewer dice for that Attack action (to a minimum of 1).

cards.name: Grasping Thorns
cards.colourText: The thorns of a black rose cut deep indeed.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After this fighter's successful Attack action, you can push the target of that Attack action up to two hexes. They must end this push adjacent to this fighter.

cards.name: Inescapable Vengeance
cards.colourText: Like the shadow of death, the Briar Queen will never stop hunting her foes.
cards.rulesText: When this fighter makes a Move or Charge action, instead of moving them normally you can place them on any starting hex.

cards.name: Sadistic Strike
cards.colourText: Even amongst his hateful kind, Varclav's cruelty stands out.
cards.rulesText: If the target has any wound tokens, this Attack action deals +2 Damage.

cards.name: Shacklegheist Chains
cards.colourText: Varclav drinks in the suffering of those he binds with his spectral chains.
cards.rulesText: When this fighter's Attack action takes an enemy fighter out of action, gain 1 additional glory point.

cards.name: Strangling Coil
cards.colourText: A spectral length of rope lashes out, wrapping around the victim's throat with the strength of a constricting serpent.

cards.name: Agents of Change
cards.colourText: To conjure sorcerous energies is to offer worship to almighty Tzeentch.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband successfully cast four or more spells in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Bind the City
cards.colourText: 'With each arcane locum that we secure, the Grand Binding draws closer.' - Vortemis the All-seeing
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you hold three or more objectives.

cards.name: Chosen by Destiny
cards.colourText: 'You'll serve Tzeentch better as an offering than an agent, you witless cretin.' - Narvia
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if either Narvia or Turosh from your warband is on the battlefield and the other is out of action.

cards.name: Eyes of the Master
cards.colourText: 'We are each of us but a swivelling orb within a seething nest of eyes. Through us, he sees all.'
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if there is at least one friendly fighter in each of the following: your territory, enemy territory, and no one's territory.

cards.name: Harness Knowledge
cards.colourText: The Katophranes left fonts of wisdom and power, for those with the wit to sup from them.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if the same friendly fighter has held the same objective at the end of two consecutive action phases.

cards.name: Master of Magic
cards.colourText: To prove yourself a master of the magical arts is to elevate yourself above your crude foes.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your warband successfully casts two or more spells in this phase.

cards.name: Rising Inferno
cards.colourText: 'Burn it all! Let naught but blackened ashes remain!'
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you caused 4 or more damage with spells in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Summoner
cards.colourText: 'Come forth, Y'xtil'prit! Sunder the veil, in Tzeentch's name I conjure thee!'
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately the second or subsequent time you use Vortemis' action to summon a Blue Horror.

cards.name: Ultimate Change
cards.colourText: No change bears more ritual significance than the final transition from life unto death.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband took two or more enemy fighters out of action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Blessing of Tzeentch
cards.colourText: The eye of Tzeentch turns towards the battlefield, causing arcane energies to swell.
cards.rulesText: Innate () for the first spell your warband attempts to cast in the next activation.

cards.name: Bound by Fate
cards.colourText: 'Blessed are those entwined within the weave of fate.' - Vortemis the All-seeing
cards.rulesText: Choose two friendly fighters that are within three hexes of each other. Switch their positions.

cards.name: Deceitful Step
cards.colourText: The fractal path weaves witherwhence, and leads where most you need to tread.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter that is not adjacent to an enemy fighter and roll a magic dice. On a roll of , place them on any starting hex. Otherwise, place them on any objective token. If you cannot, nothing happens.

cards.name: Driven by Ambition
cards.colourText: No greater motivator have the servants of Tzeentch than the selfish desire for power.
cards.rulesText: The first friendly fighter to make a Move action (not as part of a Charge action) in the next activation has +2 Move.

cards.name: Eidetic Memory
cards.colourText: K'charik recalls his every life, death and battle, and now he lets those echoes guide his blade.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action made by a friendly K'charik that fails. They can make another Attack action which targets the same fighter.

cards.name: Malicious Flames
cards.colourText: The fires of spite find swift purchase in the flesh of unwary foes.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this during an Attack action or gambit that has dealt enough damage to a friendly Brimstone Horrors to take it out of action, but before removing the fighter from the battlefield. Adjacent enemy fighters suffer 1 damage.

cards.name: Ravenous Flame
cards.colourText: The ground writhes and rumbles, belching tongues of all-consuming fire.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, Scatter 3 from any lethal hex. Any fighters in any hex in the chain suffer 1 damage.

cards.name: Shield of Fate
cards.colourText: The Disciples of Tzeentch can bind the energies of fate itself to ward off harm.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, the caster has +1 Defence. This spell persists until the caster is out of action or the end of the round, whichever happens first.

cards.name: Stolen Fate
cards.colourText: In Shadespire, victory's reflection can be shattered into shards of jagged defeat.
cards.rulesText: You can re-roll one dice for the attack roll of the first Attack action made by a friendly fighter in the next activation.

cards.name: Wracking Change
cards.colourText: Those engulfed by the raw power of Tzeentch are warped and twisted into fleshy ruin.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose an enemy fighter within 4 hexes of the caster. That fighter suffers 1 damage and 1 additional damage for each in the casting roll.

cards.name: Arcanite Shield
cards.colourText: Arcanite shields twitch with prescience, blocking enemy blows as though possessed.
cards.rulesText: This fighter's Defence characteristic changes to .

cards.name: Bizarre Capering
cards.colourText: 'Spin and whirl, leap like fire, dodge their blows and stoke their ire!' - N'xikt'ryp
cards.rulesText: +1 Defence

cards.name: Empowered Sorcery
cards.colourText: No greater practitioners of the arcane arts are there than the Magisters of Tzeentch.
cards.rulesText: +1 Damage to all Spell Attack actions

cards.name: Fateward
cards.colourText: You cannot strike one who already knows where your every blow will fall...
cards.rulesText: You can re-roll the defence roll for this fighter when it is the target of an Attack action.

cards.name: Fiery Blessing
cards.colourText: 'Fire begets fire, flame feeds flame. Now let the inferno rise!' - Narvia, Kairic Acolyte
cards.rulesText: +1 Dice to this fighter's Attack actions that have a Range of 3 or more

cards.name: Piercing Bolt
cards.colourText: Chanting words as jagged as splintered glass, Vortemis fashions his malice into a vicious magical projectile and hurls it forth.

cards.name: Scroll of Dark Arts
cards.colourText: Reading ancient invocations aloud empowers rituals of dark sorcery.
cards.rulesText: This fighter's Sorcerous Bolt Attack action has +1 Range.

cards.name: Silver Tether
cards.colourText: Another link is forged in the endless chain of twisted fate.
cards.rulesText: If this fighter is holding an objective in the third end phase, gain 1 glory point.

cards.name: Sorcerous Adept
cards.colourText: The greatest sorcerers of Tzeentch have magic flowing through their very veins.
cards.rulesText: Innate ()

cards.name: Strength of Arrogance
cards.colourText: 'The certainty of victory imparts might beyond reckoning.' - K'charik, Tzaangor
cards.rulesText: +1 Damage to all Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2

cards.name: Call that a Win
cards.colourText: For Moonclan Grots, living another day with your pockets stuffed with loot is often enough.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if there are five or more surviving friendly fighters.

cards.name: Dank Haven
cards.colourText: Sometimes victory is as simple as claiming a safe bolthole, and breathing easy for a spell.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if there are no enemy fighters in your territory.

cards.name: Flash Finale
cards.colourText: More than one warrior's storied career has ended in a flash of lurid light, a stink of brimstone, and a ragged greenskin cheer.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if an enemy fighter is taken out of action by a spell cast by your warband.

cards.name: Infestation
cards.colourText: 'Dis here's Grot property, so zog off before we stick ya.' - Zarbag
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you hold every objective.

cards.name: Mad Scurry
cards.colourText: 'Leg it ladz!' - Dibbz
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if at least five of your surviving fighters made a Move action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Malicious Kill
cards.colourText: The best kills are those your foe bemoans the most.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your warband takes an enemy fighter with two or more upgrades out of action.

cards.name: Obliterated
cards.colourText: Not so much 'killed' as 'struck entirely from the records of mortality itself'.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly Snirk Sourtongue is Inspired and takes an enemy fighter out of action.

cards.name: Scragged
cards.colourText: With sufficient numbers, even the biggest foe can be dragged down and shanked.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if an enemy fighter is taken out of action while adjacent to three or more friendly fighters.

cards.name: Vicious Killers
cards.colourText: Sometimes, quantity truly does outweigh quality.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if two or more friendly fighters made successful Attack actions that targeted the same fighter, and that fighter was taken out of action, in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Curse of da Bad Moon
cards.colourText: 'Only man in da moon I ever 'eard of was da one wot got scoffed by it!' - Zarbag
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose a hex within four hexes of the caster. Any fighter in that hex or any hex adjacent to it suffers 1 damage.

cards.name: Fungal Blessing
cards.colourText: Many Moonclan Grots wear a spiteball fungus around their necks, just in case they ever have to 'get their own back' from beyond the grave.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an enemy fighter's Attack action that takes an adjacent friendly fighter out of action. Their attacker suffers 1 damage.

cards.name: Jealous Hex
cards.colourText: 'Dis'll take that shiny-pants git down a peg or two!' - Zarbag
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose a fighter that has the highest Wounds characteristic on the battlefield. That fighter has -1 Wounds (to a minimum of 1). This spell persists until that fighter is out of action.

cards.name: Little Waaagh!
cards.colourText: With sufficient numbers and chagrin, Moonclan Grots can be remarkably dangerous.
cards.rulesText: +1 Dice to the first Attack action made by a friendly fighter in the next activation.

cards.name: Madcap Mushroom
cards.colourText: Nothing gives a Shaman's magic a little extra 'kaboom' like a madcap mushroom...
cards.rulesText: Innate () for the next spell your warband attempts to cast. The fighter casting the spell suffers 1 damage if there are any in that casting roll, rather than two or more .

cards.name: Make Some Noise
cards.colourText: 'Just make as much rakket as ya can, and try not to sound too tasty...' - Drizgit da Squig Herder
cards.rulesText: Choose up to two friendly Squigs and push each of them up to two hexes.

cards.name: 'Orrible Leer
cards.colourText: 'Oi, ratbags! Wrap yer eyes round this!' - Zarbag
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, push each enemy fighter adjacent to the caster up to one hex.

cards.name: Sneaky Stabbin'
cards.colourText: Nothing spoils an enemy's day like sticking them with the pointy end right between their shoulder blades.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, +1 Dice and Cleave to the first Attack action with a Range of 1 or 2 made by a friendly fighter in the next activation.

cards.name: Sneaky Step
cards.colourText: Sticking to the shadows makes it easy to sneak up on the enemy, or to slink away...
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter and push them one hex.

cards.name: Stab 'em in the Knee
cards.colourText: 'Face me, greenskin! We shall see who- ARGH! Why you little...' - Magore Redhand
cards.rulesText: If the first Attack action in the next activation has a Range of 1 or 2, it has +1 Damage for each supporting fighter after the first.

cards.name: Endless Whirl
cards.colourText: 'WaaAAaaAAaaAAaaAAaaGH!' - Snirk Sourtongue
cards.rulesText: Action: Each adjacent fighter suffers 1 damage. Use this action only if this fighter is Inspired.

cards.name: Extra Bouncy
cards.colourText: Few enemies are as disconcerting to face as a ricocheting fungoid meteor with a gob full of fangs.
cards.rulesText: When this fighter makes a Move or Charge action they can move through other fighters, but their move must end in an empty hex.

cards.name: Fiery Brand
cards.colourText: Even the most skilled enemy combatant has little answer to being set on fire.
cards.rulesText: On a critical hit, this fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 have +1 Damage.

cards.name: Grizzled Survivor
cards.colourText: Once you've been bitten by an angry squig, nothing else seems quite as dangerous.
cards.rulesText: +1 Defence

cards.name: Lurker
cards.colourText: Every Moonclan Grot loves to engage in the time-honoured tradition of 'lurkin' about'.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After a fighter is pushed a number of hexes, if that fighter was adjacent to this fighter before the push, push this fighter up to the same number of hexes. This fighter must end the push adjacent to the other fighter.

cards.name: Nasty Stabba
cards.colourText: A crude but effective weapon that does exactly what its name suggests.
cards.rulesText: This Attack action has +2 Dice if a friendly Prog is supporting this fighter.

cards.name: Ravenous
cards.colourText: A grown Cave Squig can devour a human in just three bites. Two, if it's feeling peckish.
cards.rulesText: +1 Damage to this fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1.

cards.name: Sniffer Spite
cards.colourText: However unwillingly, sniffer spites can be 'persuaded' to sniff out potent magic fungi.
cards.rulesText: If this fighter is in enemy territory in the third end phase, gain 1 glory point.

cards.name: Vindictive Glare
cards.colourText: Even the mightiest enemy can fall victim to 'da evil eye'.

cards.name: Volley Caller
cards.colourText: 'Not so much a rain of arrows as a light shower. Still hurt, though...' - Rastus the Charmed
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After this fighter makes the Grot Bow Attack action, an adjacent friendly fighter makes their Grot Bow Attack action.

cards.name: A Worthy Skull
cards.colourText: 'He killed well. He died well. Khorne shall savour this offering.' - Garrek Gorebeard
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy leader out of action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Blood for the Blood God!
cards.colourText: Bloodreavers do not care for subtle strategy. Theirs is the brutal force of an overwhelming charge.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if three or more of your fighters made a Charge action in this phase.

cards.name: Coward!
cards.colourText: To retreat is weakness, and the weak must be culled.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if an enemy fighter begins a Move action adjacent to one of your fighters and ends it adjacent to none of your fighters.

cards.name: Draw the Gaze of Khorne
cards.colourText: The Blood God marks well the names of those who commit great acts of slaughter in his name.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your warband takes two or more enemy fighters out of action in this phase.

cards.name: It Begins
cards.colourText: 'The first kill is the greatest. That first arc of hot blood through the air. The first scream of agony as your axe sinks home.' - Blooded Saek
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if at least one fighter from each warband is out of action.

cards.name: Khorne Cares Not
cards.colourText: Khorne cares not from whence the blood flows.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if five or more fighters are out of action.

cards.name: Khorne's Champion
cards.colourText: The weak fall, and only the mighty are left standing. Such is the will of Khorne.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if all fighters except one of your fighters are out of action.

cards.name: Let the Blood Flow
cards.colourText: All must wet their blade with the blood of the foe. To fail in this task is to invite the Blood God's wrath.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if three or more of your fighters made a successful Attack action in this phase.

cards.name: There is Only Slaughter
cards.colourText: 'What care we for worthless trinkets? Slaughter is all that matters.' - Garrek Gorebeard
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if no fighter is holding an objective.

cards.name: Blood Offering
cards.colourText: 'Witness my offering, Lord of Skulls, and send me worthy foes to butcher.'
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter. They suffer 1 damage. Roll two extra attack dice for their first Attack action in the next activation.

cards.name: Blood Rain
cards.colourText: When the blood rain comes, Khorne's faithful are masked by the profane deluge.
cards.rulesText: All Attack actions in the next activation have the characteristic, even if they would normally have the characteristic.

cards.name: Boon of Khorne
cards.colourText: Khorne offers great rewards to those who walk his bloody path.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that takes an enemy fighter out of action. Remove all wound tokens from one friendly fighter.

cards.name: Desecrate
cards.colourText: With each shadeglass artefact profaned with the blood of the fallen, the fury of Khorne's realm seeps into the Mirrored City.
cards.rulesText: Remove one objective that you hold from the battlefield.

cards.name: Final Blow
cards.colourText: 'Those cannibal madmen don't die easy. I've seen one strike the head from his killer even as his guts spilled out.'
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an enemy fighter's Attack action that takes an adjacent friendly fighter out of action. Their attacker suffers 1 damage.

cards.name: Fuelled by Slaughter
cards.colourText: The sight of a warrior torn asunder only serves to stoke a Bloodreaver's battle-lust.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action or ploy that takes a fighter out of action. A friendly fighter can make an Attack action.

cards.name: Insensate
cards.colourText: Bloodreavers fight on despite grievous wounds, lost to their exultant fury.
cards.rulesText: The first friendly fighter who suffers any amount of damage in the next activation only suffers one damage.

cards.name: Khorne Calls
cards.colourText: The Blood God's gaze falls upon you. Do not fail him.
cards.rulesText: Roll one extra attack dice for your first Attack action in the next activation.

cards.name: Rebirth in Blood
cards.colourText: 'The blood is death. The blood is life. The blood must flow.'
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action or ploy that takes your last surviving fighter out of action. Roll a defence dice. If you roll a or remove all wound tokens from them, and place them on a starting hex in your territory.

cards.name: Skulls for the Skull Throne!
cards.colourText: The path to ascension must be paved with worthy skulls.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that takes an enemy fighter out of action. Draw up to two power cards.

cards.name: Berserk Charge
cards.colourText: 'Yhaaaaarrraaaaargh!' - Blooded Saek
cards.rulesText: Both and symbols are successes when this fighter makes a Charge action.

cards.name: Bloodslick
cards.colourText: His flesh slick with gore, Garrek slips from the grasp of his foes.
cards.rulesText: +1 Defence

cards.name: Deadly Spin
cards.colourText: 'At Dredgard Ridge I opened the throats of three duardin with a single swing.' - Targor
cards.rulesText: Targets all adjacent enemy fighters - roll for each.

cards.name: Ever-Advancing
cards.colourText: Garrek is a whirlwind of unsuppressed violence, fighting to a drumbeat only the blood-maddened can hear.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: When this fighter could be driven back during an Attack action (whether or not your opponent chooses to do so), you can instead push them one hex.

cards.name: Frenzy
