cards.colourText: 'Into them you dogs! The last to spill blood gets my axe in their belly!' - Garrek Gorebeard
cards.rulesText: Roll an extra attack dice when this fighter makes a Charge action.

cards.name: Grisly Trophy
cards.colourText: 'That's a pretty face. I think I'll flay it and hang it from my belt.' - Garrek Gorebeard
cards.rulesText: When this fighter takes an enemy fighter out of action, gain 1 additional glory point.

cards.name: Terrifying Howl
cards.colourText: Karsus' frenzied screams of battle-lust are enough to shake the will of even the sturdiest foe.
cards.rulesText: Action: Push each adjacent enemy fighter one hex.

cards.name: Unstoppable Charge
cards.colourText: When the faithful of Khorne set their eyes upon their prey, nothing in the realms can stand in their path.
cards.rulesText: When this fighter makes a Charge action they can move through other fighters, but their move must end in an empty hex.

cards.name: Whirlwind of Death
cards.colourText: 'To feel flesh tear beneath your axe and blood wash across your face, that's when you understand the true glory of Khorne.' - Karsus the Chained
cards.rulesText: +1 Damage to all Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2

cards.name: Wicked Blade
cards.colourText: 'They all keep their eyes on the axe. They can't help it. That's when you sink the cutter in deep.' - Arnulf
cards.rulesText: If you roll at least one this Attack action has Cleave.

cards.name: Awe-inspiring
cards.colourText: The sheer imposing majesty of a Stormcast Eternal in battle is enough to break the will of many foes.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your warband has taken two or more fighters out of action in this phase.

cards.name: Cleanse
cards.colourText: All manner of corrupt and malicious souls haunt the shadowed streets of Shadespire. They shall all fall before the might of Sigmar.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you hold all the objectives in enemy territory.

cards.name: Consecrated Area
cards.colourText: 'This is hallowed land, heathen. Take one step further and feel the wrath of Sigmar.'
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if there are no enemy fighters adjacent to your fighters.

cards.name: Eternals
cards.colourText: The Stormcast Eternals are immortal warriors, forged to fight an unending war against the forces of darkness.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if none of your fighters are out of action.

cards.name: Immovable Object
cards.colourText: 'I claim this shard in the name of the God-King. Flee, while you still have use of your limbs.' - Angharad Brightshield
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if the same friendly fighter has held the same objective at the end of two consecutive action phases.

cards.name: Lightning Strikes
cards.colourText: Sigmar's storm will break upon the faithless with shattering force.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if an enemy fighter is taken out of action by a Charge action made by one of your fighters.

cards.name: Seize Ground
cards.colourText: Steelheart's band have sworn to end the curse of Shadespire and escape their nightmarish prison. Woe to those who stand in their way.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you hold an objective in enemy territory.

cards.name: Sigmar's Bulwark
cards.colourText: To fight the Stormcast Eternals is to break upon a wall of blessed sigmarite.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if none of your fighters suffered any damage in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Slayers of Tyrants
cards.colourText: 'With their leader slain, these wretches will scatter to the shadows.' - Obryn the Bold
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy leader out of action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Heroic Guard
cards.colourText: A Stormcast Eternal is a living wall of sigmarite, impervious and unyielding.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter and put them on Guard.

cards.name: Peal of Thunder
cards.colourText: Even in the nightmare of the Mirrored City, the fury of Sigmar's storm rings clear.
cards.rulesText: Choose an enemy fighter and push them one hex in any direction.

cards.name: Righteous Zeal
cards.colourText: The Hammers of Sigmar were the first of Sigmar's mighty Stormhosts. Theirs is the power of the storm.
cards.rulesText: +1 Damage to the first Attack action with a Range of 1 or 2 in the next activation

cards.name: Sigmarite Wall
cards.colourText: Few indeed are the foes who can breach a Liberator shield wall.
cards.rulesText: Choose two adjacent friendly fighters and put them on Guard.

cards.name: Stormforged Resistance
cards.colourText: 'Not a single step backwards, Hammers of Sigmar. Grant them nothing but a swift death.'
cards.rulesText: Friendly fighters cannot be driven back by the first Attack action in the next activation.

cards.name: Stormforged Tactics
cards.colourText: Stormcast Eternals fight as a single entity, the precision of their movement and attacks seeming almost preternatural.
cards.rulesText: In the next activation, you can make the following Reaction.

cards.name: Tireless Assault
cards.colourText: 'Fear not, heathen. I can keep this up all day.'
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that fails. That fighter can make another Attack action that targets the same fighter.

cards.name: Undaunted
cards.colourText: 'A Stormcast Eternal never fights alone. Sigmar is always with us.'
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action or ploy that takes a friendly fighter out of action leaving one surviving friendly fighter on the battlefield. Remove all wound tokens from the surviving fighter.

cards.name: Unstoppable Strike
cards.colourText: Stormcast Eternals are granted a fraction of the God-King Sigmar's celestial power, enough to shatter the guard of all but the mightiest foes.
cards.rulesText: The first Attack action in the next activation gains Cleave.

cards.name: Valiant Attack
cards.colourText: They may be lost in the depths of a nightmare, but Steelheart's warriors fight with the same valour and skill as ever.
cards.rulesText: Enemy fighters cannot support the target of the first Attack action in the next activation.

cards.name: Blessed by Sigmar
cards.colourText: 'We shall not fall here. Sigmar's light will guide us home.' - Severin Steelheart
cards.rulesText: +1 Wounds

cards.name: Block
cards.colourText: 'Is that the best you've got? Try harder.' - Angharad Brightshield
cards.rulesText: Action: This fighter and all adjacent friendly fighters go on Guard.

cards.name: Brave Strike
cards.colourText: Obryn is ever the first to throw himself into battle, smashing an opening for his comrades to take advantage of.
cards.rulesText: Roll an extra attack dice if there are no adjacent friendly fighters.

cards.name: Fatal Riposte
cards.colourText: Even amongst his warrior kin, Steelheart's skill with the blade is the stuff of legend.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an Attack action that targets this fighter and fails, roll an attack dice. On a roll of or this fighter cannot be driven back and they can make an Attack action. It must target the attacker.

cards.name: Heroic Might
cards.colourText: 'There's no parrying a well-aimed grandhammer with the weight of righteousness behind it.' - Obryn the Bold
cards.rulesText: This fighter's Attack actions gain Cleave.

cards.name: Heroic Stride
cards.colourText: A well-timed countercharge can turn the tide of battle in an instant.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After an enemy fighter ends their activation within two hexes of this fighter, you can push this fighter one hex.

cards.name: Lightning Blade
cards.colourText: Celestial energy ripples around Steelheart's sword, a cleansing storm to sear away the taint of corruption.
cards.rulesText: On a critical hit, this Attack action has +1 Damage.

cards.name: Lightning Blast
cards.colourText: As Obryn's grandhammer strikes home, a shock wave of magical energy blasts forth to send his foes reeling.
cards.rulesText: When they make a critical hit, this fighter also inflicts 1 damage on enemy fighters adjacent to the target's hex.

cards.name: Righteous Strike
cards.colourText: 'The loud one, with the fancy blade. He dies first.' - Angharad Brightshield
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After this Attack action, if it failed and the target was an enemy leader, make this Attack action again.

cards.name: Shield Bash
cards.colourText: Brightshield wields her shield as a weapon, smashing it into the face of her foes with bone-crushing force.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an adjacent fighter's Attack action that targets this fighter and fails, this fighter cannot be driven back and you can push their attacker one hex.

cards.name: A Worthy Deed
cards.colourText: The bigger the enemy, the more beautiful their death.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter takes an enemy fighter with a Wounds characteristic of 4 or more out of action with an Attack action.

cards.name: Dark Rewards
cards.colourText: Many start on the path to glory, though few ever finish.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all surviving friendly fighters (at least three) are Inspired.

cards.name: Glory or Damnation
cards.colourText: The Darkoath welcome the generosity of the Chaos Gods, even when it is unwise to do so.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if a surviving friendly fighter has three or more upgrades.

cards.name: Magical Apotheosis
cards.colourText: Through fell energies do the Darkoath find communion with the Chaos Gods.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter successfully casts a spell that requires two or more successes.

cards.name: Oath of Annihilation
cards.colourText: 'None of you shall see another day.' - Grundann
cards.rulesText: You may reveal this card at the start of your first activation in the action phase, then return it to your hand. Score this in an end phase if all enemy fighters are out of action. If you revealed this card, gain 1 additional glory point.

cards.name: Oath of Conquest
cards.colourText: 'They shall be driven before us!' - Theddra
cards.rulesText: You may reveal this card at the start of your first activation in the action phase, then return it to your hand. Score this in the third end phase if all surviving friendly fighters are in enemy territory. If you revealed this card, gain 1 additional glory point.

cards.name: Oath of Denial
cards.colourText: 'They shall die where they stand!' - Shond
cards.rulesText: You may reveal this card at the start of your first activation in the action phase, then return it to your hand. Score this in the third end phase if there are no enemy fighters in your territory. If you revealed this card, gain 1 additional glory point.

cards.name: Oath of Murder
cards.colourText: 'We shall bathe in the blood of their champion!' - Jagathra
cards.rulesText: You may reveal this card at the start of your first activation in the action phase, then return it to your hand. Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy leader out of action in the preceding action phase. If you revealed this card, gain 1 additional glory point.

cards.name: Oath of Supremacy
cards.colourText: 'All shall be claimed for our gods!' - Theddra
cards.rulesText: You may reveal this card at the start of your first activation in the action phase, then return it to your hand. Score this in an end phase if you hold three or more objectives. If you revealed this card, gain 1 additional glory point.

cards.name: Brutal Sacrifice
cards.colourText: 'Lives should not be wasted. They should be spent wisely.' - Theddra Skull-scryer
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter adjacent to another friendly fighter, and an upgrade in your hand that can be applied to the fighter you chose. The other fighter is taken out of action, and the upgrade is applied to the fighter you chose.

cards.name: Dark Destiny
cards.colourText: Even in the Mirrored City, the Chaos Gods watch over their mortal champions.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this during an Attack action that would take a friendly fighter out of action. Roll a defence dice. On a roll of or the fighter takes no damage, is not driven back and is not taken out of action.

cards.name: Enfeeble
cards.colourText: Waves of withering energy flood over Skull-scryer's foes - a prelude to slaughter.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose an enemy fighter within four hexes of the caster. That fighter's Attack actions have -1 Damage (to a minimum of 1). This spell persists until that fighter is out of action.

cards.name: Ensnare
cards.colourText: 'None can escape the wrath of the Dark Gods.' - Theddra Skull-scryer
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose an enemy fighter within four hexes of the caster. That fighter has -1 Move (to a minimum of 0). This spell persists until that fighter is out of action.

cards.name: Fearless Strike
cards.colourText: 'Shond dreads nothing, save that one day he will run out of worthy foes to slaughter.' - Shond
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this during a friendly fighter's Attack action, before the attack roll, if that fighter has no supporting fighters. Any rolls of in the attack roll are successes.

cards.name: Glimpse the Future
cards.colourText: The inevitability of victory is great motivation.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose a friendly fighter within four hexes of the caster. When they next make an Attack action, you can re-roll one dice in the attack roll. This spell persists until that Attack action is made or that fighter is out of action, whichever happens first.

cards.name: Heel
cards.colourText: Though savage in battle, Grawl follows its master's commands with deadly precision.
cards.rulesText: Push a friendly Grawl up to a number of hexes equal to twice its Move characteristic. It must end this push in a hex adjacent to a friendly Ollo.

cards.name: Hunting Pack
cards.colourText: Darkoath hunting bands run their prey to ground like ravening lashwolves.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this during a friendly fighter's Attack action, before the attack roll, if that fighter has two or more supporting fighters. Any rolls of in the attack roll are considered to be rolls of .

cards.name: Oathsworn Attack
cards.colourText: 'My axe shall carve your skull. I swear it by the Dark Gods.' - Grundann
cards.rulesText: The first Attack action made by a friendly fighter in the next activation has +1 Dice.

cards.name: Warding Eye
cards.colourText: The Dark Gods are always watching.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose a friendly fighter within four hexes of the caster. They have +1 Defence. This spell persists until the end of the phase or that fighter is out of action, whichever happens first.

cards.name: Chaos Boon
cards.colourText: The gifts of the pantheon are manifold and generous.
cards.rulesText: -1 Wounds (to a minimum of 1). This fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2 have +1 Damage.

cards.name: Enchanted Collar
cards.colourText: Rather than taming their hunting beasts, the Darkoath seek ways to enhance the tenacity of these creatures.
cards.rulesText: +1 Defence

cards.name: Ensorcelled Javelin
cards.colourText: Dark energies bind this javelin to Jagathra, returning it to her hand that it may kill again.
cards.rulesText: This Attack action has +1 Damage when made during this fighter's Charge action.

cards.name: Grundann's Path
cards.colourText: For Grundann, the path to glory leads straight through the ranks of his enemies.
cards.rulesText: When this fighter makes a Charge action, rolls of both and are successes in their attack roll.

cards.name: Path to Glory
cards.colourText: With every step, the path towards immortal glory becomes clearer.
cards.rulesText: +1 Wounds, +1 Dice to this fighter's Attack actions. You may only apply this upgrade to a fighter that has an upgrade.

cards.name: Point-blank Shot
cards.colourText: The closer the enemy comes, the harder they are to miss.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After an enemy fighter's Move action that ends adjacent to this fighter, make this Attack action. It must target that fighter and cannot drive them back.

cards.name: Seized Trophy
cards.colourText: There is no better badge of glory than the severed head of one's enemy.
cards.rulesText: You can play this upgrade using the following reaction:

cards.name: Shond's Path
cards.colourText: For Shond, the path to glory is opened only through bloodshed.
cards.rulesText: On a critical hit, this fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2 have +1 Damage.

cards.name: Theddra's Path
cards.colourText: For Theddra, the path to glory is lit by the burning fires within her soul.
cards.rulesText: Innate ()

cards.name: Trained Killer
cards.colourText: The scent of fear draws Grawl towards its master's prey.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During a friendly Ollo's Attack action, before the attack roll, push this fighter up to two hexes. It must end this push adjacent to the target of the Attack action.

cards.name: Carnage
cards.colourText: Once roused from their caves, the Dankhold creatures make short work of their foes.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband took three or more enemy fighters out of action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Demolished
cards.colourText: The beasts of the Dankholds leave little trace of their enemies behind.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter takes an enemy fighter out of action with an Attack action with a Damage characteristic of 5 or more.

cards.name: Earn Your Keep
cards.colourText: The hierarchy of the Dankholds is simple - either eat, or be eaten.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if an enemy fighter is taken out of action by an Attack action made by a friendly fighter other than Mollog.

cards.name: Easy Pickings
cards.colourText: One good kill deserves another.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if two or more enemy fighters are taken out of action by a single Attack action made by a friendly fighter.

cards.name: Feeding Frenzy
cards.colourText: Rumblings in the darkness are a sign that the creatures of the Dankholds are hungry.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if each surviving friendly fighter (at least three) is adjacent to any enemy fighters.

cards.name: Got Them
cards.colourText: Facing a troggoth alone is a good way to get killed. Facing a troggoth together is a good way to all get killed.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately at the beginning of your activation if there are three or more enemy fighters adjacent to a friendly Mollog.

cards.name: Is It Asleep?
cards.colourText: Due to their long hibernation and regenerative abilities, it's almost impossible to tell if a troggoth is dead, or just resting.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if a friendly Mollog took no actions in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Protect the Lair
cards.colourText: Though not native to Shadespire, Mollog and his minions find the perpetual gloom of the Mirrored City rather appealing.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if there are no enemy fighters in your territory.

cards.name: Rampage
cards.colourText: Once the killing has started, the Dankhold creatures do not stop until their enemies have been annihilated.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband took four or more enemy fighters out of action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Brutal Savagery
cards.colourText: When roused to anger, the cavern dwellers unleash their pent-up ferocity.
cards.rulesText: The first Attack action made by a friendly fighter in the next activation has +1 Dice.

cards.name: Feast
cards.colourText: Dankhold creatures rarely pass up a fresh meal.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that takes an adjacent enemy fighter out of action. Remove up to one wound token from the friendly fighter's fighter card.

cards.name: Flit
cards.colourText: Catching a Bat Squig is easier said than done.
cards.rulesText: Push a friendly Bat Squig up to three hexes. This push can take them through occupied hexes but must end in an empty hex.

cards.name: Follow Your Instincts
cards.colourText: What Dankhold creatures lack in intelligence they make up for in curiosity.
cards.rulesText: Discard an objective card, then draw an objective card.

cards.name: Hobble
cards.colourText: In Shadespire, even the rocks can't be trusted.
cards.rulesText: Choose an enemy fighter adjacent to a friendly Stalagsquig and roll an attack dice. On a roll of or place a Move token next to that enemy fighter.

cards.name: Predatory Growls
cards.colourText: The boldest of fighters must still be wary of rumblings in the dark.
cards.rulesText: Choose an enemy fighter and push them one hex.

cards.name: Shrouded in Gloom
cards.colourText: Coils of impenetrable shadow conceal hidden threats.
cards.rulesText: Attack actions with a Range of 3 or more in the next activation have a Dice characteristic (before other modifiers) of 1.

cards.name: Sporeburst
cards.colourText: The fungal clouds emitted by a Spiteshroom can rot flesh from bone.
cards.rulesText: Choose an enemy fighter adjacent to a friendly Spiteshroom and roll an attack dice. On a roll of or the enemy fighter suffers 1 damage.

cards.name: There the Whole Time
cards.colourText: A Stalagsquig's greatest defence is the ability to hide in plain sight.
cards.rulesText: Roll an attack dice. On a roll of or return a friendly Stalagsquig that has been taken out of action to any empty hex on the battlefield.

cards.name: Wind Up
cards.colourText: Those close enough to see this attack coming are usually too close to avoid it.
cards.rulesText: +1 Damage to the first Attack action with a Range of 1 or 2 made by a friendly fighter in the next activation

cards.name: Blooming Spores
cards.colourText: The myriad mushrooms on Mollog's club secrete all manner of toxic fumes.
cards.rulesText: +1 Damage to this fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2

cards.name: Foul Temper
cards.colourText: It's difficult to kill a troggoth, but it's easy to make them angry.
cards.rulesText: You can re-roll one dice in each attack roll for this fighter's Attack actions.

cards.name: Horrific Stench
cards.colourText: Few formations can hold against the pungency of a Dankhold Troggoth.
cards.rulesText: Enemy fighters adjacent to this fighter are considered to have one fewer supporting fighters (to a minimum of zero).

cards.name: Inescapable Jaws
cards.colourText: Bat Squigs are little more than mouths with wings, yet these body parts are a deadly combination.
cards.rulesText: Both and symbols are successes in the attack roll when this fighter makes a Charge action.

cards.name: Jabbertoad
cards.colourText: Though carried as a snack, this creature's acidic skin renders it an effective weapon.
cards.rulesText: On a critical hit this Attack action has Knockback 2 instead of Knockback 1. Discard this card after making this Attack action.

cards.name: Regenerate
cards.colourText: The rent flesh of a troggoth reknits with terrifying speed.
cards.rulesText: At the beginning of each round, remove up to one wound token from this fighter's fighter card.

cards.name: Rooted to the Spot
cards.colourText: The fungal sediment of a Stalagsquig quickly subsumes nearby objects.
cards.rulesText: This fighter can hold objectives, even though its fighter card says it cannot.

cards.name: Spore Cloud
cards.colourText: To stand downwind of a Spiteshroom can be a fatal mistake.
cards.rulesText: Action: Scatter 2 from this fighter's hex. Any enemy fighters in any hex in the chain suffer 1 damage.

cards.name: Unswattable
cards.colourText: 'Stay still, foul beast!' - Obryn the Bold
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After an Attack action that targets this fighter and fails, push this fighter up to one hex.

cards.name: Wrath of Living Rock
cards.colourText: When angered, a Stalagsquig can gnash through metal and bone with gruesome ease.
cards.rulesText: This fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 have Cleave.

cards.name: Collect Bounty
cards.colourText: The worthiest enemies are worth the most.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy leader out of action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Focus Fire
cards.colourText: Nothing is sweeter to a Kharadron's ears than the sound of an aethershot fusillade.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if the third different friendly fighter makes an Attack action with a Range of 3 or more targeting the same fighter in this phase.

cards.name: Headshot
cards.colourText: Shadespire provides plenty of opportunities for a skyfarer to prove their capabilities.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter scores a critical hit with an Attack action with a Range of 3 or more.

cards.name: It's Ours Now
cards.colourText: Success in any enterprise requires aggressive expansion.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if two or more friendly fighters are in no one's territory.

cards.name: Live by the Code
cards.colourText: 'The Kharadron Code cannot be altered.' - Amendment 11 of the Kharadron Code
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you did not discard any objective cards in the preceding action phase. If you do, you cannot discard any objective cards in this end phase.

cards.name: Search the City
cards.colourText: 'If a skyfarer is separated from their vessel, all other duties are suspended until the vessel has been rejoined.' - Kharadron Code
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you hold three or more objectives.

cards.name: Seeking Advancement
cards.colourText: The greater the challenge, the greater the rewards.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your warband takes an enemy fighter with a Wounds characteristic of 4 or more out of action.

cards.name: Sound Finances
cards.colourText: In Kharadron culture, there is no distinction between 'cunning' and 'frugality'.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you have 5 or more unspent glory points.

cards.name: Stake a Claim
cards.colourText: 'We hold what is ours.' - Dead-Eye Lund
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all friendly fighters are in your territory and no enemy fighters are in your territory.

cards.name: Aetheric Augmentation
cards.colourText: BOOOOOOM!
cards.rulesText: The first Attack action made by a friendly fighter in the next activation has +1 Dice.

cards.name: Ambitious Attack
cards.colourText: 'If exceptional initiative is shown, a bonus of a one-hundredth share may be considered.' - Kharadron Code
cards.rulesText: +1 Damage to the first Attack action with a Range of 1 or 2 made by a friendly fighter in the next activation

cards.name: Atmospheric Isolation
cards.colourText: Those who engage the skyfarers in combat cannot even take the air they breathe for granted.
cards.rulesText: Play this only if there is a surviving friendly Thundrik. No more power cards can be played until after the next activation.

cards.name: Prepared Position
cards.colourText: Combat is like a negotiation in that it's better to start from a position of strength.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter that does not have a Guard token. Place a Guard token next to them.

cards.name: Protect the Boss
cards.colourText: 'All salaries are subject to change based on the condition of the paymaster.' - Kharadron Code
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter and push them up to two hexes so that they are adjacent to your leader.

cards.name: Quiet Contemplation
cards.colourText: 'Regardless of circumstance, a skyfarer must consider the most efficient routes to victory.' - Kharadron Code
cards.rulesText: Choose one: draw a power card, or discard an objective card then draw an objective card.

cards.name: Seek the Skyvessel
cards.colourText: The Kharadron are surprisingly swift, when properly motivated.
cards.rulesText: Choose up to two friendly fighters and make a Move action with each of them.

cards.name: Timed Charge
cards.colourText: 'He's getting away! Hey, what's this?'
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After a friendly Drakkskewer's Move action that begins adjacent to any enemy fighters, roll an attack dice. On a roll of or those enemy fighters each suffer 1 damage.

cards.name: Toxic Gases
cards.colourText: Sometimes there are no good options.
cards.rulesText: Choose an enemy fighter. That fighter's player must make a choice: either that fighter suffers 1 damage or you push that fighter up to two hexes.

cards.name: Unyielding
cards.colourText: 'Hold the line!' - Dead-Eye Lund
cards.rulesText: Friendly fighters cannot be driven back in the next activation.

cards.name: Ancestral Fortitude
cards.colourText: In all the Mortal Realms, there is no race more doughty than the duardin.
cards.rulesText: +1 Wounds

cards.name: Ancestral Might
cards.colourText: The Kharadron may not revere their forebears in the manner of other duardin, but they bear a bitter enmity for any who would slight them.
cards.rulesText: +1 Damage to this fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2

cards.name: Augmented Buoyancy
cards.colourText: In the thick of battle, Drakkskewer is as swift and destructive as a raging tempest.
cards.rulesText: +2 Move

cards.name: Breath of Grungni
cards.colourText: Even the dead reel from the most potent of the Aether-Khemists' concoctions.

cards.name: Empowered Aethershot
cards.colourText: In the shattered halls of Shadespire, every shot has to count.
cards.rulesText: The Attack actions on this fighter's fighter card with a Range of 3 or more have Cleave.

cards.name: Magmalt Draught
cards.colourText: WARNING: Excessive consumption may cause unexpected spontaneous combustion.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an Attack action or gambit that will damage this fighter, discard this card. Reduce the damage suffered by 1, to a minimum of 1.

cards.name: Paymaster
cards.colourText: To achieve true heroism in battle, a skyfarer just needs the proper incentive.
cards.rulesText: You can re-roll one dice in each Attack roll made for friendly fighters adjacent to this fighter.

cards.name: Punishing Retort
cards.colourText: Kharadron craftsmanship ensures that an aethershot rifle is sturdier than any enemy's skull.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an adjacent enemy fighter's Attack action that targets this fighter and fails, this fighter cannot be driven back and makes this Attack action. It must target the attacker.

cards.name: Rapid Reload
cards.colourText: 'If at first you don't succeed, fire again.' - Enrik Ironhail
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After this fighter's first Aethermatic Volley Gun Attack action in a round, they can make that Attack action again.

cards.name: Swashbuckler
cards.colourText: Arkanauts drill constantly in close-combat fighting, allowing them to deal with all manner of pests that might find their way aboard a skyvessel.
cards.rulesText: +1 Dice to this fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2

cards.name: Domain Denied
cards.colourText: 'You have made a valiant effort, but you shall go no further.' - Ahnslaine
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if no enemy fighters are holding objectives.

cards.name: Glade's Last Hope
cards.colourText: 'The glade must endure.' - Ylthari
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if at least 3 wound tokens were removed from the fighter cards of friendly fighters in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Glade's Pride
cards.colourText: A glade is strongest when all in it are standing tall.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if no friendly fighter is out of action.

cards.name: Lithe Spirits
cards.colourText: 'I bend in the breeze, stand firm in the gale, brace myself in the frost and bask in the sun. There is no danger to which I cannot adapt.' - Ahnslaine
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your warband makes its second or subsequent reaction in this phase.

cards.name: Reclaim the Lamentiri
cards.colourText: No matter how much time has passed, the Sylvaneth do not forget those of their kind who have fallen.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you hold all the objectives in at least one player's territory.

cards.name: Show No Mercy
cards.colourText: For a glade to flourish, the weeds must first be eradicated.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if 3 or more enemy fighters are out of action.

cards.name: Song of Hatred
cards.colourText: The mellifluous sound of Sylvaneth magic is both beautiful and terrifying to those upon whom it is unleashed.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your warband successfully casts their second or subsequent spell in this phase.

cards.name: Strike Swiftly
cards.colourText: 'There is a season for caution, and a season for action.' - Skhathael
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter takes an enemy fighter out of action with a Charge action.

cards.name: Vengeful Revenants
cards.colourText: Life is a cycle, and the Sylvaneth see to it that their enemies reach the end of the cycle first.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if at least one friendly fighter is out of action, and at least twice as many enemy fighters as friendly fighters are out of action.

cards.name: Curse of the Dwindling
cards.colourText: Those afflicted by this curse feel their life force rapidly draining away.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose an enemy fighter within five hexes of the caster. That fighter's Attack actions have -1 Dice (to a minimum of 1). This spell persists until that fighter is out of action.

cards.name: Healing Amphora
cards.colourText: The Sylvaneth have ways to flourish in even the most inimical environments.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly Gallanghann or a friendly fighter adjacent to a friendly Gallanghann and roll a defence dice. On a roll of or remove up to two wound tokens from that fighter's fighter card. Otherwise remove up to one wound token from that fighter's fighter card.

cards.name: Last Guardians
cards.colourText: 'We shall not be uprooted.' - Skhathael
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter that does not have a Guard token. Place a Guard token next to them.

cards.name: Leech Power
cards.colourText: 'The Katophranes are not gone. Their life essence still hangs thick in these darkened halls.' - Ylthari
cards.rulesText: Play this only if a friendly Ylthari is holding an objective. Remove that objective from the battlefield and remove up to one wound token from that Ylthari's fighter card.

cards.name: Mesmerising Gaze
cards.colourText: A spite's eyes hold an ocean of hatred, within which countless warriors have drowned.
cards.rulesText: Choose an enemy fighter adjacent to a friendly fighter and choose one: remove the enemy fighter's Guard tokens, or place a Move token next to the enemy fighter.

cards.name: Pangs of the Great Lack
cards.colourText: The bitter cold of a Ghyranite winter can fell even the sturdiest warriors.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose an enemy fighter within five hexes of the caster. That fighter suffers 1 damage.

cards.name: Revenant Rage
cards.colourText: 'Hatred is evergreen.' - Sylvaneth proverb
cards.rulesText: The first Attack action in the next activation has +1 Dice.

cards.name: Springseed Step
cards.colourText: A lone tree can be easily felled, but those that grow together remain strong.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Move action. Choose another friendly fighter and push them up to three hexes. They must end this push adjacent to the fighter that moved.

cards.name: Strength of the Burgeoning
cards.colourText: During the warm seasons, the Sylvaneth are prone to explosive bursts of activity.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, the first Attack action with a Range of 1 or 2 in the next activation has +1 Damage.

cards.name: Writhing Roots
cards.colourText: Thick weeds burst from the fallow ground, entangling those who would do harm to Alarielle's servants.
cards.rulesText: The first fighter to make a Move action in the next activation has -2 Move (to a minimum of 0).

cards.name: Cage of Thorns
cards.colourText: 'Halt!' - Ylthari
cards.rulesText: If this Attack action succeeds, place a Move token next to the target.

cards.name: Constant Growth
cards.colourText: Even when surrounded by death, each Sylvaneth is a wellspring of life.
cards.rulesText: +1 Wounds

cards.name: Enraged Spite
cards.colourText: To anger a spite is to invite one's own end.

cards.name: Inescapable Grasp
cards.colourText: 'Be still now, and accept my wrath.' - Ylthari
cards.rulesText: Rolls of are not successes in the defence rolls of enemy fighters targeted by this fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2.

cards.name: Menacing Step
cards.colourText: As the enemy advances, Skhathael's rage rises to new heights.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After an enemy fighter's Move action that ends adjacent to at least one other friendly fighter, push this fighter up to two hexes. The push must end with this fighter adjacent to the enemy fighter.

cards.name: Pinning Shot
cards.colourText: Even when firing into a swirling melee, Ahnslaine is able to pick off her enemies with unerring accuracy.
cards.rulesText: This fighter is considered to be a supporting fighter for adjacent friendly fighters.

cards.name: Spiteful Thorns
cards.colourText: The barbed tendrils surrounding Ylthari can quickly reduce an enemy to bloody ribbons.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After an enemy fighter's Attack action with a Range of 1 that targets this fighter and succeeds, roll an attack dice. On a roll of or the attacker suffers 1 damage.

cards.name: Unflinching Guardian
cards.colourText: Gallanghann's formidable size belies the swiftness with which he is able to defend his kin.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an enemy fighter's Attack action that targets a friendly fighter supported by this fighter, after the defence roll but before the Attack action succeeds or fails, you can re-roll one defence dice.

cards.name: Vengeful Blow
cards.colourText: 'The fallen shall not go unremembered, and the enemy shall not go unpunished.' - Skhathael
cards.rulesText: This Attack action has +1 Dice and +1 Damage for each friendly fighter that is out of action.

cards.name: Warding Stance
cards.colourText: When wielded correctly, a protector glaive can turn aside any blow with ease.
cards.rulesText: +1 Defence

cards.name: Acolyte of the Katophranes
cards.colourText: 'The secrets of our order make gods of mortal beings.' - Grand Katophrane Temultus
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if you have at least one surviving friendly fighter that has at least one Katophrane Tome. Choose a surviving friendly fighter. Gain 1 glory point for each Katophrane Tome that fighter has.

cards.name: Aggressive Commander
cards.colourText: 'Hit them first!' - Ancient orruk proverb
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if you took the first activation in each round.

cards.name: All or Nothing
cards.colourText: In the labyrinth of the Mirrored City, even disaster can be turned into triumph.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if you have scored no objective cards this game. If you do, you cannot score any other objective cards.

cards.name: Annihilation
cards.colourText: The screams of routed foes make for a most stirring choir.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all enemy fighters have been taken out of action.

cards.name: Arcane Implosion
cards.colourText: Those wise in the arcane arts are sometimes proved most foolish of all.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if an enemy fighter is taken out of action while attempting to cast a spell.

cards.name: Arcane Torrent
cards.colourText: To master the unfettered fury of magic is a victory in and of itself.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter successfully casts a spell and there are two or more in the casting roll.

cards.name: Biding Your Time
cards.colourText: A fate worse than death awaits all in Shadespire - there is no need to rush towards it.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you have at least one fighter on the battlefield and your warband took no Attack actions in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Bloodless Skirmish
cards.colourText: Death can not be escaped in Shadespire, but it can be delayed.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if there are no fighters out of action.

cards.name: Branching Fate
cards.colourText: Many are the roads that lead to victory.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if you roll three or more dice in an attack or defence roll and they all show a different symbol.

cards.name: Brute Force
cards.colourText: 'I will take you all down. Just try to stop me.' - Obryn the Bold
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter's Attack action succeeds against an enemy fighter who has two or more supporting fighters more than the friendly fighter.

cards.name: Building Momentum
cards.colourText: Where doubt is a dangerous enemy, confidence is an ally beyond compare.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you have scored at least 2 other objective cards in this phase.

cards.name: Calculated Risk
cards.colourText: 'One way or another, there will be blood!' - Garrek Gorebeard
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter makes a Move action through a lethal hex that damages them but doesn't take them out of action.

cards.name: Catching Up
cards.colourText: The enemy might think victory is within their grasp. You, of course, know better...
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you have fewer glory points than an opponent.

cards.name: Charmed Life
cards.colourText: Sometimes, blind luck will get you further than the most cunning of plans.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you removed at least 3 wound tokens from a single fighter, and that fighter was not taken out of action, in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Combination Strike
cards.colourText: The interlocking wheels of a sound battle plan can crush those caught between them.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you scored at least two objective cards in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Conquest
cards.colourText: 'Hope is not yet lost. While we still stand, we can prevail.'
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if all surviving friendly fighters are in your opponent's territory.

cards.name: Cornered
cards.colourText: There is little more satisfying than a careful trap ensnaring its intended target.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter takes an enemy fighter out of action with an Attack action that is only successful because their target is Trapped.

cards.name: Dashed Hopes
cards.colourText: Those who have climbed the highest towards glory have the furthest to fall.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband took at least one Inspired enemy fighter out of action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Death from Afar
cards.colourText: A well-placed shot can stop even the most ferocious enemy in their tracks.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter takes an enemy fighter out of action while at least three hexes from that fighter.

cards.name: Denial
cards.colourText: 'None shall pass! These treasures are ours alone.'
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if there are no enemy fighters in your territory.

cards.name: Devastation
cards.colourText: There is no peace in Shadespire, only swift and merciless slaughter.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if three or more enemy fighters were taken out of action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Didn't Even Want It
cards.colourText: In the cramped confines of Shadespire, it is important to pick your battles.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if an enemy fighter is holding objective 1.

cards.name: Digging Deep
cards.colourText: For those brave or foolish enough to explore its darkened halls, Shadespire is a place of endless possibilities.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you drew at least four power and/or objective cards in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Disdain for Knowledge
cards.colourText: It takes a lifetime to fill a head with wisdom, but only a second to empty it.
cards.rulesText: Score this card immediately if your warband takes an enemy fighter out of action, and that fighter has at least one Katophrane Tome.

cards.name: Envious Acquisition
cards.colourText: There is no treasure of greater value than that taken from the enemy.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you hold an objective held by an enemy fighter at the beginning of the round.

cards.name: Every Trick in the Book
cards.colourText: Defeat comes only to those who have exhausted all other options.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you have no power cards in your hand.

cards.name: Extreme Flank
cards.colourText: 'They're hemmed in on all sides. Finish them!'
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if there is a friendly fighter on an edge hex and another friendly fighter on an edge hex on the opposite edge of the battlefield to the first fighter. Where there is more than one opposite edge, it must be the furthest of these edges.

cards.name: Finish Them
cards.colourText: 'There is a pleasing elegance in a perfectly placed and finely weighted finishing blow.'
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your warband takes an enemy fighter out of action with an Attack action with a Damage characteristic of 1.

cards.name: Fired Up
cards.colourText: 'Come on then, you yellow-bellied dung scrubbers! I'll tear your stinking heads off!' - Tefk Flamebearer
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if at least one surviving friendly fighter is Inspired.

cards.name: Frugal
cards.colourText: A wise warrior expends only what is needed to win.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you have at least 3 unspent glory points.

cards.name: Ganging Up
cards.colourText: To trap an adversary in a thicket of blades is to bring about his swift demise.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if all hexes adjacent to a single enemy fighter (other than blocked or incomplete hexes) contain friendly fighters.

cards.name: Get Thee Hence
cards.colourText: 'AIYEEeeeee...'
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter's Attack action drives an enemy fighter back two or more hexes.

cards.name: Giant-slayer
cards.colourText: When the enemy is dead, it doesn't matter how big they were.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your warband takes a fighter with a Wounds characteristic of 5 or more out of action.

cards.name: Girded for Battle
cards.colourText: When the spoils of victory are shared, every warrior fights harder to protect them.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all surviving friendly fighters (at least three) have at least one upgrade.

cards.name: Grand Melee
cards.colourText: 'Let the feast of carnage begin. Let the blood fly free and plentiful!' - Magore Redhand
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if at least three enemy fighters were damaged in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Great Gains
cards.colourText: 'Mork's warty backside, would ya look at all dis loot, ladz!?' - Zarbag
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you gained at least 5 glory points in this round.

cards.name: Hale and Whole
cards.colourText: 'So far so good.' - Severin Steelheart
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if no friendly fighters are out of action and no friendly fighters have wound tokens on their fighter cards.

cards.name: Heroic Effort
cards.colourText: When facing death in the Mirrored City, a single warrior can fight with the grit of an entire army.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you activated the same fighter four times in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Hoarder
cards.colourText: Glory saved is glory earned.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if you have at least 9 unspent glory points.

cards.name: Hold Objective 1
cards.colourText: 'There is a pattern to reality. A greater design that escapes our comprehension. For now.'
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you are holding objective 1.

cards.name: Hold Objective 2
cards.colourText: 'Crystallised magic is the raw essence of creation, there to be shaped to our desires.'
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you are holding objective 2.

cards.name: Hold Objective 3
cards.colourText: 'Death is insufficient to punish your betrayal. Eternal imprisonment is far more fitting.'
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you are holding objective 3.

cards.name: Hold Objective 4
cards.colourText: 'A crude concept, perhaps, but no less lethal a sentinel for that.'
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you are holding objective 4.

cards.name: Hold Objective 5
cards.colourText: 'Soul-transferral experiments ten to forty-one unsuccessful. I have requested more subjects.'
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you are holding objective 5.

cards.name: Hold What We Have
cards.colourText: Why pursue the enemy when you have what they desire? Inevitably, they will come to you.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you have at least one fighter on the battlefield and your warband made no Move actions in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Indomitable Defender
cards.colourText: In battle, the killing blow is the only one that matters.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if a single surviving friendly fighter was the target of at least three Attack actions in the preceding action phase and was not taken out of action.

cards.name: Interdiction
cards.colourText: 'Decapitation, the most effective counter-spell of all...' - Magore Redhand
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy wizard out of action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Keep Chopping
cards.colourText: Attack first, ask questions later.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband made an Attack action in four or more activations in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Keep Moving
cards.colourText: In a city where everyone is marked for a fate worse than death, it pays to not stay in one place for too long.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband made a Move action in four or more activations in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Keep Them Guessing
cards.colourText: Your enemy cannot defeat you if they do not comprehend your aims.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband made at least four different actions from the following list in the preceding action phase: Move (other than as part of a Charge), Attack (other than as part of a Charge), Charge, Guard, another action on a fighter card.

cards.name: Lethal Repertoire
cards.colourText: Those who lead violent lives are quick to adopt new methods of brutality.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if a friendly fighter made an Attack action in the preceding action phase printed on an upgrade that you played in the same phase.

cards.name: Loner
cards.colourText: 'No underlings means no incompetent fool-fools to betray you...' - Skritch Spiteclaw
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if at least one surviving friendly fighter has no other fighter within three hexes.

cards.name: Longstrider
cards.colourText: A swift advance leads to swift victory.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately when a friendly fighter makes their second or subsequent Move action in a single action phase.

cards.name: Magical Mastery
cards.colourText: Arcane energies flood the dark halls of Shadespire.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband successfully cast six or more spells in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Magical Storm
cards.colourText: Such a confluence of arcane energies is at once awe-inspiring and terrifying to behold.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband successfully cast four or more spells in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Magical Void
cards.colourText: The wages of sorcery are unpredictable, and often meagre.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if an opponent's warband attempted to cast at least one spell and did not successfully cast any spells in the preceding phase.

cards.name: Martyred
cards.colourText: Some believe that death in battle is the only way to escape Shadespire's eternal curse.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if the first fighter taken out of action in this round is a friendly fighter.

cards.name: Massive Overkill
cards.colourText: Better safe than sorry.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter takes an enemy fighter out of action with an Attack action that deals an amount of damage that is at least twice the target's Wounds characteristic.

cards.name: Master of Mayhem
cards.colourText: With enemies in every shadow, even the most anarchic assaults usually find their target.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if you use your warband's third action or card that Scatters in the same phase.

cards.name: Master of Terrain
cards.colourText: 'Turn the battlefield itself into your weapon, and you are one step closer to supremacy.'
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if an enemy fighter is taken out of action by a lethal hex.

cards.name: Neck and Neck
cards.colourText: When fate hangs in the balance, the finest warriors shine the brightest.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you and an opponent are tied for the same number of glory points (at least 1).

cards.name: No Heroes
cards.colourText: 'All we need down here is to kill-kill. Honour is for the weak.' - Skritch Spiteclaw
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if there are at least three surviving friendly fighters, and none of them are Inspired.

cards.name: No Openings
cards.colourText: Shadespire's many defences include the shield walls of those who died to protect it.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your opponent scored no objectives in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Nowhere to Go
cards.colourText: 'Let's see you scurry out of this one, you verminous little cur!' - Severin Steelheart
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if each hex adjacent to an enemy fighter is either occupied, blocked or lethal.

cards.name: On a Roll
cards.colourText: Victory has a momentum all of its own, one that, once it gathers, is hard to stop.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you scored at least four other objective cards in this round.

cards.name: One Fate
cards.colourText: In the Mirrored City, every path of fate leads to the same destination.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if you roll three or more dice in an attack or defence roll and they all show the same symbol.

cards.name: Opening Gambit
cards.colourText: A swift and sure strike can often prove the difference between victory and defeat.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you scored at least one objective card in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Our Powers Combined
cards.colourText: Cruelty loves company.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if all of the successes (at least two) in your attack or defence roll were support symbols.

cards.name: Patient Commander
cards.colourText: Patience is for the wise, haste is for the foolish.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if you took the second activation in each round.

cards.name: Peerless Fighter
cards.colourText: A single masterful blow can crumple the resolve of an entire army.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if there are two or more in your attack roll.

cards.name: Preserve Life
cards.colourText: To defeat the enemy, you must first outlast them.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you removed at least one wound token from each of at least two surviving friendly fighters in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Preserve Their Knowledge
cards.colourText: The Katophranes may be gone, but their wondrous learnings have not yet been erased from existence.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all surviving friendly fighters (at least three) have at least one Katophrane Tome.

cards.name: Press the Advantage
cards.colourText: A sense of impending victory has a potent bolstering effect.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you have more glory points than an opponent.

cards.name: Quick on Your Feet
cards.colourText: Keep moving, swift as the wind, and let your instincts be your guide.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all surviving friendly fighters (at least three) made a Move action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Scorched Earth
cards.colourText: Attrition and despair are both useful weapons of war.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your warband removes an objective from the battlefield.

cards.name: Seize the Initiative
cards.colourText: The opening move sets the tone for the battle to come.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if you have three or more when rolling to determine who takes the first activation in a round and win that roll.

cards.name: Singled Out
cards.colourText: Putting all arrows in the single quiver is a risk, but it makes for a deadly archer indeed.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if a surviving friendly fighter has three or more upgrades.

cards.name: Solid Gains
cards.colourText: Triumph builds upon triumph, until your position becomes unassailable.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you gained at least 3 glory points in this round.

cards.name: Sorcerous Duel
cards.colourText: 'In Sigmar's name, you shall fall before my might!' - Averon Stormsire
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter takes an enemy wizard out of action with a spell.

cards.name: Sorcerous Retort
cards.colourText: 'Suffer no insult, and let no deed of the foe go unpunished.' - Vortemis the All-seeing
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your warband successfully casts a spell as a reaction.

cards.name: Sorcerous Scouring
cards.colourText: 'With arcane fire and forbidden lore we shall purge them from our lands.'
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your warband takes an enemy fighter out of action with a spell.

cards.name: Stand Firm
cards.colourText: The most dauntless warbands are those who are completely united in their defiance.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if all surviving friendly fighters (at least three) have one or more Guard tokens.

cards.name: Strong Start
cards.colourText: 'One ta nuffink and we've only just seen 'em! We've got this in da bag, ladz.' - Redkap
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if the first fighter taken out of action in this round is an enemy fighter.

cards.name: Supremacy
cards.colourText: The Mirrored City itself shrinks before your might.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you hold three or more objectives.

cards.name: Swift Beheading
cards.colourText: 'Thy king's head is mine.' - the Harvester
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy leader out of action in the preceding action phase, and that leader was the first fighter taken out of action in this game.

cards.name: Tactical Supremacy 1-4
cards.colourText: Grasp this city in your fist and squeeze. Only by exerting sufficient force will you achieve conquest.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you hold objectives 1 and 4.

cards.name: Tactical Supremacy 2-5
cards.colourText: 'The glory of Shadespire is not found in its individual treasures, but in the confluence of minds and souls.' - The Sepulchral Warden
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you hold objectives 2 and 5.

cards.name: Tempting Target
cards.colourText: A richly appointed warrior is just a loot-worthy corpse waiting to happen.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your warband takes an enemy fighter with at least two upgrades out of action.

cards.name: Thin Their Ranks
cards.colourText: Enemies abound in Shadespire, but they are not completely without limit.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if three or more enemy fighters are out of action.

cards.name: Tireless Slayer
cards.colourText: 'By Khorne, this is a blessed place!' - Karsus the Chained
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if a single friendly fighter took three or more enemy fighters out of action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Total Dominance
cards.colourText: 'Distant thunder, Cursebreakers. Sigmar is pleased this day.' - Averon Stormsire
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if there are no surviving enemy fighters and no friendly fighters out of action.

cards.name: Trash to Treasure
cards.colourText: It is a fine thing to watch your foes cast away that which they once held dear.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if an opponent discards three objective cards in an end phase.

cards.name: United
cards.colourText: In the Mirrored City, the enemy is never far away. It therefore pays to have your allies close at hand.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all surviving friendly fighters (at least two) are in a single group with each fighter adjacent to at least one other friendly fighter.

cards.name: Versatile Fighter
cards.colourText: The most dangerous fighters are deadly at any range.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if the same friendly fighter made both an Attack action with a Range of 1 or 2 and an Attack action with a Range of 3 or more in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: What Armour?
cards.colourText: Even the most artfully forged plate can be sundered by a well-placed strike.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter's Attack action with Cleave succeeds.

cards.name: Witch-slayer
cards.colourText: Some of those trapped in Shadespire harbour an especial hatred for enemy sorcerers.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if your leader takes an enemy wizard out of action.

cards.name: With Our Bare Hands
cards.colourText: 'Ya can keep yer fancy wotsits and shiny fingz. We'll nick 'em off yer corpse later!' - Stikkit
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if there are at least three surviving friendly fighters, and no surviving friendly fighter has an upgrade.

cards.name: Abasoth's Unmaking
cards.colourText: A jagged chant, a rushed spill of crackling un-words, and reality is shattered into dissipating shards. All that remains are embers, and a brimstone reek.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose an objective token within four hexes of the caster. Remove it from the battlefield.

cards.name: Abasoth's Withering
cards.colourText: This baleful curse withers the target's flesh to dust.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose an enemy fighter within four hexes of the caster. That fighter has -1 Wounds (to a minimum of 1). This spell persists until that fighter is out of action.

cards.name: Aetherflux
cards.colourText: In the Mirrored City, even magic can become strangely distorted.
cards.rulesText: Until the next power step, spells that would require instead require and vice versa.

cards.name: Aggressive Defence
cards.colourText: 'Come closer, dear heart...' - the Briar Queen
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this during an Attack action that targets a friendly fighter, before the attack roll. You cannot make a defence roll, but the target of the Attack action cannot be driven back. After the Attack action, if the friendly fighter survives, immediately make an Attack action with that fighter that targets their attacker.

cards.name: Amnesiac Backlash
cards.colourText: '... what was I saying?'
cards.rulesText: Reaction : Cast this spell after an enemy fighter casts a spell. If this spell is cast, that fighter suffers 1 damage and they can no longer cast spells. This spell persists until that fighter is out of action.

cards.name: Arcane Recall
cards.colourText: In the Mirrored City, echoes of the past can be summoned back into being.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose one gambit spell from your power discard pile and add it to your hand.

cards.name: Arcane Shield
cards.colourText: A shield of sorcerous energies that can turn aside bolt and blade.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, reduce all damage suffered by the caster by 1, to a minimum of 1. This spell persists until the caster is out of action.

cards.name: Arcane Smothering
cards.colourText: Like a raging fire, the energies of a spell can be quashed and thus extinguished.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose one persisting spell. That spell is discarded.

cards.name: Arcane Transposition
cards.colourText: Space and time can be easily manipulated within the halls of the Mirrored City.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, switch the positions of two adjacent fighters.

cards.name: Baffling Illusion
cards.colourText: In Shadespire, you can't even trust your eyes.
cards.rulesText: The first time a fighter would make a Move action in the next activation, their player instead Scatters X from the hex that fighter occupies, and pushes the fighter along the chain to the end hex. X is the fighter's Move characteristic. If the fighter cannot be pushed into a hex, the push ends in the last hex in the chain they can occupy. Place a Move token next to that fighter.

cards.name: Black-powder Sphere
cards.colourText: Black-powder is as effective as it is dangerous to use.
cards.rulesText: Choose a hex (other than a blocked hex) within three hexes of a friendly fighter, and Scatter 1 from that hex. Then roll an attack dice. On a roll of or , any fighter in or adjacent to the end hex suffers 1 damage.

cards.name: Bolt of Inspiration
cards.colourText: Like death, inspiration can come when it is least expected.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, Scatter 1 from any hex on the battlefield. Any fighter in the end hex is Inspired.

cards.name: Centre of Attention
cards.colourText: Sometimes it's good to be right in the middle of things - battle being a notable exception.
cards.rulesText: Choose a fighter and push all other fighters that are within two hexes of that fighter up to one hex so that they are closer to that fighter in an order you choose. If a fighter cannot be pushed in this way, do not push them.

cards.name: Commanding Stride
cards.colourText: A good leader can get themselves into or out of harm's way with equal ease.
cards.rulesText: Push your leader up to three hexes. They must end this push on a starting hex.

cards.name: Confusing Reflection
cards.colourText: In Shadespire, you can never trust your senses.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this when an enemy fighter successfully casts a spell with Scatter, before they resolve the Scatter. You resolve the Scatter instead. The effect of the spell remains the same.

cards.name: Confusion
cards.colourText: It pays to keep your enemy guessing.
cards.rulesText: Choose two fighters that are adjacent to each other and switch them.

cards.name: Countercharge
cards.colourText: What better way to counter the enemy's onslaught than with one of your own?
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an enemy fighter's Move action that is part of a Charge action. Choose a friendly fighter and push them up to three hexes. They must end this push adjacent to the enemy fighter.

cards.name: Damning Pact
cards.colourText: 'Dark Gods! I offer unto you my heart's blood. Now let fly your wrath!' - Theddra
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly wizard. They suffer 1 damage. The first time they attempt to cast a spell before the next power step, any fighter damaged by that spell suffers 1 additional damage.

cards.name: Dancing with Death
cards.colourText: The whirl of a close-fought melee can have a strange beauty. It soon turns to ugliness.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action that targets a friendly fighter and fails. You can push the target up to two hexes.

cards.name: Death Frenzy
cards.colourText: Some parting gifts are more savage than others.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this during an enemy warband's gambit or enemy fighter's Attack action that takes a friendly fighter out of action. For each fighter adjacent to that fighter, roll an attack dice. On a roll of the fighter being rolled for suffers 1 damage.

cards.name: Death Grip
cards.colourText: Discretion is the better part of valour, but a strong hold is the better part of belligerence.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter. Enemy fighters adjacent to that fighter can't be pushed until the next power step.

cards.name: Determined Effort
cards.colourText: Grit your teeth and get the task done.
cards.rulesText: +1 Dice for the first Attack action in the next activation

cards.name: Emboldened
cards.colourText: 'Ha! They ain't so tough! We got 'em where we wants 'em, ladz!' - Zarbag
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action that targets a friendly fighter and fails. Remove up to one wound token from that fighter's fighter card.

cards.name: Empathic Exchange
cards.colourText: 'Your pain is my pain.' - Ylthari
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell(): If this spell is cast, choose a friendly fighter adjacent to the caster. Take up to 2 wound tokens from that fighter's fighter card and put them on the caster's fighter card.

cards.name: Encroaching Shadow
cards.colourText: Those who tarry too long in the shadows of Shadespire are like to vanish without trace...
cards.rulesText: Choose an enemy fighter in an edge hex. They suffer 1 damage.

cards.name: Entropic Curse
cards.colourText: Shyishan magic needn't be swift in order to be deadly.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose an enemy fighter within four hexes of the caster. That fighter suffers 1 damage at the beginning of each round, before the first activation. This spell persists until that fighter is out of action.

cards.name: Ephemeral Form
cards.colourText: In Shadespire, even the sturdiest warriors are naught but light and shadow.
cards.rulesText: The first fighter to be the target of an Attack action in the next activation has a Defence characteristic (before other modifiers) of 2, instead of their usual characteristic.

cards.name: Fearful Visage
cards.colourText: Fear is a weakness to be exploited.
cards.rulesText: Choose a fighter. The first fighter to make an Attack action while adjacent to that fighter in the next activation has -1 Dice, to a minimum of 1.

cards.name: Flexible Strategy
cards.colourText: Even the best-laid plans rarely survive contact with the enemy.
cards.rulesText: Discard an objective card and draw an objective card.

cards.name: Ghoulish Pact
cards.colourText: A profane act of bloodletting can set the heart pounding and the spirit raging - for a time.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter and an upgrade card from your hand that you can apply to that fighter. That fighter suffers 1 damage. If they survive, apply the upgrade to that fighter.

cards.name: Grievous Riposte
cards.colourText: Failure has a heavy price.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action with a Range of 1 that targets a friendly fighter and fails, if there are any in your defence roll. The attacker suffers 2 damage.

cards.name: Grinding Earth
cards.colourText: The ground opens to devour the unwary, splintering into a grinding maw of razor-sharp shards.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose an empty hex adjacent to the caster and place the chasm token on it. A hex with a chasm token is a lethal hex. Remove the token at the end of the action phase.

cards.name: Haymaker
cards.colourText: 'My grandsire taught me how to punch, and he once felled a troggoth!' - Mad Maegrim
cards.rulesText: +2 Dice for the first Attack action made by a friendly fighter in the next activation. You cannot make defence rolls for that fighter. The latter effect persists until that fighter is out of action or the end of the round, whichever happens first.

cards.name: Healing Pulse
cards.colourText: Life magic flows in burgeoning waves, a distant echo of the pulse of far Ghyran.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose a friendly fighter within four hexes of the caster. Remove up to one wound token from that fighter's fighter card at the beginning of each round, before the first activation. This spell persists until that fighter is out of action.

cards.name: Imbue with Life
cards.colourText: You cannot claim what you cannot catch...
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose an objective token within four hexes of the caster. Scatter 2 from that token's hex, and place the objective token in the end hex. If the end hex is blocked, lethal or contains an objective token, or if the chain would leave the battlefield, leave the objective token where it is.

cards.name: Incredible Leap
cards.colourText: Within the Mirrored City, one must be wary of the dangers that lie in every direction.
cards.rulesText: The first fighter to make a Move action in the next activation can pass through blocked and occupied hexes, and treats lethal hexes as normal hexes. They must end this move in an empty hex.

cards.name: Infinite Riches
cards.colourText: Why fight and bleed for treasure when you can simply conjure it into being?
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose one upgrade from your power discard pile and add it to your hand.

cards.name: Instinctive Denial
cards.colourText: A will of iron can sometimes be better protection than a suit of sigmarite armour.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this when an enemy fighter adjacent to a friendly fighter casts a spell, before the spell is resolved. Roll a defence dice. On a roll of or that spell is not cast.

cards.name: Irresistible Prize
cards.colourText: Greed is a predictable emotion, and an easy one to exploit.
cards.rulesText: Choose an objective token. Push all fighters that are within two hexes of that token up to one hex so that they are standing on or closer to that token in an order you choose. If a fighter cannot be pushed in this way, do not push them.

cards.name: Lethal Ward
cards.colourText: Some of Shadespire's haunted relics have a life of their own - and power enough to kill.
cards.rulesText: Choose an objective token. Any fighter in the same hex as that token suffers 1 damage.

cards.name: Levitation
cards.colourText: Borne aloft upon wings of sorcery, you look down upon the battlefield like an arrogant god.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, the caster treats lethal hexes as normal hexes. This spell persists until the caster is out of action or the end of the phase, whichever happens first.

cards.name: Lifesurge
cards.colourText: The purest form of life magic does not distinguish between friend and foe.
cards.rulesText: Remove one wound token from all fighter cards that have at least one wound token.

cards.name: Magical Damping
cards.colourText: 'All that has been crafted can also be unmade.' - Tome of Incantations
cards.rulesText: Reaction (): Cast this spell during an attempt to cast a spell, after the dice are rolled but before the spell is resolved or fails (and before the defence roll, if it is a spell Attack action). If this spell is cast, any damage caused by the other spell is reduced by 1.

cards.name: Magical Dearth
cards.colourText: The thick gloom of Shadespire can smother all but the brightest sparks of magic.
cards.rulesText: Until the end of the power step, only rolls of are successes when a fighter attempts to cast a spell.

cards.name: Mirror Move
cards.colourText: Amidst the halls of the Katophranes, reflection can swiftly become reality.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an opponent pushes a fighter. Choose a different fighter and push them the same number of hexes.

cards.name: Noble Sacrifice
cards.colourText: A brave warrior defends their leader. A wise leader surrounds themselves with brave warriors.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this during an Attack action that targets your leader, before any dice are rolled. Choose a friendly fighter adjacent to your leader, and roll a defence dice. On a roll of , or , switch the positions of the fighter you chose and your leader. The fighter you chose is now the target of the Attack action.

cards.name: One Step Ahead
cards.colourText: Anticipating your enemy's movements is the first step towards defeating them.
cards.rulesText: You can only play this card in the final power step of a round. Choose an opponent and name an objective, then roll an attack dice. On a roll of or that opponent cannot score that objective in the subsequent end phase.

cards.name: Piling On
cards.colourText: Slaughter is at its best when performed as a group activity.
cards.rulesText: The first Attack action with a Range of 1 or 2 in the next activation has +1 Damage for each supporting fighter after the first.

cards.name: Pit Trap
cards.colourText: The hazards of the retrograde advance are many, and often lined with spikes...
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action that drives an enemy fighter back. They suffer 1 damage.

cards.name: Power Surge
cards.colourText: 'Its awright, ladz. I've got it... probably...' - Zarbag, Moonclan Shaman
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this during an attempt to cast a spell, after the dice are rolled but before the spell is resolved or fails, if at least one was rolled in the casting roll. Add a to the casting roll.

cards.name: Quick Exchange
cards.colourText: 'Bait, switch, and hack.' - Targor to Arnulf, prior to the decapitation of Sir Valorine
cards.rulesText: Choose two adjacent friendly fighters who each have at least one upgrade that could be applied to the other fighter. Take an upgrade from each fighter and apply it to the other fighter. Each fighter must be eligible for that upgrade.

cards.name: Quintok's Gamble
cards.colourText: The magician Quintok believed a good trick was worth repeating.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, shuffle your power discard pile face down, then add the top card to your hand.

cards.name: Razormaw Swarm
cards.colourText: Flesh, metal, bone - the swarm devours all.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, Scatter 3 from the caster's hex. Any fighter in any hex in the chain suffers 2 damage.

cards.name: Regal Vision
cards.colourText: The echoes of futures yet to come can inspire hope as well as strike fear into the heart.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter that is holding an objective. That fighter becomes Inspired.

cards.name: Rend the Earth
cards.colourText: A surge of magic causes the earth surrounding the caster to splinter into jagged shards.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, all fighters adjacent to the caster suffer 1 damage.

cards.name: Revoke
cards.colourText: 'An improperly obtained grudge-clause shall be subject to immediate revocation.' - Amendment 36 of the Kharadron Code
cards.rulesText: Choose one persisting ploy. That ploy is discarded.

cards.name: Shadowed Step
cards.colourText: In the darkness there are many hidden paths.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter with no Move or Charge tokens and place them on an empty hex in no one's territory. Place a Move token next to them.

cards.name: Shifting Reflection
