cards.colourText: Those who stare too long into shadeglass may find their view of the world around them suddenly changed.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter and an enemy fighter that are both holding an objective. Switch those fighters' positions.

cards.name: Sidestep
cards.colourText: Quick footwork can position a warrior for the killing blow.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter and push them one hex.

cards.name: Silence
cards.rulesText: Choose an enemy fighter. They cannot attempt to cast spells for the remainder of the power step.

cards.name: Sorcerous Insight
cards.colourText: Memory becomes echo, echo resonance, resonance reality wrought anew.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose one ploy from your power discard pile and add it to your hand.

cards.name: Sorcerous Riposte
cards.colourText: If at first you don't succeed, an agonising death awaits you.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell () Reaction: Play this after an Attack action that targets a friendly wizard and fails. If this spell is cast, the attacker suffers 2 damage.

cards.name: Soul Drain
cards.colourText: At the moment of death, an enemy's life force can be drawn off and consumed.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell () Reaction: Cast this spell after an Attack action or gambit that takes an enemy fighter out of action. If this spell is cast, remove up to one wound token from the caster's fighter card.

cards.name: Sphere of Aqshy
cards.colourText: Wrought from the arcane energies of the Realm of Fire, this orb immolates all it touches.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose an enemy fighter within four hexes of the caster. That fighter suffers 1 damage.

cards.name: Sphere of Azyr
cards.colourText: 'Your very presence pollutes this place of power. Begone!' - Averon Stormsire
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose an enemy fighter holding an objective. They suffer 1 damage.

cards.name: Sphere of Chamon
cards.colourText: A quicksilver blessing for your allies, a weighty curse for your foes.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose a fighter within three hexes of the caster. That fighter has a Defence characteristic (before other modifiers) of 1. This spell persists until the next power step or that fighter is out of action, whichever happens first.

cards.name: Sphere of Ghur
cards.colourText: With a bellowed word, the fighter is filled with bestial fury.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, the first Attack action made by a fighter standing within four hexes of the caster has +1 Dice. This spell persists until such an Attack action is made or the caster is out of action, whichever happens first.

cards.name: Sphere of Ghyran
cards.colourText: The life-giving light of this sphere fills those who bask in it with renewed vigour.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose the caster or a friendly fighter adjacent to the caster. Remove 1 wound token from that fighter's fighter card.

cards.name: Sphere of Hysh
cards.colourText: The energies of the Realm of Light can bring illumination, certainty and speed of thought.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, Attack actions in the next activation have +1 Dice.

cards.name: Sphere of Shyish
cards.colourText: The cold grasp of the Great Necromancer carries a particular dread in this cursed city.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose an enemy fighter within three hexes of the caster. Wound tokens cannot be removed from that fighter's card. This spell persists until that fighter is out of action.

cards.name: Sphere of Ulgu
cards.colourText: The shrouding mists of the Realm of Shadows can steal away all certainty.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, Attack actions in the next activation have -1 Dice, to a minimum of 1.

cards.name: Spiked Surface
cards.colourText: In Shadespire, the walls have ears. Sometimes they also have spikes.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this during a friendly fighter's Attack action in which the target fighter is trapped and is in an edge hex and/or adjacent to a blocked hex. The target fighter suffers 1 damage.

cards.name: Spirit Sacrifice
cards.colourText: All power has its price.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly wizard. They suffer 1 damage. The first time that fighter attempts to cast a spell, roll an extra dice in the casting roll. This effect persists until that fighter attempts to cast a spell or is out of action, whichever happens first.

cards.name: Stand and Shoot
cards.colourText: 'Come closer. I dare you.' - Eagle-Eye
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an enemy fighter's Move action that is part of a Charge action. Choose a friendly fighter that is adjacent to them, and make an Attack action with that fighter that has a Range of 3 or more. It must target the enemy fighter, and that fighter cannot be driven back by this Attack action.

cards.name: Strategic Sorcery
cards.colourText: Only those who deal in sorcery can afford to dwell on past victories.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose one objective card from your objective discard pile and add it to your hand, then discard an objective card if you have more than three in your hand.

cards.name: Sudden Paranoia
cards.colourText: 'You all call me paranoid when my tail is turned, yes-yes?' - Skritch Spiteclaw
cards.rulesText: Enemy fighters cannot provide support during the first Attack action in the next activation.

cards.name: Taunting Challenge
cards.colourText: 'Strike! I dare you.' - Blooded Saek
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an enemy fighter's Move action that is part of a Charge action. Choose a friendly fighter adjacent to that fighter. If the enemy fighter does not target that fighter with their subsequent Attack action, the enemy fighter is no longer Inspired and cannot be Inspired. The latter effect persists until the enemy fighter is out of action.

cards.name: Terrifying Visage
cards.colourText: Those who behold the caster see their greatest fears made manifest.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, enemy fighters adjacent to the caster have -1 Dice, to a minimum of 1, when they make Attack actions. This spell persists until the caster is out of action.

cards.name: Trading Up
cards.colourText: 'Even betta ta bash you with!' - Hakka
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter with at least one upgrade. Discard one upgrade from that fighter, and apply another upgrade to that fighter from your hand.

cards.name: Transfixing Stare
cards.colourText: Fear can freeze an enemy in their tracks.
cards.rulesText: Choose an enemy fighter within two hexes of a friendly fighter and place a Move token next to them.

cards.name: Unchecked Energy
cards.colourText: Some shadeglass-rich sites can discharge the vital force of those trapped within the mirrors.
cards.rulesText: Choose a lethal hex. Roll an attack dice for each fighter in or adjacent to that hex. On a roll of or the fighter being rolled for suffers 1 damage.

cards.name: Unfocused Blast
cards.colourText: With enemies in every shadow, there is no need to steer arcane energies in a single direction.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, do the following. Scatter 1 from the caster's hex: any fighter in the end hex suffers 1 damage. Do this two more times, scattering from the caster's hex each time.

cards.name: Vertigo
cards.colourText: Out-of-control momentum takes a lot of getting used to - but it is possible.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this during an action or gambit that uses the scatter token, after the scatter token is placed but before any dice are rolled. Choose how the scatter token is oriented.

cards.name: Vital Surge
cards.colourText: The revitalising touch of magic seals gaping wounds and stitches together shattered bones.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose a friendly fighter and remove up to two wound tokens from their fighter card.

cards.name: Whip into a Frenzy
cards.colourText: Some forms of motivation are less subtle than others.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter. They suffer 1 damage. Their first Attack action with a Range of 1 or 2 in the next activation has +1 Damage.

cards.name: Arcane Familiar
cards.colourText: Familiars are physical manifestations of magic that bolster and empower their master's spells.
cards.rulesText: Each time this fighter attempts to cast a spell, after the casting roll, you can change one of the symbols rolled to .

cards.name: Arcane Focus
cards.colourText: A centred mind is as deadly as the sharpest blade.
cards.rulesText: Action: This fighter's next casting roll in this phase has Innate ().

cards.name: Arcane Savant
cards.colourText: Death can come unexpectedly in Shadespire, as can knowledge.
cards.rulesText: +1 wizard level. Apply this upgrade only to a level 1 wizard.

cards.name: Archer's Focus
cards.colourText: This warrior is able to strike the smallest target with unerring accuracy.
cards.rulesText: You can re-roll one dice in the attack roll each time this fighter makes an Attack action with a Range of 3 or more.

cards.name: Bag of Tricks
cards.colourText: The wiliest fighters prepare for every eventuality.
cards.rulesText: Action: Search your power deck for a card, reveal it and add it to your hand. Then shuffle your power deck and place a Charge token next to this fighter.

cards.name: Binding Shard
cards.colourText: Chains of crackling sorcery reach out to bind foes and anchor allies.
cards.rulesText: Fighters adjacent to this fighter cannot be pushed (or driven back).

cards.name: Blessing of Argentine
cards.colourText: Those born under the sign of the Silver Wyrm are swift to strike back against threats.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an adjacent enemy's Attack action that damages this fighter, their attacker suffers 1 damage.

cards.name: Blessing of Hydragos
cards.colourText: With its many heads, the godbeast Hydragos was able to level an unrelenting assault against its enemies.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After this fighter's Attack action that succeeds, push this fighter up to two hexes.

cards.name: Blessing of Ignax
cards.colourText: Drawing upon the power of the Solar Drake, the warrior's weapons burst into raging flame.
cards.rulesText: Action: This fighter's next Attack action with a Range of 1 or 2 in this round has +2 Damage.

cards.name: Blessing of Vytrix
cards.colourText: The light of stars flows through the chosen of the godbeast.
cards.rulesText: Innate ()

cards.name: Butcher's Eye
cards.colourText: A sixth sense for the sure kill can take you far in the Mirrored City.
cards.rulesText: If there are any in an attack roll for this fighter's Attack action, resolve that Attack action as if it had Cleave.

cards.name: Chained Spite
cards.colourText: Size is far less important than savagery.
cards.rulesText: Action: Scatter 3 from this fighter's hex. Choose one fighter standing in a hex in the chain. They suffer 1 damage.

cards.name: Challenge Seeker
cards.colourText: To become great, one must first face those who are greater.
cards.rulesText: When this fighter makes an Attack action that targets a fighter with a higher Wounds characteristic than itself, that Attack action has +1 Dice.

cards.name: Champion's Fortitude
cards.colourText: Some warriors are born to weather the storm of blades so that others may thrive unharmed.
cards.rulesText: You can re-roll one defence dice each time you make a defence roll for this fighter.

cards.name: Circlet of Companionship
cards.colourText: The Katophranes were once content to make artefacts that fostered brotherhood and unity.
cards.rulesText: When this fighter is adjacent to two or more friendly fighters, this fighter has +1 Defence.

cards.name: Cloak of Shadows
cards.colourText: This cloak? They say it is made from gyrspider silk and the locks of murderous queens.
cards.rulesText: While this fighter is adjacent to no fighters, this fighter has +1 Defence.

cards.name: Crown of Avarice
cards.colourText: Heavy is the head that wears the crown.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an Attack action or gambit that will take this fighter out of action, choose an opponent and take up to one of their unspent glory points.

cards.name: Dirty Fighting
cards.colourText: 'Bash da blade wide, then knee 'em right between the legs. Wot a larf!' - Hakka
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After this fighter's Attack action that targets an adjacent enemy fighter and fails, roll an attack dice. On a roll of or that enemy fighter suffers 1 damage.

cards.name: Distracting Blow
cards.colourText: Nothing breaks concentration quicker than a blade to the face.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: When an adjacent enemy fighter attempts to cast a spell, but before the casting roll, make this Attack action.

cards.name: Disturbing Presence
cards.colourText: 'If you look away, he'll rip your lungs out through your back. But don't look directly at him, either.' - Ollo
cards.rulesText: Enemy fighters adjacent to this fighter cannot make Charge actions.

cards.name: Duellist's Speed
cards.colourText: The deadliest fighters are never where their opponents expect them to be.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After this fighter's Attack action, push them up to one hex.

cards.name: Earthing Stone
cards.colourText: In the presence of this seemingly innocuous stone, even the grandest treasure appears worthless.
cards.rulesText: If this fighter is standing on an objective token in a player's territory, no fighters in that territory are considered to be holding objectives.

cards.name: Enchanted Greaves
cards.colourText: 'Nuffink can stop me now!' - Stikkit, prior to falling into the Abyss of Shards
cards.rulesText: This fighter treats lethal hexes as normal hexes.

cards.name: Envoy's Prerogative
cards.colourText: Success in combat begins with defining the rules of engagement.
cards.rulesText: Action: Draw an objective card, then discard an objective card.

cards.name: Escape Artist
cards.colourText: 'Stand and fight, you slippery wretch!'
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After an enemy fighter's Attack action that targets this fighter and fails, push this fighter up to one hex.

cards.name: Fading Form
cards.colourText: 'I am the mist, come to gather you in my cruel embrace.' - Ylthari
cards.rulesText: This fighter treats lethal hexes as normal hexes and can move through blocked and occupied hexes, but cannot end their move in a blocked or occupied hex.

cards.name: Faneway Crystal
cards.colourText: 'Step away from the bounds of the tangible, and onto the endless paths of the beyond.'
cards.rulesText: When this fighter makes a Move action, they do not move normally. Instead, place them on any objective token, then discard this card. It is still considered to be a Move action.

cards.name: Fated Blade
cards.colourText: The fell sentience that inhabits this blade knows the fated hour of each mortal's death.
cards.rulesText: Roll five attack dice each time this Attack action succeeds. Its Damage characteristic is equal to the number of and rolled.

cards.name: Fighter's Ferocity
cards.colourText: Sheer fury brings strength to a warrior's arm, and a swift end to his enemy's life.
cards.rulesText: If you score a critical hit when making an Attack action with this fighter, that Attack action has +1 Damage.

cards.name: Gallant's Courage
cards.colourText: 'In Sigmar's name, not a step backward shall we take!' - Angharad Brightshield
cards.rulesText: When this fighter is the target of an Attack action, they cannot be driven back if there are any successes in their defence roll.

cards.name: Gloryseeker
cards.colourText: 'The bigger the target, the more meat there is to catch your blade.' - Garodd Alensen
cards.rulesText: +1 Damage to this fighter's Attack actions that target a fighter with a Wounds characteristic of 4 or more.

cards.name: Great Fortitude
cards.colourText: This warrior can take a strike from a drunken gargant and keep on fighting.
cards.rulesText: +1 Wounds

cards.name: Great Speed
cards.colourText: This warrior is as swift as a loosed arrow.
cards.rulesText: +1 Move

cards.name: Great Strength
cards.colourText: This warrior strikes with the strength of a river troggoth.
cards.rulesText: +1 Damage to all Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2

cards.name: Hammer of Scorn
cards.colourText: The slightest tap from this mighty weapon is enough to send an armoured warrior flying.

cards.name: Horrifying Armour
cards.colourText: Quenched in the blood of heroes, this spiked plate causes pain to wearer and foe alike.
cards.rulesText: -1 Wound (to a minimum of 1). Adjacent enemy fighters' Attack actions have -1 Dice, to a minimum of 1.

cards.name: Hunter's Tenacity
cards.colourText: A true hunter never relents when bringing down their prey.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After this fighter makes an Attack action against an adjacent enemy fighter that drives them back, push this fighter into the hex the other fighter was in.

cards.name: Loathe Stone
cards.colourText: This innocuous-looking stone has a withering effect on arcane energies.
cards.rulesText: Players roll 1 fewer dice in the casting roll (to a minimum of 1) for fighters that attempt to cast a spell within two hexes of this fighter.

cards.name: Low Cunning
cards.colourText: The deadliest blow falls ever from an unexpected angle.
cards.rulesText: Fighters supported by this fighter have +1 Damage on their Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2.

cards.name: Lucky Trinket
cards.colourText: This unassuming token thrums to life whenever it detects the flare of magical energy.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an enemy fighter's spell or spell Attack action, if the spell is cast and the caster is within three hexes of this fighter, roll three magic dice. If you roll at least one

cards.name: Mirror of Spite
cards.colourText: A cursed mirror of darkened shadeglass can soon see the aggressor turned victim.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an enemy fighter's Attack action that takes this fighter out of action, before removing them from the battlefield, all adjacent enemy fighters suffer 1 damage.

cards.name: Mutating Maul
cards.colourText: A weapon that changes shape in sympathy with its wielder's deepest desire.
cards.rulesText: When a fighter makes this Attack action, choose Cleave or Knockback 1. This Attack action has that rule in this activation.

cards.name: Nullstone Arrows
cards.colourText: Tipped with crystallised shards of the void, these arrows fly unerringly toward sources of arcane power.
cards.rulesText: You can re-roll one dice in the attack roll if the target is a wizard.

cards.name: Nullstone Axe
cards.rulesText: You can re-roll one dice in the attack roll if the target is a wizard.

cards.name: Nullstone Dagger
cards.colourText: Small and deadly, this void-resonant blade is the bane of sorcerers.
cards.rulesText: If there are any in the attack roll, this Attack action has Cleave. You can re-roll one dice in the attack roll if the target is a wizard.

cards.name: Nullstone Darts
cards.colourText: A master mage can be reduced to a dribbling imbecile with the flick of a nullstone dart.
cards.rulesText: You can re-roll one dice in the attack roll if the target is a wizard.

cards.name: Nullstone Hammer
cards.colourText: Nullstone echoes the all-consuming nothingness of the void, devouring magic and enchantments.
cards.rulesText: You can re-roll one dice in the attack roll if the target is a wizard.

cards.name: Nullstone Mace
cards.colourText: The void-stuff from which this weapon is made allows it to shatter the most resilient arcane defences.
cards.rulesText: You can re-roll up to two dice in the attack roll if the target is a wizard.

cards.name: Nullstone Spear
cards.colourText: Like a shard of the void, this weapon lances through arcane defences with ease.
cards.rulesText: You can re-roll one dice in the attack roll if the target is a wizard.

cards.name: Nullstone Sword
cards.colourText: 'This blade... It thirsts for the blood of cowards. Think I'll keep it.' - Targor
cards.rulesText: You can re-roll one dice in the attack roll if the target is a wizard.

cards.name: Paradox Armour
cards.colourText: Whether created by the Katophranes or by the anarchy of the Shyish necroquake, this armour defies all possible forms of logic.
cards.rulesText: When the target of an Attack action, this fighter counts rolls of and as successes, but does not count rolls of as successes or critical successes.

cards.name: Parrying Blade
cards.colourText: Swift as a quicksilver gale, this blade lashes out with a mind of its own.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an Attack action that targets this fighter and fails, this fighter cannot be pushed back and you make this Attack action.

cards.name: Possessed Weapon
cards.colourText: The baleful entity bound within this weapon craves pain and death, and cares not from where it finds it.
cards.rulesText: After each Attack action with a Range of 1 or 2 this fighter makes, they suffer 1 damage. Their Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2 have +1 Damage.

cards.name: Potion of Clarity
cards.colourText: This glimmering draught, when imbibed, brings focus and calm to even the most turbulent mind.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During this fighter's attempt to cast a spell, after the casting roll, discard this card. You can re-roll one dice from the casting roll.

cards.name: Potion of Constitution
cards.colourText: Immortality has never tasted so good.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an Attack action or gambit that will damage this fighter, discard this card. Reduce the damage suffered by 1, to a minimum of 1.

cards.name: Potion of Grace
cards.colourText: A silken distillation, this dusty but still delicious potion can lend great agility.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After a Move token is placed next to this fighter, discard this card. Remove that token.

cards.name: Potion of Rage
cards.colourText: Some say this potion contains a drop of Khorne's molten blood.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During this fighter's Attack action, before any dice are rolled, discard this card. The Attack action has +2 Dice until the action is resolved.

cards.name: Quick Learner
cards.colourText: That which does not kill you only makes you deadlier.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After an enemy fighter's Attack action or another warband's gambit that damages this fighter but does not take them out of action, draw a power card.

cards.name: Ready for the Fight
cards.colourText: Even a charging bull can be brought low if enough bold spears surround it.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After an enemy fighter's Move action that is part of a Charge action, you can push this fighter up to two hexes. This push must bring them adjacent to the enemy fighter.

cards.name: Regenerative Charm
cards.colourText: Bones fuse and flesh reknits under the power of this life-giving totem.
cards.rulesText: Remove up to one wound token from this fighter's fighter card at the beginning of each round.

cards.name: Reinforced Armour
cards.colourText: The sharpest blades and arrows shatter harmlessly when striking this adamantine plate.
cards.rulesText: This fighter takes no damage from Attack actions with a Damage characteristic (before modifiers) of 1, unless those result in a critical hit.

cards.name: Ritual Dagger
cards.colourText: This wicked blade channels the magical potential of its wielder to deadly effect.
cards.rulesText: When a fighter makes this Attack action, the Dice characteristic (before other modifiers) is equal to their wizard level. If there are any in the attack roll, this Attack action has Cleave.

cards.name: Scroll of Recall
cards.colourText: The most impressive acts of sorcery deserve an encore.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After this fighter's gambit spell is resolved, discard this card and roll a magic dice. On a roll of , place the gambit spell on top of your power deck instead of on your power discard pile.

cards.name: Seeking Blade
cards.colourText: 'Seek out this blade, and it will seek out the hearts of those who wish thee ill.' - inscription
cards.rulesText: Rolls of aren't successes in defence rolls for targets of this Attack action.

cards.name: Seeking Stones
cards.colourText: These stones have a target's name marked upon their surface in elaborate runework. When loosed, they seek their prey unerringly.
cards.rulesText: Rolls of are not considered successes against this Attack action.

cards.name: Shifting Map
cards.colourText: A map that leads not to what you seek, but to that which you are destined to find...
cards.rulesText: If this fighter is not out of action in the third end phase, draw an objective card. If it is worth 1 glory point, you gain 1 glory point (you cannot score the card you draw).

cards.name: Slumbering Key
cards.colourText: Some arcane locks can only be opened at the right time in the right place.
cards.rulesText: If this fighter is not out of action in the third end phase, gain 1 glory point.

cards.name: Spinning Defence
cards.colourText: A warrior cannot defeat what they cannot hit.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During an Attack action that targets this fighter and fails, this fighter cannot be pushed. Scatter 2 from this fighter's hex and push this fighter along the chain to the end hex. If the fighter cannot be pushed into a hex, the push ends in the last hex in the chain they can occupy.

cards.name: Spiteful Charm
cards.colourText: Mechloth's charm of infinite spite has claimed many an ensorcelled victim.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After an enemy fighter's Attack action that damages this fighter, discard this card. Choose one of the enemy fighter's upgrades. That card is discarded.

cards.name: Strong-arm
cards.colourText: 'Byyeee!' - Mollog
cards.rulesText: Action: Push an adjacent enemy fighter up to one hex.

cards.name: Sudden Growth
cards.colourText: As wild magic fills the air, strange and powerful changes are wrought amongst the combatants.
cards.rulesText: -2 Move (to a minimum of 0), +2 Wounds

cards.name: Swordbreaker
cards.colourText: 'Parry the blade, snap at the hilt, stab at the wielder and blood will be spilt.' - inscription
cards.rulesText: On a critical hit, you can choose one of the target fighter's upgrades that confers an Attack action. That card is discarded.

cards.name: Tome of Diseases
cards.colourText: Katophrane Tome
cards.rulesText: Action: Choose an adjacent enemy fighter. They suffer 1 damage.

cards.name: Tome of Glories
cards.colourText: Katophrane Tome
cards.rulesText: Action: If this fighter is holding an objective, gain 1 glory point. Place a Charge token next to this fighter.

cards.name: Tome of Healing
cards.colourText: As the passages within these pages are intoned, broken bones become whole and hewn flesh reknits.
cards.rulesText: Action: Choose this fighter or an adjacent friendly fighter. Remove up to one wound token from that fighter's fighter card.

cards.name: Tome of Incantations
cards.colourText: Katophrane Tome
cards.rulesText: Each time this fighter attempts to cast a spell, after the casting roll, you can change one of the symbols rolled to .

cards.name: Tome of Insight
cards.colourText: The Katophranes were well aware that the most powerful weapon is knowledge of one's enemies.
cards.rulesText: Action: Choose an opponent. They must reveal the power cards in their hand to you.

cards.name: Tome of Offerings
cards.colourText: Katophrane Tome
cards.rulesText: If this fighter takes an enemy fighter out of action, gain 1 additional glory point.

cards.name: Tome of Vitality
cards.colourText: Katophrane Tome
cards.rulesText: +1 Wounds

cards.name: Tome of Warfare
cards.colourText: Katophrane Tome
cards.rulesText: Action: Choose this fighter or an adjacent friendly fighter. Their next Attack action has +1 Dice.

cards.name: Touch of Death
cards.colourText: Radiating deathly magic, the bearer's touch turns flesh to ash and dust.
cards.rulesText: Place a Charge token next to any fighter damaged by this Attack action.

cards.name: Unstoppable Force
cards.colourText: Strength, skill and determination - all three are needed to achieve victory.
cards.rulesText: This fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2 gain Knockback 1.

cards.name: Voidsceptre
cards.colourText: The flames of sorcery flicker and die in the presence of this ornate rod.
cards.rulesText: Action: Choose a persisting effect or spell that is affecting a fighter within two hexes of this fighter. That effect or spell ends.

cards.name: Warding Scroll
cards.colourText: As the words inked upon this parchment are read, it crumbles to ash, and any arcane energies named in the incantation dissipate into nothingness.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After an enemy fighter's spell is cast, but before it is resolved, if this fighter is on the battlefield, discard this card. The spell is not cast.

cards.name: Well of Power
cards.colourText: As this wizard begins to speak words of power, the air around them crackles with sorcerous energy.
cards.rulesText: While this fighter is Inspired, you can roll an extra dice when they attempt to cast a spell.

cards.name: Focal Formation
cards.colourText: A coordinated offensive offers the best hope of victory.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly Rastus and a friendly Ammis are both holding objectives after an activation.

cards.name: Storm's Fury
cards.colourText: The best way to win a duel is with the first blow.
cards.rulesText: The first friendly fighter's Attack action in the next activation has +1 Damage.

cards.name: Hand of Sigmar
cards.colourText: 'I feel the hand of the God-King upon my shoulder, fiend, and in his name I shall destroy you.' - Rastus the Charmed
cards.rulesText: Innate ()

cards.name: Deathly Clutches
cards.colourText: Like a swarm the ghasts descend, a shrieking cloud of the malevolent dead.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately when two or more friendly fighters become Inspired at the start of your activation.

cards.name: Freezing Fear
cards.colourText: True terror can reduce even the mightiest warrior to a frozen statue.
cards.rulesText: Choose an enemy fighter adjacent to your leader. Place a Move token next to the enemy fighter.

cards.name: Haunting Obsession
cards.colourText: The malevolent dead are drawn to living souls like dustwings to a lantern's flame.
cards.rulesText: This fighter cannot be pushed while they are adjacent to any enemy fighters. If a push takes this fighter adjacent to any enemy fighters, the push ends in that hex.

cards.name: Architect of Fate
cards.colourText: No matter how hard they strive, victory will always elude those who anger Tzeentch.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter is the target of an enemy Attack action with a Dice characteristic of 3 or more that fails.

cards.name: Forewarned
cards.colourText: 'Ever-open is the eye that fate perceives.' - Narvia
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this during an Attack action that targets a friendly fighter, before the attack roll. You can re-roll any number of dice in that fighter's defence roll.

cards.name: Mark of Favour
cards.colourText: The protection offered by the Mark of Tzeentch is both potent and fickle.
cards.rulesText: Roll a defence dice each time this fighter suffers any amount of damage. On a roll of this fighter does not suffer that damage.

cards.name: Petty Vindication
cards.colourText: 'Mighta cost us a few ladz, but just look at dese shinies!' - Zarbag
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you scored two or more other objective cards in this round.

cards.name: Leaping Loon
cards.colourText: 'Stand still, you irksome little maniac!' - Obryn the Bold
cards.rulesText: Your leader has +2 Defence in the next activation.

cards.name: Really Pointy Stick
cards.colourText: As every grot worth their gubbinz knows, the longer and pointier a stick, the better!

cards.name: Worthy Kill
cards.colourText: With a single telling blow, an aspirant can become a champion.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately when a friendly fighter makes an Attack action that takes an enemy fighter with a Wounds characteristic of 4 or more out of action.

cards.name: Dark Portent
cards.colourText: When the gods speak, it is wise to listen.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this during an Attack action that targets a friendly fighter, before the attack roll. Rolls of in the attack roll are not successes or critical successes.

cards.name: Writhing Charm
cards.colourText: A charm 'gainst axe and bolt and blade, by suckled blood is the dark pact made.
cards.rulesText: When exactly 1 damage would be caused to this fighter, this fighter does not suffer that damage. When this happens, roll a defence dice. On anything but a discard this card.

cards.name: Territorial
cards.colourText: Safe havens in the Mirrored City are few, and should be guarded tenaciously.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if no enemy fighters are in your territory.

cards.name: Horrible Grin
cards.colourText: Some sights one cannot simply unsee, no matter how much one might want to...
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an enemy fighter's Attack action with a Range of 1 that targets a friendly Mollog but does not take that Mollog out of action. The enemy fighter is no longer Inspired, and cannot be Inspired. This effect persists.

cards.name: Spark of Sentience
cards.colourText: 'Did that stalagmite just move?' - Turosh
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After this fighter's activation, draw a power card.

cards.name: Steady Aim
cards.colourText: 'If a shot's worth taking, it's worth taking your time over.' - Dead-eye Lund
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately when a friendly fighter's attack roll includes only successes.

cards.name: Duardin Resilience
cards.colourText: 'If you strike, be sure to slay, lest one day vengeance finds you.' - Old Kharadron proverb
cards.rulesText: The first time a friendly fighter suffers any amount of damage in the next activation, they only suffer 1 damage.

cards.name: Disciplined Retreat
cards.colourText: 'Artycle 37:4; the appropriate response to mindless aggression is heavy firepower, coupled with a retrograde advance.' - Excerpt from the Kharadron Code
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After this fighter's Attack action, push them up to two hexes.

cards.name: Avatar of Vengeance
cards.colourText: 'Oh Lifemother, lend thine strength to me that I might avenge thy fallen leaves.' - Ahnslaine
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately if there is only one surviving friendly fighter after an activation.

cards.name: Bitter Vengeance
cards.colourText: Vengeance is a blade forged in anguish, tempered in fury and quenched in your comrades' bloodsap.
cards.rulesText: The first Attack action made by a friendly fighter in the next activation has +1 Dice for each friendly fighter that is out of action.

cards.name: Spitethorn Arrow
cards.colourText: 'Split the flesh and pierce the vein, let thorn'd barb rend black heart in twain.' - Ahnslaine
cards.rulesText: Rolls of are not successes against this Attack action. Discard this card after making this Attack action.

cards.name: Burst of Speed
cards.colourText: Speed for speed's own sake.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately when a friendly fighter makes their second or subsequent Move action in this phase.

cards.name: Champions All
cards.colourText: And there were none who could stand against that mighty band.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately when a second or subsequent enemy fighter is taken out of action in this phase, and each one was taken out of action by an Attack action made by a different friendly fighter.

cards.name: Chokepoint
cards.colourText: You call it a shortcut, I call it a deathtrap.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if a fighter is in each hex (other than blocked hexes) in no one's territory.

cards.name: Fusillade
cards.colourText: Overwhelming firepower is a plan in its own right.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband made an Attack action with a Range of 3 or more in four or more activations in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Grievous Toll
cards.colourText: 'Reap them all for the glory of Khorne!' - Ghartok
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if three or more enemy fighters, and no friendly fighters, were taken out of action in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Method in the Madness
cards.colourText: Sorcery is a fell and fickle ally, and will soon turn upon the unwary.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately when an enemy fighter is taken out of action by a spell that has Scatter.

cards.name: Overpower
cards.colourText: To stand against such a sorcerous tide is to be annihilated.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately when a friendly fighter successfully casts a spell if there were one or more in the casting roll.

cards.name: Shortcut
cards.colourText: The Mirrored City is full of hidden paths for those brave or foolish enough to take them.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately when a friendly fighter is taken out of one hex and immediately placed in a different hex, but not as a result of a push or a Move action.

cards.name: Spike
cards.colourText: The bloodshed soon reaches a peak if a fighter is brutally run through.
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately after an enemy fighter suffers damage, and they have suffered 5 or more damage in this phase (damage in excess of their Wounds characteristic counts).

cards.name: Staying Power
cards.colourText: Their numbers are legion, their advance relentless.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if there are five or more surviving friendly fighters.

cards.name: Strange Demise
cards.colourText: 'Death by magic is rarely quick, and it is never, ever clean.' - Vortemis the All-seeing
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately when an enemy fighter is taken out of action by a spell that damaged them or by a spell Attack action that damaged them.

cards.name: Warning Shot
cards.colourText: 'That was a touch too close for comfort...' - Tefk
cards.rulesText: Score this immediately when a friendly fighter's Attack action with a Range of 3 or more fails.

cards.name: Arrow Snare
cards.colourText: Swift reactions are worth a full suit of plate mail.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this during an enemy fighter's Attack action with a Range of 3 or more that targets a friendly fighter, before the attack roll. Place a Guard token next to that friendly fighter.

cards.name: Fizzle
cards.colourText: It is ever the fear of the sorcerer and the mage that the power for which they reach will one day abandon them.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this when an enemy fighter successfully casts a spell. Roll a magic dice. On a roll of that spell is not cast.

cards.name: Fumble
cards.colourText: The keenest blade is still worse than useless when gripped by the wrong hands.
cards.rulesText: The first Attack action made by an enemy fighter in the next activation has -1 Dice, to a minimum of 1.

cards.name: Galvanised
cards.colourText: 'By Grimnir's blazing fists, you'll die for that!' - Mad Maegrim
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action that takes a friendly fighter out of action. +2 Dice to the first Attack action made by a friendly fighter in the next activation.

cards.name: Inspired Attack
cards.colourText: 'NyeaaaaaAAAAGH!' - Khazgan Drakkskewer
cards.rulesText: The first Attack action with a Range of 1 made by an Inspired friendly fighter in the next activation has +1 Dice and +1 Damage.

cards.name: Keen Avarice
cards.colourText: If it's worth hoarding, then it's worth shedding blood for.
cards.rulesText: The first Attack action with a Range of 1 or 2 made by a friendly fighter in the next activation has +1 Dice and Cleave if the target is holding an objective.

cards.name: Long Shot
cards.colourText: 'Steady your aim, feel your heartbeat, centre on your target and breathe out as you squeeze the trigger...' - Dead-eye Lund
cards.rulesText: The first Attack action with a Range of 3 or more made by a friendly fighter in the next activation has +1 Range.

cards.name: Seggut's Salvo
cards.colourText: Salamador Seggut was a wizard known for his love of extreme pyrotechnic violence.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, choose an enemy fighter within three hexes of the caster. The fighter you chose suffers 1 damage and you can push them one hex - this push must take them further away from the caster.

cards.name: Shadow Shape
cards.colourText: To step beyond the bounds of the real is to become one with something other, something infinite and terrible and cold.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If this spell is cast, the caster cannot be pushed. This spell persists until the end of the round.

cards.name: Sorcerous Flourish
cards.colourText: 'Sorcery is often at its most potent when one truly enjoys its casting.' - Vortemis the All-seeing
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after resolving a spell cast by a friendly fighter that damaged one or more enemy fighters. Choose one of those enemy fighters. That fighter suffers 1 damage.

cards.name: Two Steps Forward
cards.colourText: 'Close on their position, flank 'em and drive 'em back.' - Bjorgen Thundrik
cards.rulesText: Choose two friendly fighters and push each of them one hex. Then choose an opponent: they choose one fighter from their warband and push them up to one hex.

cards.name: Upper Hand
cards.colourText: 'Dread not the weapon in your enemy's hand, but the other they drive into your back.' - Theddra Skull-scryer
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this during a friendly fighter's Attack action, when the attack roll and defence roll are compared. If the rolls are tied, add one success to the attack roll.

cards.name: Blazing Soul
cards.colourText: The brightest souls blaze like a beacon for all to see.
cards.rulesText: This fighter is Inspired and cannot be un-Inspired. This upgrade cannot be applied to a fighter that cannot be Inspired.

cards.name: Eldritch Ward
cards.colourText: There are more ways to turn a blade than with just a sturdy shield.
cards.rulesText: When this fighter suffers damage, reduce that damage by 1 to a minimum of 1.

cards.name: Huge Presence
cards.colourText: 'I ain't no smartboy, but dat don't look right.' - Basha
cards.rulesText: When an opponent chooses a target for an Attack action, they consider this fighter's hex to be a blocked hex, unless this fighter is chosen as the target.

cards.name: Leech Stone
cards.colourText: This foul Khornate curse-stone has drunk the blood of thousands.
cards.rulesText: Wound tokens cannot be removed from the fighter cards of fighters within two hexes of this fighter.

cards.name: Lethal Reflexes
cards.colourText: Death strikes lightning-swift, its grasp inescapable.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After an enemy fighter's Move action, if that fighter left a hex adjacent to this fighter during that Move action, roll an attack dice. On a roll of or that fighter suffers 1 damage.

cards.name: Prized Vendetta
cards.colourText: Vengeance is a prize hard-won and worthy of savouring.
cards.rulesText: When you apply this upgrade, choose an enemy fighter. You can re-roll all dice in attack rolls for this fighter's Attack actions that target that enemy fighter.

cards.name: Quickening Greaves
cards.colourText: 'Swift as the blade-horns of the steppes shall I run, and twice as sure of foot.' - Jagathra
cards.rulesText: In each round, you can do one of the following: push this fighter one hex before the roll to determine who has the first activation, or push this fighter one hex after the final power step.

cards.name: Spectral Armour
cards.colourText: Not all armour is forged from iron and steel.
cards.rulesText: If this fighter's Defence characteristic is , they have +1 Defence.

cards.name: Spiritbond
cards.colourText: Allies, comrades, siblings-in-arms - some bonds go deeper than mere loyalty.
cards.rulesText: When you apply this upgrade, choose a friendly fighter other than the one who receives this upgrade. While the fighter you chose is on the battlefield, they are always considered to be supporting this fighter.

cards.name: Swift as an Arrow
cards.colourText: 'It came shrieking from the dark, there and gone in a blink, leaving naught but blood and terror in its wake.' - Averon Stormsire
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After an Attack action in which there were any number of in this fighter's attack or defence roll, push this fighter up to that number of hexes.

cards.name: Unnatural Defences
cards.colourText: Some beings are so lethal in nature that even striking a blow against them brings only pain.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After an enemy fighter's Attack action with a Range of 1 that damages this fighter, roll an attack dice. On a roll of or the attacking fighter suffers 1 damage.

cards.name: Wall of Force
cards.colourText: 'Don't matter 'ow big you are, ya can't wrestle magic, ya zogger!' - Zarbag
cards.rulesText: This Attack action deals no damage when it is successful. It has Knockback X, where X is the number of successes in the attack roll.

cards.name: Bestial Cunning
cards.colourText: There is a diabolical method to the Brayherds' depravity.
cards.rulesText: Surge: Score this immediately when you play your third or subsequent gambit in a single round.

cards.name: Blood Ritual
cards.colourText: The gruesome fuel for Grashrak's primal sorceries is rarely in short supply.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if there are two or more Ritual counters on your leader's fighter card.

cards.name: Bloodshed
cards.colourText: To beastmen, carnage and mayhem are ends unto themselves.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if three or more enemy fighters are out of action.

cards.name: Conquerors
cards.colourText: The creatures of the Brayherds stampede forth from their domains whenever a more enticing territory presents itself.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband holds one or more objectives in enemy territory.

cards.name: Despoilers
cards.colourText: True victory comes only when all the enemy held dear is reduced to ruin.
cards.rulesText: Surge: Score this immediately after an activation if your warband holds three or more objectives.

cards.name: Killing Blow
cards.colourText: To Grashrak's Despoilers, there is no sight more pleasing than that of unsullied flesh being butchered.
cards.rulesText: Surge: Score this immediately when a friendly fighter's Attack action that targets a fighter that has no wound tokens takes the target fighter out of action.

cards.name: Proven Superiority
cards.colourText: In the wild, the alpha creature is the one still standing at battle's end.
cards.rulesText: Dual: Score this in an end phase

cards.name: Raiders
cards.colourText: There is no better hunting ground than the lands of a defiant enemy.
cards.rulesText: Surge: Score this immediately after an activation if three or more friendly fighters are in enemy territory.

cards.name: Stampede
cards.colourText: Beastmen strike hard and fast, and they seldom do so alone.
cards.rulesText: Surge: Score this immediately when a third or subsequent friendly fighter makes a Charge action in the same phase.

cards.name: Survival of the Fittest
cards.colourText: Bloodshed breeds strength, and death breeds opportunity.
cards.rulesText: Dual: Score this in an end phase

cards.name: Swarm the Battlefield
cards.colourText: Wherever Grashrak's Despoilers go, so follows the corruption of Chaos.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if there are one or more friendly fighters in each of the following: your territory, enemy territory, and no one's territory.

cards.name: Taint of Ruin
cards.colourText: It is not enough to despoil the land - the air itself must writhe with the power of anarchy.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband cast two or more spells in the preceding action phase.

cards.name: Baying Anger
cards.colourText: The primal fury of the Brayherds is infamous, and rightly feared.
cards.rulesText: +1 Dice to the first Range 1 or Range 2 Attack action made by a friendly fighter in the next activation.

cards.name: Baying Hatred
cards.colourText: The true children of Chaos are driven by instinctual animosity.
cards.rulesText: +1 Damage to the first Range 1 or Range 2 Attack action made by a friendly fighter in the next activation.

cards.name: Berserk Bellow
cards.colourText: There is nothing more fearful than a wounded beastman.
cards.rulesText: Choose an enemy fighter adjacent to a friendly fighter and push them up to one hex, and up to one additional hex for each wound token the friendly fighter has.

cards.name: Bestial Vigour
cards.colourText: Primal magics swirl across the battlefield, driving the herd towards their foe.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If cast, friendly fighters have +2 Move in the next activation.

cards.name: Blood Taunt
cards.colourText: The language of the Brayherds is not elegant, but it is easily understood.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter. They are dealt 1 damage. Give them a Guard token. +2 Dice to the first Attack action made by that fighter in the next activation.

cards.name: Bull Charge
cards.colourText: Grashrak's Despoilers use every weapon that nature and Chaos have bestowed upon them.
cards.rulesText: The first Attack action made by a friendly fighter as part of a Charge action in the next activation has Innate ().

cards.name: Devolve
cards.colourText: A bestial curse twists the foe in both body and mind.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If cast, choose an enemy fighter within four hexes of the caster. That fighter is dealt 1 damage. Then push that fighter up to one hex. This must take them closer to the caster.

cards.name: Skirmisher
cards.colourText: When hunting down prey, speed is as important as brute strength.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Move action (not as part of a Charge action). That fighter can make a Range 3+ Attack action.

cards.name: Vile Invaders
cards.colourText: Like carrion feeders to a corpse, the beasts of the Brayherds flock to territories they can despoil.
cards.rulesText: Choose up to two friendly Hunters and push them up to two hexes each.

cards.name: Weight of Numbers
cards.colourText: The notion of a fair fight is anathema to ungors.
cards.rulesText: +1 Damage to the first Attack action made by a friendly Hunter in the next activation if there are one or more friendly supporting Hunters.

cards.name: Blinding Attack
cards.colourText: Why work to conceal yourself when you can simply take away your hunter's ability to see?

cards.name: Bloodcrazed
cards.colourText: The scent of blood only intensifies the hunger for battle.
cards.rulesText: +1 Damage to this fighter's Range 1 and Range 2 Attack actions if this fighter has one or more wound tokens and/or is adjacent to a fighter that has one or more wound tokens.

cards.name: Cursed Flint
cards.colourText: Even the most masterfully wrought armour crumples at the touch of this Chaos-infused blade.

cards.name: Dogged Survivor
cards.colourText: There are few greater weapons than a strong instinct for self-preservation.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After an Attack action that targets this fighter and fails, push this fighter up to two hexes.

cards.name: Endless Hatred
cards.colourText: Always another foe, always another quarry, the bloodletting in Beastgrave is never-ending.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After this fighter's Attack action that takes an enemy fighter out of action, this fighter makes another Attack action. You can only use this reaction once per round.

cards.name: Heedless of Pain
cards.colourText: Pain is the one sense the beastmen seek to dull.
cards.rulesText: +1 Wounds

cards.name: Jabbing Spear
cards.colourText: Those with the shortest horns must find other ways to puncture their prey.
cards.rulesText: +1 Range to this fighter's Shortspear Attack action

cards.name: Savage Bolt
cards.colourText: Seething energy crashes into the enemy, tearing at their flesh and driving them from their feet.

cards.name: Sorcerous Trinket
cards.colourText: Grashrak has an innate understanding of the anarchic and the arcane.
cards.rulesText: You can re-roll one dice in the casting roll each time this fighter attempts to cast a spell.

cards.name: Trophy Taker
cards.colourText: Amongst the Brayherds, the severed head of one's enemy is the ultimate symbol of status.
cards.rulesText: When this fighter's Attack action takes an adjacent enemy fighter out of action, gain 1 glory point.

cards.name: Aspects of Kurnoth
cards.colourText: In Beastgrave, there is no end to the hunt.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all surviving friendly fighters are Inspired.

cards.name: Cry of the Wild
cards.colourText: Once the quarry has been sighted, it is Karthaen's horn that calls the Wild Hunt.
cards.rulesText: Dual: Score this in an end phase

cards.name: Gifts of Kurnoth
cards.colourText: Preparation is the first step towards victory.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if three or more surviving friendly fighters each have one or more upgrades.

cards.name: Hunt's End
cards.colourText: There are multiple ways to take down one's quarry.
cards.rulesText: Hybrid: Score this in an end phase

cards.name: Kurnoth's Snare
cards.colourText: In the wilds, one must always be aware of their surroundings.
cards.rulesText: Surge: Score this immediately when an enemy fighter is pushed into a lethal hex.

cards.name: Purifying Rites
cards.colourText: It is Karthaen's hope that Beastgrave itself will some day be scoured from the realms.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband holds all objectives in one or more players' territory.

cards.name: Ritual Kill
cards.colourText: 'Your blood shall flow free, and it shall wash away the corruption you have brought to this land.' - Sheoch, Kurnothi Tracker
cards.rulesText: Surge: Score this immediately when your warband takes an enemy fighter standing in the same hex as an objective out of action.

cards.name: Run Down
cards.colourText: 'Your death is as inevitable as the changing of the seasons.' - Skaeth the Huntsman
cards.rulesText: Surge: Score this immediately when a friendly fighter takes an enemy fighter out of action with an Attack action made as part of a Charge action.

cards.name: Run Through
cards.colourText: 'Die, foul creature. No longer shall you be a blight upon the realms.' - Skaeth the Huntsman
cards.rulesText: Surge: Score this immediately when your leader takes an enemy fighter out of action.

cards.name: Safety in Swiftness
cards.colourText: 'Who can catch an arrow in flight? Its speed is its armour, and the source of its deadliness.' - Althaen, Kurnothi Tracker
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if three or more surviving friendly fighters each have one or more Move and/or Charge tokens.

cards.name: Slay the Corrupted
cards.colourText: The most fallow soil can be made fertile if seeded with enough bone and flesh.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if three or more enemy fighters are out of action.

cards.name: Soulbinding
cards.colourText: The Wild Hunt seek to ensure that no more souls fall to the Katophrane curse.
cards.rulesText: Surge: Score this immediately when your warband casts a spell.

cards.name: Binding Wind
cards.colourText: With a blast of his horn, the air itself comes to Karthaen's aid.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If cast, choose an enemy fighter within four hexes of the caster. Give that fighter a Move token.

cards.name: Fleet of Foot
cards.colourText: The Wild Hunt advance on their foes with the speed of a summer storm.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter that has no Move or Charge tokens. They make a Move action.

cards.name: Healing Breeze
cards.colourText: Even in the cavernous depths of Beastgrave, the life-giving winds of Ghyran can blow strong.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If cast, pick a hex within four hexes of the caster. Heal (1) any fighters in that hex and in hexes adjacent to that hex.

cards.name: Hunt in Concert
cards.colourText: In a hunting pack, bonds of loyalty bind strong and tight.
cards.rulesText: Choose up to two friendly fighters and push each of them up to one hex.

cards.name: Might of Kurnoth
cards.colourText: 'I am the Hunt! The Hunter grows within me!' - Sheoch, Kurnothi Tracker
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If cast, choose a friendly fighter. Their Range 1 and Range 2 Attack actions have +1 Damage. This spell persists until the end of the round or until that fighter is taken out of action.

cards.name: Pounce
cards.colourText: The weak must be reaped so that the strong may thrive. This is the way of the hunt.
cards.rulesText: Push a friendly fighter up to three hexes so that they are adjacent to an enemy fighter that has one or more wound token.

cards.name: Retrieve Javelin
cards.colourText: 'That which was made to run must run. That which was made to fly must fly. That which was made to kill must kill.' - Skaeth the Huntsman
cards.rulesText: Your leader is no longer considered to have made a Javelin of the Hunt Attack action.

cards.name: Song of Swiftness
cards.colourText: The resounding blare of Karthaen's horn imbues the members of the Wild Hunt with bountiful vigour.
cards.rulesText: Friendly fighters have +1 Move. This effect persists until the end of the round or until the friendly Karthaen is taken out of action.

cards.name: Strike in Concert
cards.colourText: Just as they seek harmony in life, the Wild Hunt work in harmony to bring death to those who would desecrate the realms.
cards.rulesText: The first Range 1 or Range 2 Attack action made by a friendly fighter in the next activation has +1 Damage for each friendly supporting fighter.

cards.name: Swift as the Wind
cards.colourText: In the pursuit of their foes, the Kurnothi are as relentless as a winter's gale.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter that has one or more Move tokens. Remove one of those tokens.

cards.name: Battle Cry
cards.colourText: Any enemy that values its life can be herded, given adequate provocation.
cards.rulesText: Action: Remove all Guard tokens from adjacent enemy fighters. Push all adjacent enemy fighters up to one hex.

cards.name: Divine Strength
cards.colourText: The Kurnothi call upon their fallen god to drive their enemies from the lands that have been corrupted.
cards.rulesText: This fighter's Attack actions have Knockback 1.

cards.name: Eye of Kurnoth
cards.colourText: There is no escaping this fighter's fury when they have marked their prey for death.
cards.rulesText: This fighter's Attack actions have +1 Dice. If the target is a Quarry, this fighter's Attack actions also have Ensnare.

cards.name: Fast Shot
cards.colourText: Althaen's arrows fall swift and sharp as monsoon rains.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After this fighter's activation in which they made a Range 3+ Attack action, they make another Range 3+ Attack action.

cards.name: Great Strides
cards.colourText: It is speed, not strength, that allows prey to outrun its predator, and a predator to close ground on its prey.
cards.rulesText: +2 Move

cards.name: Hale Charm
cards.colourText: Even now, Kurnoth's gifts still protect those who are faithful to him.
cards.rulesText: When this fighter is dealt damage, reduce that damage by 1, to a minimum of 1.

cards.name: Hunting Aspect
cards.colourText: Those familiar with malkyn know that when their teeth are bared, it is already too late to run.
cards.rulesText: +2 Move

cards.name: Kurnoth's Mark
cards.colourText: 'Bring life to the lands, and death to those who would despoil them.' - Kurnothi chant
cards.rulesText: You can re-roll one dice in the defence roll when this fighter is the target of an Attack action.

cards.name: Shield Slash
cards.colourText: An enemy's offence becomes severely limited when their bones have been shattered.

cards.name: Vicious Darts
cards.colourText: At Karthaen's call, the motes of life magic in Beastgrave coalesce into barbed projectiles that fly towards his foes.

cards.name: Bravely Done!
cards.colourText: Slay the vile foe and you shall inspire your proud men-at-arms to ever-greater feats of heroism.
cards.rulesText: Surge: Score this immediately when a friendly fighter with one or more supporting fighters takes an enemy fighter out of action with an Attack action.

cards.name: Charnel House
cards.colourText: Whether it be in your own magnificent fortified encampment or amidst the ruin of the enemy's stronghold, your warriors shall know victory at any cost.
cards.rulesText: Hybrid: Score this in the third end phase

cards.name: Conquering Heroes
cards.colourText: Drive like a lance-point into the enemy's very heart.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband holds one or more objectives in enemy territory.

cards.name: Defending the Hearth
cards.colourText: What act could be more noble than fighting in defence of your lord's idyllic fief?
cards.rulesText: Surge: Score this immediately when an enemy fighter is taken out of action in your territory.

cards.name: Ghoul Pack
cards.colourText: Sound the horns! Gather about the reviled foe and hack them to bloody ruin!
cards.rulesText: Surge: Score this immediately after an activation if three or more friendly fighters are adjacent to the same enemy fighter.

cards.name: Glory of the Court
cards.colourText: Visions of magnificence burn through your underlings' diseased minds.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if three or more surviving friendly fighters are Inspired.

cards.name: In the Name of the King
cards.colourText: March forth and conquer the lands so dishonourably coveted by your vile foe.
cards.rulesText: Surge: Score this immediately after an activation if your warband holds three or more objectives.

cards.name: Incomprehensible Scheme
cards.colourText: They might appear deranged, but your Ghouls follow a cunning battle plan nonetheless.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband holds more objectives than each enemy warband.

cards.name: Mordant Triumph
cards.colourText: An unstoppable avalanche of worm-white bodies, snapping fangs and staring yellow eyes sweeps through the caverns to victory.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if you have scored five or more surge objective cards in this game.

cards.name: Mouths to Feed
cards.colourText: An army marches on its stomach, after all...
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if there are fewer surviving enemy fighters than there are enemy fighters out of action.

cards.name: Pervasive Delusion
cards.colourText: So potent is the insanity that burns through the mordants' minds that it can begin to infect their enemies' perceptions too.
cards.rulesText: Surge: Score this immediately when you play your third or subsequent gambit card in a single round.

cards.name: Shifting Madness
cards.colourText: One moment, the mordants are wholly fixated upon a single goal. Then, upon a whim as faint as a dying breath, their mania switches entirely.
cards.rulesText: Surge: Score this immediately after an activation if your warband holds the objective with the same number as the current round (e.g. objective 1 in the first round).

cards.name: Appalling Visage
cards.colourText: That which the mordants see as handsome and noble, their foes perceive for the horror it truly is.
cards.rulesText: Choose one friendly fighter and one adjacent enemy fighter. Push the chosen enemy fighter up to 2 hexes away from the chosen friendly fighter.

cards.name: Combat Drill
cards.colourText: The advancing Grymwatch do so in a ghastly parody of military discipline.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After a friendly fighter's Move action made as part of a Charge action, choose another friendly fighter. The chosen fighter makes a Move action. The chosen fighter must end that Move action adjacent to the fighter making the Charge action.

cards.name: Double Time
cards.colourText: 'Grurrrr... grahr, sggrach!' - Duke Crakmarrow (Trans: Make haste, the hour is nigh!)
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Move action (but not during a superaction). That fighter makes another Move action.

cards.name: Horrifying Spectacle
cards.colourText: 'Oh... oh by Alarielle's... oh spirits... I'm going to be sick!' - Karthaen
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this during an Attack action

cards.name: Pack, Advance!
cards.colourText: 'Schreeeegh! Guh! Guh!' - Duke Crakmarrow (Trans: Forwards, my noble warriors!)
cards.rulesText: Choose one or more friendly Crypt Ghouls and push each of the chosen fighters up to 2 hexes.

cards.name: Recycled Riches
cards.colourText: One warrior's midden heap is another's overflowing armoury.
cards.rulesText: Take all the cards from your power discard pile that have the Grymwatch warband symbol. Shuffle them face down, then add the top card to your hand. Return the other cards to your power discard pile.

cards.name: Scrabbling Claws
cards.colourText: 'Oi! Gerroff my loot!' - Rippa Narkbad
cards.rulesText: Choose one enemy fighter that has one or more upgrades and is adjacent to one or more friendly fighters. The chosen fighter's player picks one of that fighter's upgrades and discards it.

cards.name: Shattering Impact
cards.colourText: So savage are the mordants, so mindless their ferocity, that they will gladly smash their own trophies to flinders in order to destroy those of their foes.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action, if that fighter has one or more upgrades. Pick one of their upgrades and one of their target's upgrades. Both cards are discarded.

cards.name: Stench of Victory
cards.colourText: Ghouls gather like carrion-corvids to rend flesh, split bone and feast upon the fallen.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this during a friendly fighter's successful Attack action, before the deal damage step. Choose another friendly fighter and push the chosen fighter up to 3 hexes so they are adjacent to the target.

cards.name: Strident Summons
cards.colourText: 'The creature's howl was monstrous, echoing along the twisted tunnels. Yet the cacophony of scrabbling motion and gasping breaths that answered was more terrible still.' - Althaen
cards.rulesText: A friendly Crakmarrow makes the Ghoul Call action.

cards.name: Aura of Command
cards.colourText: The duke's authority over his loyal men-at-arms is absolute, their obedience instant.
cards.rulesText: Action: Choose two other friendly fighters. You cannot choose fighters with any Move or Charge tokens. Each of the chosen fighters makes a Move action.

cards.name: Drawn to Weakness
cards.colourText: 'Slap something on that wound, runtling, quickly. Those things can scent blood on the air.' - Hrothgorn
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After an activation, push this fighter 1 hex towards an enemy fighter that has one or more wound tokens.

cards.name: Grip of Madness
cards.colourText: 'Grreeh! Brugh ruarghlrgh!' - Valreek the Tracker (Trans: Fie upon thee, foul fiends, I shall not be moved!)
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After this fighter's Move action, if this fighter is holding an objective, place a Madness counter on this card. While there are one or more Madness counters on this card, this fighter cannot be pushed. Remove all Madness counters from this card when this fighter makes a Move action.

cards.name: Heroic Vision
cards.colourText: Though in truth they are debased monsters, the mordants of the Flesh-eater Courts see themselves as brave and noble warriors.
cards.rulesText: +1 Dice to this fighter's Range 1 and Range 2 Attack actions

cards.name: Hunter's Nose
cards.colourText: 'Silence, all of you. Where in Khaine's name is that revolting snuffling coming from...?' - Morgwaeth the Bloodied
cards.rulesText: Each enemy fighter is a Quarry.

cards.name: Impervious Delusion
cards.colourText: Madness is its own sort of armour.
cards.rulesText: If this fighter would be dealt more than 2 damage by an Attack action or gambit, they are instead dealt 2 damage. This damage cannot be further modified.

cards.name: Right-hand Ghoul
cards.colourText: 'Wurghhhh glarghle scragh!' - Duke Crakmarrow (Trans: To me, brave Sir Gristlewel! To me!)
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After a friendly Crakmarrow's Move action, if this fighter has no Move or Charge tokens, this fighter makes a Move action. This fighter must end the Move action adjacent to a friendly Crakmarrow.

cards.name: Seized Weapon
cards.colourText: A new definition of 'disarmed'.
cards.rulesText: When you give this upgrade to a friendly fighter from your hand, one adjacent enemy fighter is dealt 1 damage.

cards.name: Severed Trophy
cards.colourText: The leg came free with an awful sound of parting flesh and gristle.
cards.rulesText: When this fighter's Attack action takes an adjacent enemy fighter out of action, gain 1 additional glory point.

cards.name: Well Motivated
cards.colourText: The scent of blood in the air drives the cannibalistic Ghouls into a slavering frenzy.
cards.rulesText: +1 Damage to this fighter's Range 1 and Range 2 Attack actions

cards.name: Annihilation
cards.colourText: When the enemy lie broken and bloodied to the last, then can the deep rumbling of Beastgrave be heard.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all enemy fighters are out of action.

cards.name: Conquest
cards.colourText: Stride forth boldly and seize that which belongs to your enemy.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if all surviving friendly fighters are in your opponent's territory.

cards.name: Coveted Spoils
cards.colourText: One is not enough, you must have them all!
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if all objectives are held.

cards.name: Denial
cards.colourText: Hold fast to what is yours, no matter the cost.
cards.rulesText: Score this in the third end phase if there are no enemy fighters in your territory.

cards.name: Dug In
cards.colourText: 'See... banner? Land... ours!' - Grashrak Fellhoof
cards.rulesText: Dual: Score this in an end phase

cards.name: Fateful Strike
cards.colourText: Ill fortune undoes even the mightiest armour.
cards.rulesText: Surge: Score this immediately after a friendly fighter's successful Attack action that targets a fighter with a Defence characteristic of 2 or more.

cards.name: Hold Objective 1
cards.colourText: Seize the howl-horn and let its mournful dirge echo through Beastgrave's heart.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband holds objective 1.

cards.name: Hold Objective 2
cards.colourText: Capture the amber-bone riches of Ghur.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband holds objective 2.

cards.name: Hold Objective 3
cards.colourText: The throne of tusks may be claimed by one who is worthy.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband holds objective 3.

cards.name: Hold Objective 4
cards.colourText: The worth of the gargant's blade is beyond imagination.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband holds objective 4.

cards.name: Hold Objective 5
cards.colourText: Dare you don the mask of the Silent People?
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband holds objective 5.

cards.name: Path to Victory
cards.colourText: Butcher the foe! Seize their lands! Teach them to fear you!
cards.rulesText: Dual: Score this in an end phase

cards.name: Scrum
cards.colourText: Battle is rarely an elegant affair.
cards.rulesText: Surge: Score this immediately after an activation if four or more fighters on the battlefield are in a single group in which each fighter is adjacent to at least one other fighter in that group.

cards.name: Supremacy
cards.colourText: Seize the heart of the mountain, chamber by twisted chamber.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if your warband holds three or more objectives.

cards.name: Swift Capture
cards.colourText: 'Grrrgh... ggrrreeeegh!' - Duke Crakmarrow (Trans: Sally forth, my brave and noble heroes! Sally forth!)
cards.rulesText: Surge, Dual: Score this immediately after an activation

cards.name: The Beast is Slain
cards.colourText: 'You're all just meat to me.' - Hrothgorn
cards.rulesText: Surge: Score this immediately after a friendly Hunter's Attack action that takes an enemy leader or enemy Quarry out of action.

cards.name: The Great Hunt
cards.colourText: 'Out they rode, that noble band, and far was their riding and many and magnificent were their hunters' blades.' - Extract from an ancient parchment, author unknown
cards.rulesText: Hybrid: Score this in an end phase

cards.name: To the End
cards.colourText: With every snare set, every tactic tried and nothing held back, you can know at least that you could have done nothing more.
cards.rulesText: Score this in an end phase if there are no cards left in your power deck.

cards.name: Cloaked in Shadow
cards.colourText: 'It was only when I saw the shadows move, when I perceived the barest suggestion of crawling limbs and a glinting eye fixed upon me, that I realised my peril.' - Althaen
cards.rulesText: Choose a fighter. Until the end of the next activation, that fighter is a Quarry, players cannot choose that fighter when a gambit is played, and that fighter cannot be dealt damage by gambits.

cards.name: Confusion
cards.colourText: The cursed caverns within Beastgrave can disorient even the most keen-minded explorer.
cards.rulesText: Choose two fighters that are adjacent to each other. Place each fighter in the hex that was occupied by the other fighter when you chose them.

cards.name: Desperate Flight
cards.colourText: When flushed from cover, the only option is a panicked retreat.
cards.rulesText: Choose one friendly fighter and Scatter 4 from that fighter's hex. Push that fighter 3 hexes along the chain. If a hex that fighter would be pushed into is blocked or occupied, do not push that fighter any further.

cards.name: Eldritch Haze
cards.colourText: A morbid fume surrounds the caster, choking any foe that dares approach.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If cast, the caster has +1 Defence. This spell persists until the end of the round or until that fighter is taken out of action.

cards.name: Exhaustion
cards.colourText: Sometimes, the only reward for making a superhuman effort is learning just how mortal you really are.
cards.rulesText: Play this only in a power step following your activation. At the end of the next activation, choose one enemy fighter that made two or more actions in that activation. The chosen fighter is dealt 1 damage.

cards.name: Fate's Decree
cards.colourText: 'Hah! You missed! You mis-' - last words of Oleg the Hunter
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this after an opponent makes a roll as instructed by a gambit or upgrade (but not during an Attack action), before the effect of the roll is resolved. The opponent must re-roll that roll.

cards.name: Frenzied Search
cards.colourText: 'Look sharp, lads, grab anyfing that glints before dey get back.' - Rippa Narkbad
cards.rulesText: Play this only if your warband holds one or more objectives. Discard one power card. If you do, draw up to three power cards.

cards.name: Madness Dart
cards.colourText: The venom of the bore-serpent transforms the meekest fighter into a reckless berzerker.
cards.rulesText: Choose one enemy fighter adjacent to one or more friendly fighters. The chosen fighter's Attack actions have the characteristic instead of their printed characteristic. This effect persists until the chosen fighter is taken out of action.

cards.name: Marked
cards.colourText: 'Nowhere have you left to run, nor any place to hide...' - Skaeth the Huntsman
cards.rulesText: Choose a fighter. They are a Quarry. This effect persists until that fighter is taken out of action.

cards.name: Mass Upheaval
cards.colourText: With shrieked incantations and Ghurish curses, the caves and tunnels themselves can be stirred to a writhesome churn.
cards.rulesText: Gambit Spell (): If cast, roll one magic dice for each feature token in the same player's territory as the caster. For each roll of , flip that token. If the caster is in no one's territory, this spell fails.

cards.name: Restless Prize
cards.colourText: 'Down here in the mountain-gut, everything crawls.' - Hrothgorn
cards.rulesText: Pick one objective token and move it into an adjacent hex up to two times. You cannot move it into a lethal hex or a hex that includes a feature token.

cards.name: Sidestep
cards.colourText: The key to survival is being where your predators least expect.
cards.rulesText: Choose a friendly fighter and push them one hex.

cards.name: Sitting Target
cards.colourText: When everyone about you is a predator waiting to pounce, staying in one place for too long is bad for the health.
cards.rulesText: The first Attack action made by a friendly fighter in the next activation has +1 Dice and Ensnare if the target has no Move or Charge tokens.

cards.name: Snare
cards.colourText: The key to killing is to attack where your prey least expects.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: Play this during a friendly Hunter's Attack action, after it drives back an enemy fighter. The enemy fighter is dealt 1 damage.

cards.name: Bloodthief
cards.colourText: A blade like the needle-maw of a life-drinker fly, and with as voracious an appetite, this weapon steals from its victims and gives back to its wielder.

cards.name: Caltrops
cards.colourText: An opponent cannot always be defeated, but they can always be made to pay for their actions.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: During a Range 1 Attack action, after this fighter is driven back, but before they are dealt damage by any lethal hexes, their attacker is dealt 1 damage.

cards.name: Great Fortitude
cards.colourText: The most fearsome creatures in Beastgrave are those who have adapted to survive in an environment of slaughter.
cards.rulesText: +1 Wounds

cards.name: Great Speed
cards.colourText: This warrior is as swift as a loosed arrow.
cards.rulesText: +1 Move

cards.name: Great Strength
cards.colourText: The bestial might of Ghur flows through this fighter's veins.
cards.rulesText: +1 Damage to this fighter's Range 1 and Range 2 Attack actions

cards.name: Hunter's Reflexes
cards.colourText: A true hunter moves with their prey, becoming first their shadow and then their death.
cards.rulesText: This fighter is a Hunter.

cards.name: Larval Lance
cards.colourText: Life pulses within this weapon, its true form pushing closer to the surface with every heartbeat. The gods alone know what will emerge at the moment of its quickening...

cards.name: Mazzig's Many Legs
cards.colourText: 'Ambulatorum multiplicitus! Oh... Oh now that is unsettling...' - Fecula Flyblown
cards.rulesText: Spell Action (): If cast, choose another friendly fighter within 2 hexes of the caster. Push the chosen fighter up to 2 hexes.

cards.name: Predatory Instinct
cards.colourText: Driven by primal urges, this fighter watches their enemies for the slightest sign of weakness.
cards.rulesText: This fighter is a Hunter. You can re-roll one dice in the attack rolls for this fighter's Attack actions that target a Quarry.

cards.name: Soothing Companion
cards.colourText: This strange symbiotic entity secretes healing spittle upon its host's wounds, in exchange for their protection.
cards.rulesText: Reaction: After this fighter's activation, unless this fighter made one or more Attack actions in that activation, Heal (1) this fighter.

cards.name: Stoneform
cards.colourText: Whispered tales warn that others can become as the Silent People became, returned to stone whence they came...
cards.rulesText: -1 Move (to a minimum of 0)

cards.name: Survival Instincts
cards.colourText: Sometimes the best armour is a keen sense for danger.
